original: yang dag @85b pa la yang dag pa nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang dag @85b pa la yang dag pa nyid du yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de yang de kho na nyid yin te /
translated: That which is real is the reality of the perfect knowledge of reality.

original: rtag tu gnyis bral 'khrul pa'i rten gang yin dang gang zhig rnam kun tu //üîΩbrjod par nus ma yin zhing spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid de kho na //
analyzed: rtag tu gnyis bral 'khrul pa'i rten gang yin dang gang zhig rnam kun tu // brjod par nus ma yin zhing spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid de kho na //
translated: That which is always free from duality, the basis of error, and that which is

original: zhes bshad ma thag pa yang yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad ma thag pa yang yin no //
translated: incapable of being expressed and has a nature free from fabrication is reality.üîΩThe three natures‚Äîthe imagined, the other-dependent, and the real‚Äîare

original: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum ni go rims bzhin du gnyis dang bral ba dang / 'khrul pa'i rten dang brjod du med cing spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum ni go rims bzhin du gnyis dang bral ba dang / 'khrul pa'i rten dang brjod du med cing spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid du bstan te /
translated: taught to be free from duality, the basis of error, and to have an inexpressible

original: 'di ni go rims bzhin du de dag gi de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni go rims bzhin du de dag gi de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: and unelaborated nature, respectively. This is the reality of those three, respectively.

original: 'di ni de kho na nyid de la rnam pa gang gi sgyu ma lta bu nyid yin pa de'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de kho na nyid de la rnam pa gang gi sgyu ma lta bu nyid yin pa de'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: This is reality. The illusion-like nature of that reality is considered in theüîΩfollowing verses.

original: gtsug lag gi mdo de dang de dag las kyang chos rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gtsug lag gi mdo de dang de dag las kyang chos rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: And in this and that scripture, it is said that things are like illusions.

original: de la 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan shing dang bong ba la sogs pa sgyu ma'i sngags kyis btab pa ji lta ba de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems dang
analyzed: de la 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan shing dang bong ba la sogs pa sgyu ma'i sngags kyis btab pa ji lta ba de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems dang
translated: The causes of error, such as sticks and clods, which are affected by the spells of a magician, should be understood as being the other-dependent pattern of reality, which is unreal imagination.

original: sems las byung ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams la rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnams la rig par bya ba ste /
translated: This is to be understood in terms of mind and mental factors, which are dependently arisen.

original: de dag ni shing dang bong ba la sogs pa sgyu ma'i sngags kyi btab pa lta bu yin par rig par bya la /
analyzed: de dag ni shing dang bong ba la sogs pa sgyu ma'i sngags kyi btab pa lta bu yin par rig par bya la /
translated: They are to be understood as being like sticks and clods affected by the spells of a magician.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni sgyu ma byas pa rta dang glang po che la sogs pa lta bu yin par rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni sgyu ma byas pa rta dang glang po che la sogs pa lta bu yin par rig par bya ba'o //
translated: And forms, etc., are to be understood as being like the horses, elephants, etc., created by the magician.

original: ji ltar de la de med pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de la de med pa ste /
translated: How is it that they do not exist in that?

original: sgyu ma byas pa de la glang po che la sogs pa med pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang de la kun btags pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid med pa don dam par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar thag pa la sbrul med par mthong ba de
analyzed: sgyu ma byas pa de la glang po che la sogs pa med pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang de la kun btags pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid med pa don dam par 'dod do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar thag pa la sbrul med par mthong ba de
translated: Just as one sees that the snake does not exist in the rope,

original: bzhin du gzhan gyi dang gi ngo bo nyid la gnyis su med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: bzhin du gzhan gyi dang gi ngo bo nyid la gnyis su med par mthong ngo //
translated: so one sees that the two do not exist in the nature of the relative.

original: gnyis dang bral ba nyid mthong bas gnyis su 'khrul pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis dang bral ba nyid mthong bas gnyis su 'khrul pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: By seeing the absence of duality, one is free from the error of duality.

original: gnyis su 'khrul ba dang bral ba'i rnam pa can gyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis su 'khrul ba dang bral ba'i rnam pa can gyis yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the aspect of freedom from the error of duality, one sees the nature of the perfected.

original: gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa dag 'jig rten pa phyin ci ma log pas gzhan gyi dbang de mthong ba de'i tshe yang gnyis su 'khrul pa de mi 'byung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa dag 'jig rten pa phyin ci ma log pas gzhan gyi dbang de mthong ba de'i tshe yang gnyis su 'khrul pa de mi 'byung ba kho na'o //
translated: When one sees the relative with the mundane, unmistaken, subsequent to the transcendent, then the error of duality does not occur.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma byas pa de glang po che la sogs pa'i ngo bor dmigs pa de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa las kun brtags pa de kun rdzob kyi bden par dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de ltar na de ni yang @86a * //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma byas pa de glang po che la sogs pa'i ngo bor dmigs pa de bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa las kun brtags pa de kun rdzob kyi bden par dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de ltar na de ni yang @86a * //
translated: Just as the creation of an illusion is perceived as the entity of an elephant, etc., so the imagination of what is unreal is perceived as conventional truth.

original: dag pa ma yin pa nyid du snang ba na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag pa ma yin pa nyid du snang ba na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when it appears as unreal, it is the objective support for the afflicted.

original: gang yang de dang de las bden pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gang yang de dang de las bden pa ni gnyis te /
translated: And, in this regard, it is said: ‚ÄúThere are two truths for the noble ones:üîΩthe truth of conventional usage and the truth of the ultimate. ‚Äù

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes 'byung ba de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na la de ltar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes 'byung ba de yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na la de ltar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is also established in terms of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de bzhin du gnas gzhan du gyur na gnyis su 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i don yang dag pa dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gnyis su 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs par
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas gzhan du gyur na gnyis su 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i don yang dag pa dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gnyis su 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs par
translated: This means that the nature of the perfected is perceived because there is no error of duality.

original: 'gyur ro // de mthong na phyin ci ma log pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes su thob pa'i ye shes kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gnyis dang bral ba mthong ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de mthong na phyin ci ma log pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes su thob pa'i ye shes kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gnyis dang bral ba mthong ste /
translated: When that is seen, the nature of the dependent is seen as free from the duality that is attained subsequently to the non-erroneous non-imagination.

original: de ltar na de'i don yang dag pa dmigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na de'i don yang dag pa dmigs par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, the real object is perceived.

original: gnyis su 'khrul pa dang bral bas kyang rnal 'byor ba'i gnas gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis su 'khrul pa dang bral bas kyang rnal 'byor ba'i gnas gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of being free from the error of duality, there is a change of state for the yogi.

original: de lta ba ni de la yod //
analyzed: de lta ba ni de la yod //
translated: That exists in that,

original: de yi dngos po yod ma yin //
analyzed: de yi dngos po yod ma yin //
translated: but its reality does not exist.

original: de ltas sgyu ma la sogs la //
analyzed: de ltas sgyu ma la sogs la //
translated: Therefore, in an illusion and so on,

original: yod dang med pa nyid du brjod //
analyzed: yod dang med pa nyid du brjod //
translated: existence and non-existence are expressed.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni don go bar zad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni don go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning of this verse is self-evident.

original: ji ltar don go zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar don go zhe na /
translated: How is the meaning understood?

original: ji ltar sgyu ma de la sgyu ma byas pa glang po che la sogs pa'i gzugs de'i ngo bor te /
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma de la sgyu ma byas pa glang po che la sogs pa'i gzugs de'i ngo bor te /
translated: Just as in the case of an illusion, the form of an elephant, etc. created by the illusion appears as the very form of an elephant, etc.

original: glang po che la sogs pa gzugs nyid du snang ba'i glang po che'i gzugs de ni glang po che nyid du yod pa ma yin pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa gzugs nyid du snang ba'i glang po che'i gzugs de ni glang po che nyid du yod pa ma yin pa kho na yin la /
translated: But the form of an elephant, etc. does not exist as an elephant.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i phyin ci log rnams ni glang po che la sems pa lta bu nyid du yod pas de lta bas na yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du brjod de /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i phyin ci log rnams ni glang po che la sems pa lta bu nyid du yod pas de lta bas na yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid du brjod de /
translated: The error of mind and mental factors exists as the very thought of an elephant, etc. Therefore, it is said to exist and not exist.

original: de lta bu nyid du yod pa la yang dag pa'i don du ni med do zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du yod pa la yang dag pa'i don du ni med do zhes bya ba de bzhin du /
translated: But it does not exist in reality as it appears.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa de la gnyis su 'khrul pa'i gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du snang ba de ni yod do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa de la gnyis su 'khrul pa'i gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa nyid du snang ba de ni yod do zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the appearance of the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject in the form, etc. of the error of the unreal imagination is said to exist.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma yongs su shes nas glang po che la sogs pa mi snang ba'i phyir glang po che la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob nas gnyis po mi snang ba'i phyir med do zhes bya'o
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma yongs su shes nas glang po che la sogs pa mi snang ba'i phyir glang po che la sogs pa med do zhes bya ba de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob nas gnyis po mi snang ba'i phyir med do zhes bya'o
translated: Just as, having understood an illusion, an elephant, etc. does not appear, and so one says that an elephant, etc. does not exist; in the same way, having attained non-discriminative awareness, the two do not appear, and so one says that they do not exist.

original: // de la yod pa med pa yin //
analyzed: // de la yod pa med pa yin //
translated: Therein, existence is non-existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i glang po che lta bu yod pa ni med par mi 'dod de //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i glang po che lta bu yod pa ni med par mi 'dod de //
translated: This means that the existence of an elephant, etc. like an illusory elephant is not held to be non-existence,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists as the imagination of what is unreal.

original: @86b med pa yod pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: @86b med pa yod pa nyid ma yin //
translated: Non-existence is not existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyis yang dag pa nyid du kun brtags pa'i glang po che la sogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par dpyad na yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyis yang dag pa nyid du kun brtags pa'i glang po che la sogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par dpyad na yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: This means that the non-existence of an elephant, etc. imagined as real by the naive is not existence when investigated in the ultimate.

original: 'o na ci zhe na med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na med pa yin no //
translated: But what is it? It is non-existence.

original: sgyu ma dag la sogs pa la //
analyzed: sgyu ma dag la sogs pa la //
translated: In illusions, etc.

original: yod med khyad par med pa'ang brjod //
analyzed: yod med khyad par med pa'ang brjod //
translated: The absence of the distinction between existence and non-existence is also stated.

original: ces bya ba ni de la de lta bu yod pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de la de lta bu yod pa ste /
translated: That which exists in that way

original: glang po che lta bu yod pa gang yin pa de nyid glang po che la sogs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po che lta bu yod pa gang yin pa de nyid glang po che la sogs pa med pa yin no //
translated: is the existence of an elephant, and that itself is the nonexistence of an elephant.

original: de la 'dra ba tsam dang 'khrul pa tsam yod kyi /
analyzed: de la 'dra ba tsam dang 'khrul pa tsam yod kyi /
translated: There is only a mere similarity and a mere error,

original: yang dag pa nyid du glang po che yod pa ni ma yin pas gang gi tshe de ltar shes pa de'i tshe glang po cher 'dzin pa ldog ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du glang po che yod pa ni ma yin pas gang gi tshe de ltar shes pa de'i tshe glang po cher 'dzin pa ldog ste /
translated: but an elephant does not exist in reality. Therefore, when one knows that, then the apprehension of an elephant is eliminated.

original: glang po che lta bu tsam du snang ba gang yin pa de nyid glang po che med pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po che lta bu tsam du snang ba gang yin pa de nyid glang po che med pa yin no //
translated: That which appears as a mere elephant is the nonexistence of an elephant.

original: de ltar na 'di mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, this is the same as the equality of existence and nonexistence.

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad du /
translated: As the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes teaches:

original: de yi phyir na dmigs pa dang // mi dmigs mnyam par shes par bya //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de yi phyir na dmigs pa dang // mi dmigs mnyam par shes par bya // zhes bshad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should know the equality of perception and nonperception.

original: rim pa 'dis na yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med par mthong ste /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis na yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med par mthong ste /
translated: In this way, one sees that existence and nonexistence are not different.

original: dper na gang gi tshe kho na nye bar len pa'i phung po lngar ma mthong ba de kho na'i tshe bdag yod par lta ba la /
analyzed: dper na gang gi tshe kho na nye bar len pa'i phung po lngar ma mthong ba de kho na'i tshe bdag yod par lta ba la /
translated: For example, just as when one does not see the five appropriated aggregates, one sees the existence of a self,

original: gang gi tshe kho na bdag med par mthong ba de'i tshe kho na phung po tsam du lta ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe kho na bdag med par mthong ba de'i tshe kho na phung po tsam du lta ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: and when one does not see a self, one sees the mere aggregates.

original: de ltas gzugs la sogs pa la //
analyzed: de ltas gzugs la sogs pa la //
translated: Therefore, form and so on

original: yod dang med pa nyid du brjod //
analyzed: yod dang med pa nyid du brjod //
translated: are said to exist and not exist.

original: ces bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid la kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa yod pa nyid du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid la kun rdzob tu gzugs la sogs pa yod pa nyid du brjod par bya ste /
translated: The nature of unreal imagination is said to exist conventionally as form and so on.

original: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad du /
translated: As Distinguishing the Middle from the Extremes says:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //üîΩde la gnyis po yod pa ma yin //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod // de la gnyis po yod pa ma yin //
translated: Unreal imagination exists.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /üîΩde la ni gnyis po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun rdzob tu yod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu ste / de la ni gnyis po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa kun rdzob tu yod kyi /
translated: The duality that appears there does not exist.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: There, the duality of apprehendeds and apprehenders exists conventionally but not ultimately.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal zhing spros pa thams cad dang bral bas byis pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa chos su gzung ba med pa mthong ba de'i tshe med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal zhing spros pa thams cad dang bral bas byis pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa chos su gzung ba med pa mthong ba de'i tshe med do zhes bya'o //
translated: When nonconceptual wisdom has removed the counteragents and is free from all conceptual elaborations, then the childish imagination of form, etc. as real entities is seen to be nonexistent.

original: med pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Nonexistence is not existence.

original: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par yod pa nyid ma yin @87a * //
analyzed: gnyis kyi dngos po med pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis kyi dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam par yod pa nyid ma yin @87a * //
translated: That which is the nonexistence of the duality is not the ultimate existence of the nonexistence of the duality.

original: no ; 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: no ; 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistence.

original: gnyis po snang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid gnyis kyi dngos por med pa yin pas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis po snang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid gnyis kyi dngos por med pa yin pas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: That which is the appearance of the duality is the nonexistence of the duality.

original: gnyis po snang ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis po snang ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: The appearance of the duality is not the reality of imagination.

original: gang gi tshe yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa ste /
translated: When there is the imagination of what is unreal,

original: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa gnyis dang bral zhing sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa de'i tshe 'di gnyis su 'dzin pa ldog cing /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la sogs pa gnyis dang bral zhing sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa de'i tshe 'di gnyis su 'dzin pa ldog cing /
translated: When one understands that the mind and mental factors are devoid of the duality of the eye and form, etc., and are not of the nature of the eye and form, etc., then the apprehension of duality is eliminated.

original: 'di la sems dang sems las byung bar snang ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la sems dang sems las byung bar snang ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: And, in this regard, the appearance of the mind and mental factors is eliminated.

original: de ltar na gnyis po snang ba gang yin pa de nyid gnyis kyis dngos po med pa yin pas yod pa dang med pa dag mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyis po snang ba gang yin pa de nyid gnyis kyis dngos po med pa yin pas yod pa dang med pa dag mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the non-existence of the duality that appears is the equality of existence and non-existence.

original: theg pa dman pas 'gro ba dgag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: theg pa dman pas 'gro ba dgag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to prevent the lower vehicle from being attained.

original: theg pa dman pas 'gro ba ni theg pa dman pas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa dman pas 'gro ba ni theg pa dman pas 'gro ba'o //
translated: The lower vehicle is the attainment of the lower vehicle.

original: theg pa dman pas 'gro ba de dgag pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa dag kyang khyad par med par bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: theg pa dman pas 'gro ba de dgag pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa dag kyang khyad par med par bsgom pa yin te /
translated: In order to prevent the lower vehicle from being attained, one meditates on the non-distinction of existence and non-existence.

original: yod pa dang med par khyad par med pa nyid du rig nas yod pas yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med par khyad par med pa nyid du rig nas yod pas yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Having understood the non-distinction of existence and non-existence, one does not become disgusted with existence.

original: ji ltar na sgro 'dogs pa bkag pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na sgro 'dogs pa bkag pa yin /
translated: How is superimposition refuted?

original: ji ltar na skur pa 'debs pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar na skur pa 'debs pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: How is it that he refutes nihilism?

original: ji ltar na yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med par bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar na yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med par bsgom pa yin te /
translated: How is it that he meditates on the non-differentiation of existence and non-existence?

original: de la yod pa med pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la yod pa med pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúnon-existence is existence‚Äù refers to the appearance of duality.

original: gnyis su snang ba yod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba yod pa gang yin pa de ni med pa ma yin no //
translated: The existence of the appearance of duality is not non-existence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: de ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: It is existence.

original: de ltar bzod pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par shes pa 'di nyid gnyis su snang bar rab tu 'byung gi / phyi rol gyi don ni med do zhes phyi rol gyi don rnam par rig pas sems tsam du rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par shes pa 'di nyid gnyis su snang bar rab tu 'byung gi / phyi rol gyi don ni med do zhes phyi rol gyi don rnam par rig pas sems tsam du rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, in the state of acquiescence, he realizes mind-only, by the cognition of external objects, that this consciousness itself appears as duality, but external objects do not exist.

original: de'i tshe yod pa la yod par rig nas skur pa 'debs par mi byed do //üîΩmed pa yod pa nyid ma yin //
analyzed: de'i tshe yod pa la yod par rig nas skur pa 'debs par mi byed do // med pa yod pa nyid ma yin //
translated: At that time, knowing that existence is existence, he does not deny.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa gnyis kyi dngos po med pa nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa gnyis kyi dngos po med pa nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNon-existence is not non-existence‚Äù refers to the non-existence of the two kinds of imagined entities.

original: med pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni yod pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Non-existence is not non-existence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: de ni rtag tu med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ni rtag tu med pa kho na yin te /
translated: It is always non-existent.

original: de ltar na med pa la med par rig nas sgro 'dogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na med pa la med par rig nas sgro 'dogs par mi byed do //
translated: Thus, having understood non-existence as non-existence, one does not superimpose.

original: ji ltar na de dag khyad par med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag khyad par med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they undifferentiated?

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi gnyis su snang ba gang yin @87b pa de nyid rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa yod pa nyid du kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis med pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi gnyis su snang ba gang yin @87b pa de nyid rnam par shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa yod pa nyid du kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis med pa yin la /
translated: The dependent nature‚Äôs appearance as duality is non-existent in the sense of being imagined to exist as external form, etc., apart from consciousness.

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis med pa gang yin pa de nyid rnam par rig pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis med pa gang yin pa de nyid rnam par rig pa tsam yin te /
translated: That which is non-existent as external form, etc., in the sense of being imagined is itself mere representation.

original: de ltar na mthong ba de ni byis pas kun brtags pa yod pa la mngon par zhen pa las yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na mthong ba de ni byis pas kun brtags pa yod pa la mngon par zhen pa las yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, that seeing does not cause the childish to turn away from their attachment to the existence of the imagined.

original: nyan thos ni gzugs la sogs pa la yod pa nyid du kun brtags nas /
analyzed: nyan thos ni gzugs la sogs pa la yod pa nyid du kun brtags nas /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas, having imagined form, etc., to exist,

original: 'di dag la skye ba dang 'jig pas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin par dmigs pa na 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid las yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag la skye ba dang 'jig pas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin par dmigs pa na 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid las yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one observes that these have the nature of suffering because they are produced and destroyed, one becomes disgusted with the reality of cyclic existence.üîΩWhen one becomes disgusted, one becomes free from attachment, and therefore one is liberated by the Sravakayana.

original: yid 'byung na 'dod chags dang bral bas de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par 'byung gi / byang chub sems dpa' ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul 'dis yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med par rig nas 'khor ba las yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur
analyzed: yid 'byung na 'dod chags dang bral bas de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par 'byung gi / byang chub sems dpa' ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul 'dis yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med par rig nas 'khor ba las yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur
translated: But the Bodhisattva, knowing that existence and nonexistence are not different in the manner explained, does not become disgusted with cyclic existence.

original: ro // yid mi 'byung na nyan thos mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba ltar byed pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ro // yid mi 'byung na nyan thos mgo dang gos la me 'bar ba ltar byed pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir nyan thos kyi theg pas nges par mi 'byung ngo //
translated: When one is not disgusted, one does not strive for nirvana, like one who is not burned by a blazing house and head. Therefore one is not liberated by the Sravakayana.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang 'khrul pa ni //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang 'khrul pa ni //
translated: The cause of error and error

original: zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyi rnam par rig pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis su 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyi rnam par rig pa 'di ni rnam pa gnyis su 'byung ste /
translated: This consciousness of the childish occurs in two aspects.

original: 'di lta ste 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang / 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang / 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Thus, the cause of error and error itself.

original: de la 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa yin par 'dod de /
translated: The cause of error is the representation of form.

original: gzugs zhes smos pas ni mig dang gzugs la sogs pa gzugs kyi phung po bsdu'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes smos pas ni mig dang gzugs la sogs pa gzugs kyi phung po bsdu'o //
translated: By the word ‚Äúform,‚Äù the aggregate of form, such as the eye and form, is included.

original: 'di lta ste byis pa rnams ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pas bdag med bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams bdag nyid du snang ngo //üîΩde ltar byis pas kun brtags pa mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i don dag med bzhin du thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i dbang gis byis pa rnams la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa mig dang gzugs la sogs pa nyid du snang
analyzed: 'di lta ste byis pa rnams ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pas bdag med bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams bdag nyid du snang ngo // de ltar byis pas kun brtags pa mig dang gzugs la sogs pa'i don dag med bzhin du thog ma med pa'i dus nas goms pa'i dbang gis byis pa rnams la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa mig dang gzugs la sogs pa nyid du snang
translated: Thus, the foolish, due to habituation from beginningless time, perceive the aggregates of form, etc., as a self, although there is no self.

original: ba gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa 'di ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ba gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa 'di ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus, the representation of form, which appears as the eye, form, etc., to the foolish, although the objects of the eye, form, etc., do not exist as imagined by the foolish, is the cause of error.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de ni 'di yin no zhes 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'jug pa gang yin pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i rnam par rig pa @88a * //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de ni 'di yin no zhes 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'jug pa gang yin pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i rnam par rig pa @88a * //
translated: The eye consciousness, etc., are the representations that are not form, since they are the operations that apprehend the form, etc., as being this or that.

original: 'di ni 'khrul pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khrul pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: This is the nature of error.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyur gyur cing gzhir gyur pa gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de med pa'i phyir cig shos mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par rig pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyur gyur cing gzhir gyur pa gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa de med pa'i phyir cig shos mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa rnam par rig pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the representation that appears as form, which is the cause and basis of error, does not exist, the other, the non-form representation, the eye consciousness, etc., also does not exist.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because there is no cause.

original: rgyu ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu ni ming dang gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: The cause is name-and-form, etc.

original: rgyu de med pa'i phyir 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par rig par mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de med pa'i phyir 'bras bur gyur pa'i rnam par rig par mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because that cause does not exist, the result, the representation, the eye consciousness, etc., also does not exist.

original: de la gnyis po ji lta bar med kyang gnyis su yang dmigs so zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i glang po che'i gzugs su 'khrul pa la yang dag pa nyid du glang po che la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: de la gnyis po ji lta bar med kyang gnyis su yang dmigs so zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma'i glang po che'i gzugs su 'khrul pa la yang dag pa nyid du glang po che la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med mod kyi /
translated: This is like the error of a magical elephant form, where although there is no elephant, etc., as an object apprehended or an apprehending subject,

original: 'on kyang byis pa ma rig pas ldongs pa rnams glang po che'i gzugs su 'khrul pa'i sgo nas 'di dag ni glang po che la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa ma rig pas ldongs pa rnams glang po che'i gzugs su 'khrul pa'i sgo nas 'di dag ni glang po che la sogs pa'o //
translated: still, because of being blinded by ignorance, the childish are attached to the two, thinking, ‚ÄúThese are elephants, etc.,

original: bdag ni 'di dag 'dzin pa'o zhes bya bar gnyis su mngon par zhen to //üîΩkeng rus kyi ni gzugs 'dzin pa //
analyzed: bdag ni 'di dag 'dzin pa'o zhes bya bar gnyis su mngon par zhen to // keng rus kyi ni gzugs 'dzin pa //
translated: and I am apprehending them.‚ÄùüîΩBecause of the error of apprehending a skeleton,

original: 'khrul phyir gnyis su brjod pa ste //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir gnyis su brjod pa ste //
translated: the two are said to exist.

original: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor can rus pa'i keng rus sgom par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi me long la keng rus kyi gzugs brnyan snang la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi gnas skabs las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor can rus pa'i keng rus sgom par byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi me long la keng rus kyi gzugs brnyan snang la /
translated: This is like the beginner yogis in the state of meditative concentration who cultivate the meditative concentration of a skeleton. The reflection of a skeleton appears in the mirror of meditative concentration.

original: keng rus kyi gzugs su 'khrul pa de las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su brjod do //
analyzed: keng rus kyi gzugs su 'khrul pa de las gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su brjod do //
translated: The error of a skeleton is said to be the duality of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de la ni yang dag pa nyid du na rus pa'i keng rus kyang med la de med na 'dzin pa yang med mod kyi /
analyzed: de la ni yang dag pa nyid du na rus pa'i keng rus kyang med la de med na 'dzin pa yang med mod kyi /
translated: In reality, there is no skeleton of bones, and if that does not exist, then the apprehending subject does not exist.

original: 'on kyang de bzhin du yang snang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang de bzhin du yang snang ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, it appears as if it does.

original: yod pa dang med pa de dag kyang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa de dag kyang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between existence and nonexistence.

original: yang yod pa yang yin la med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang yod pa yang yin la med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it exists and does not exist.

original: sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The characteristic of an illusion is like that.üîΩTherefore, it is like an illusion.

original: de lta bas na sgyu ma lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni de la glang po che'i gzugs yod pa gang yin pa de nyid glang po che nyid la sogs par med pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na sgyu ma lta bu yin no zhes bya ba ni de la glang po che'i gzugs yod pa gang yin pa de nyid glang po che nyid la sogs par med pa yin la /
translated: Whatever exists as the form of an elephant in that illusion does not exist as an elephant, etc.

original: glang po che nyid la sogs par med pa gang yin pa de nyid glang po che'i gzugs su yod pa yin no //
analyzed: glang po che nyid la sogs par med pa gang yin pa de nyid glang po che'i gzugs su yod pa yin no //
translated: Whatever does not exist as an elephant, etc. does exist as the form of an elephant.

original: de lta bas na sgyu ma la yod pa dang med pa nyid du khyad par med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na sgyu ma la yod pa dang med pa nyid du khyad par med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between existence and nonexistence in an illusion.

original: sgyu ma la yod pa nyid gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob du'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma la yod pa nyid gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob du'o //
translated: Whatever exists in the illusion is conventional.

original: med pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam par ro //
analyzed: med pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam par ro //
translated: Whatever does not exist there is ultimate.

original: sgyu ma la yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med par bshad pa ji lta bar @88b gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma la yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med par bshad pa ji lta bar @88b gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as the existence and nonexistence in the illusion are explained as undifferentiated, so it is with the phenomena of form, etc.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de bzhin nyid snang de la yod //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid snang de la yod //
translated: That reality appears there exists.

original: de yi dngos po yod ma yin //
analyzed: de yi dngos po yod ma yin //
translated: Its entity does not exist.

original: de ltas gzugs la sogs pa la //
analyzed: de ltas gzugs la sogs pa la //
translated: Therefore, in form, etc.

original: yod dang med pa nyid du brjod //üîΩces bshad pa lta bu yin no //üîΩyang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid de la rnam par shes pa'i gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa de ni de la yod la /
analyzed: yod dang med pa nyid du brjod // ces bshad pa lta bu yin no // yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid de la rnam par shes pa'i gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa de ni de la yod la /
translated: existence and nonexistence are declared.üîΩThe appearance of the duality of the consciousness in that imagination of what is unreal exists there.

original: rnam par shes pa snang ba gsal te yang dag pa nyid du gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyis gnyis kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni de la med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snang ba gsal te yang dag pa nyid du gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyis gnyis kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni de la med do //
translated: But the appearance of the consciousness, i.e., the entity of the duality of form, etc., as something real does not exist there.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa de la gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa de nyid gnyis med pa yin la gnyis med pa gang yin pa de nyid gnyis su snang ba yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa de la gnyis su snang ba gang yin pa de nyid gnyis med pa yin la gnyis med pa gang yin pa de nyid gnyis su snang ba yin te /
translated: That false imagination is non-dual, in that it is the appearance of duality, and it is dual, in that it is the non-duality of the appearance of duality.

original: de ltar na yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yod pa dang med pa dag khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, existence and non-existence are not distinguished.

original: de lta bas na chos 'di dag sgyu ma bzhin du yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos 'di dag sgyu ma bzhin du yod pa nyid dang med pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir sgyu ma lta bu brjod do //
translated: Therefore, these dharmas are like an illusion, in that they are both existent and non-existent. Thus, it is said that they are like an illusion.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'grub pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kun tu spyod pa dang ldan pa yin na kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams yang dang yang du 'grub par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'grub pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kun tu spyod pa dang ldan pa yin na kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams yang dang yang du 'grub par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because it controls the establishment of defilement, when the dharmas of defilement are in operation, the defilements are repeatedly established.

original: mig yor lta bu ni nang gi skye mched rnams kyi grib ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir phyi'i skye mched drug kho na ste /
analyzed: mig yor lta bu ni nang gi skye mched rnams kyi grib ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir phyi'i skye mched drug kho na ste /
translated: The reflection is the six external sense-fields alone, because they are like the reflection of the internal sense-fields.

original: de'i dbang gis 'byung bas so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gdugs la sogs pa'i dbang gis grib ma 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gi skye mched gdugs lta bu rnams kyi dbang gis phyi'i skye mched kyi grib ma lta bu rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'byung bas so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar gdugs la sogs pa'i dbang gis grib ma 'byung ba de bzhin du nang gi skye mched gdugs lta bu rnams kyi dbang gis phyi'i skye mched kyi grib ma lta bu rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as a shadow arises by the power of such things as an umbrella, so the external sense-spheres, which are like shadows, arise by the power of the internal sense-spheres, which are like umbrellas.üîΩThe Dharma teachings that are explained are like an echo.

original: brag ca lta bu ni bshad pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar brag ca yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: brag ca lta bu ni bshad pa'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar brag ca yod pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Just as an echo does not exist,

original: 'on kyang grag pa ltar bshad pa'i chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang grag pa ltar bshad pa'i chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: so it is with the Dharma teachings that are explained.

original: 'di dag la ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig 'jug pa yod pas yod pas ni 'di dag ni ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di dag la ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig 'jug pa yod pas yod pas ni 'di dag ni ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: These are associated with ignorance and the afflictions.

original: ma rig pa ni ma rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni ma rig pa nyid do //
translated: Ignorance is ignorance itself.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste drug gam bcu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste drug gam bcu'o //
translated: The afflictions are the six or ten afflictions beginning with attachment.

original: ma rig pa longs shig tu smos pa ni dbang byed pa'i don te /
analyzed: ma rig pa longs shig tu smos pa ni dbang byed pa'i don te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúarouse ignorance‚Äù means to exercise control.

original: ma rmongs pa la gzhan mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩnyon mongs pa smos pas ni khro ba dang kho na du 'dzin pa @89a * //
analyzed: ma rmongs pa la gzhan mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro // nyon mongs pa smos pas ni khro ba dang kho na du 'dzin pa @89a * //
translated: Because if there is no delusion, the others will not occur.

original: la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The mention of the afflictions should be understood to include the secondary afflictions such as anger and envy.üîΩThese conceptualizations of form, sound, etc., occur together with ignorance, the afflictions, and the secondary afflictions.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di dag la ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig 'jug pa yod pas na 'di dag ni ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa dang / lhan cig 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di dag la ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang lhan cig 'jug pa yod pas na 'di dag ni ma rig pa dang nyon mongs pa dang / lhan cig 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are said to occur together with ignorance and the afflictions.

original: rnam par rtog pa gang dang gang kun du 'byung ba na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags 'jog pa'i bag chags de nyid rnam par rtog pa de dang de'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang dang gang kun du 'byung ba na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags 'jog pa'i bag chags de nyid rnam par rtog pa de dang de'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever conceptualization occurs, it deposits a latent impression in the store consciousness. That very latent impression becomes the cause of that conceptualization.

original: de ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i shes pa gsum gyis /
analyzed: de ni sngar bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni thos pa la sogs pa'i shes pa gsum gyis /

original: rang gi dbyings ni rnam par mi rtog pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par byang ba'i skabs kyis 'ongs pa yin pas rang gi dbyings ni rnam par byang ba tshul bzhin rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings yin te
analyzed: rang gi dbyings ni rnam par mi rtog pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par byang ba'i skabs kyis 'ongs pa yin pas rang gi dbyings ni rnam par byang ba tshul bzhin rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings yin te

analyzed: / 'di ni de bzhin nyid kyi rnam grangs kyi ming yin no //

original: de bzhin nyid kyi phyir dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang / chos mngon par kun las btus pa la sogs pa las chos kyi dbyings kyi nges pa'i tshig nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dbyings zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi phyir dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa dang / chos mngon par kun las btus pa la sogs pa las chos kyi dbyings kyi nges pa'i tshig nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rgyu mtshan nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dbyings zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //

original: ming la sems gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ming la sems gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /

original: ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste /
analyzed: ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste /

original: de la spyi'i rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ming la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la spyi'i rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ming la gnas pa yin no //

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ya shes rnyed nas ming la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ya shes rnyed nas ming la gnas par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: zhi gnas bsgom pa chu lta bus ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog bdag gis khengs par byas pa'i sems de gnyen por 'gyur ro //

original: lhag mthong pa sgom pa me long lta bus ni las dang po pa'i gnas skabs na lta ba ngan pa la sogs pas yon por gyur pa'i shes rab mda' yon po lta bu gang yin pa de mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na lhag mthong goms @89b bas
analyzed: lhag mthong pa sgom pa me long lta bus ni las dang po pa'i gnas skabs na lta ba ngan pa la sogs pas yon por gyur pa'i shes rab mda' yon po lta bu gang yin pa de mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs na lhag mthong goms @89b bas
translated: The cultivation of vipa≈õyanƒÅ, which is like a mirror, straightens the crooked wisdom that is in the state of a beginner, which is like a crooked arrow, with the vipa≈õyanƒÅ of the state of equipoise.

original: mda' mes bsros pa bzhin du drang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mda' mes bsros pa bzhin du drang por 'gyur ro //

original: de'i phyir sems dang shes rab 'dod chags dang ma rig pa'i nyon mongs pa dag dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams las rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing /

translated: Therefore, the mind and wisdom are liberated from the afflictions of attachment and ignorance and from incorrect thoughts.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa la khengs pa dang yon po nyid du byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag nyid kyang gnyis su snang bar mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa la khengs pa dang yon po nyid du byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag nyid kyang gnyis su snang bar mi 'jug go //

original: rnam par rig pa tsam yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba la /

original: tsam zhes smos pa ni don dgag pa'i ched yin no //
analyzed: tsam zhes smos pa ni don dgag pa'i ched yin no //

original: sems 'ba' zhig gzung ba ni ma yin te /

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: sems la 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sems la 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'dod pa yang ma yin no //

original: rnam pa sna tshogs can du 'jug go zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyis sems las byung ba dag yod kyi de dag sel ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes te /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs can du 'jug go zhes bya ba ni 'di nyid kyis sems las byung ba dag yod kyi de dag sel ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit engages in various aspects‚Äù indicates that mental factors exist, and not that they are eliminated.

analyzed: sems las byung ba dag yod na de dag gi rnam par skye bas rnam pa sna tshogs nyid srid kyi med par ni ma yin no //
translated: If mental factors exist, it is possible that various aspects arise from them, but not if they do not exist.

analyzed: gal te sems kho na rnam grangs kyis skye bas na sems las byung ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: sems las byung ba bdag med par gang zhig cig car sna tshogs kyi rnam pa nyid du 'gyur ro //

original: de lta bas na sems las byung ba dag ni yod do //

analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa gzhan gzung ba dang 'dzin par gyur pa'i chos dag med pas na med pa'o //

original: gang dag sems las byung ba yod par mi 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na ni tshigs su bcad pa dag gis don go bar zad do //
analyzed: gang dag sems las byung ba yod par mi 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na ni tshigs su bcad pa dag gis don go bar zad do //
translated: For those who do not assert mental factors, the meaning of the verses is understood.

analyzed: mtshan gzhi ni mtshon par bya ba yin pas na mtshan gzhi'o //

original: mtshan nyid ni ngo bo nyid gsum mo //

analyzed: de bas na mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid 'di ni las lta bu yin la /

original: mtshon pa ni byed pa po lta bu yin te /

analyzed: 'di ltar des mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid de mtshon par byed do zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //

original: sems ni ltar bcas gang yin dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems ni ltar bcas gang yin dang // zhes bya ba la /

original: sems zhes smos pas ni gnyis su snang ba'i sems gzung bar snang ba dang /'dzin par snang ba gzung ba ste /
analyzed: sems zhes smos pas ni gnyis su snang ba'i sems gzung bar snang ba dang /'dzin par snang ba gzung ba ste /
translated: By saying ‚Äúmind,‚Äù the mind that appears as duality‚Äîthe appearance of the apprehended and the appearance of the apprehender‚Äîis included.

original: de la sems ni rnam par shes pa dang gzugs sogs zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: de la sems ni rnam par shes pa dang gzugs sogs zhes bya bas so //
translated: Mind is called consciousness and form, etc.

original: lta ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i phyir thams cad lta ba yin par tha snyad gdags @90b so ;
analyzed: lta ba ni sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i phyir thams cad lta ba yin par tha snyad gdags @90b so ;
translated: View is called the mental factors, because all are conventionally designated as views, since they are clear.

original: / de'i rnam par rig pa rtag tu de bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa la 'gyur ba med pas rtag pa'o //

translated: Because the representations of that always operate in that way, means that the representations of space, etc. are permanent, because they are without change.

original: bag chags de las kyang zhes bya ba ni bag chags la gnas pa'o phyir brjod pa de las kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bag chags de las kyang zhes bya ba ni bag chags la gnas pa'o phyir brjod pa de las kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And from that habitual tendency means that it is based on the habitual tendency, and the expression from that means from that.

original: tha snyad la mi mkhas pa rnams la don du snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad la mi mkhas pa rnams la don du snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the appearance of an object to those who are unskilled in conventional expressions.

original: zhes bya ba ni pa chung ngu rnams la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pa chung ngu rnams la'o //
translated: It is to those of little understanding.

original: brjod pa'i don gyi 'du shes med par zhes bya ba ni byis pa chung ngu la sogs pa la bum pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni brjod par bya ba'i don lto yangs pa dang / mgrin pa phra ba gang yin pa brjod do zhes bya bar bye brag tu rtogs pa de med de /

analyzed: brjod pa'i don gyi 'du shes med bzhin du ci zhig tu rnam par rtog par byed do //

analyzed: rgyu mtshan des 'du shes de 'jug go //
translated: because that discrimination is engaged by those reasons.

original: de ltar na tha snyad la mkhas pa'am tha snyad la mi mkhas pas brtag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa don gang yin pa dang rgyu la sogs pa don gang yin pa dang rgyu gang las yin pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags gang las yin
analyzed: de ltar na tha snyad la mkhas pa'am tha snyad la mi mkhas pas brtag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa don gang yin pa dang rgyu la sogs pa don gang yin pa dang rgyu gang las yin pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags gang las yin
translated: Thus, the object of a pot, etc., which is to be investigated by one who is skilled in conventions or unskilled in conventions, and the object of a cause, etc., and the cause from which it is, i.e., the latent impressions from which it is,

analyzed: pas te / de dag ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin bar rig par bya'o // gal te ming ji lta bar don du snang ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang zhig don ming gi ngo bo nyid kho na yin pa'am /

analyzed: gang dag ming dang / don dag glo bur pa nyid yin pa bsam nas don ming gi rang bzhin yin pa'am /
translated: Those who think that names and referents are adventitious will think that referents are the nature of names or that names are the nature of referents.üîΩ

original: ming don gyi rang bzhin yin par rtog par byed na /
analyzed: ming don gyi rang bzhin yin par rtog par byed na /
translated: Those who think that names and referents are adventitious imagine that referents are the nature of names or that names are the nature of referents.

original: de yang kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de yang kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is also the imagined characteristic.

original: gnas su snang ba zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs par snang ba ste /
analyzed: gnas su snang ba zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs par snang ba ste /
translated: The appearance as the basis is the appearance as earth, etc.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas kyi rnam par rig pa la der snang ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas kyi rnam par rig pa la der snang ba nyid du ston to //
translated: It shows that the appearance as that is the appearance of the store consciousness as the basis.

original: don du snang ba zhes bya ba ni @91a * //
analyzed: don du snang ba zhes bya ba ni @91a * //
translated: The appearance as referents is

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams so //
translated: forms, etc., the objects.

original: lus su snang ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: lus su snang ba ni mig la sogs pa dbang po rnams so //
translated: The appearance as the body is the sense organs such as the eyes, etc.üîΩSince existence and nonexistence are not different, there is also the equality of existence and nonexistence.

original: yod pa dang med pa de dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa mnyam pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid yin pas ji skad du sangs rgyas nyid la 'jug pa'i thabs kyi skabs nas /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa de dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa mnyam pa nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid yin pas ji skad du sangs rgyas nyid la 'jug pa'i thabs kyi skabs nas /
translated: Since suchness is buddhahood, as it says in the context of the means of entry into buddhahood,

original: med pa gang yin de nyid ni //
analyzed: med pa gang yin de nyid ni //
translated: Whatever does not exist is just suchness.

original: yod pa yi ni dam pa yin //
analyzed: yod pa yi ni dam pa yin //
translated: It is the supreme existence.

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /üîΩkun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis po med pa gang yin pa de nyid de bzhin nyid yod pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu ste / kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis po med pa gang yin pa de nyid de bzhin nyid yod pa yin la /
translated: As it is explained.üîΩThe non-existence of the two characteristics of the imagined is reality.

original: de bzhin nyid yod pa gang yin pa de nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid yod pa gang yin pa de nyid kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med pa yin no //
translated: The existence of reality is the non-existence of the characteristics of the imagined.

original: rnal 'byor gyi sa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi sa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel ba'i lam ste /
translated: The stage of yoga is the path of the union of serenity and insight.

original: de yang rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: It is also fivefold.

original: me long lta bu ni sems kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: me long lta bu ni sems kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The mirror-like stage is the samadhi of the sphere of mind.

original: gong du ming la gnas par bshad pa gang yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba gong du ji skad bshad ce na /
analyzed: gong du ming la gnas par bshad pa gang yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba gong du ji skad bshad ce na /
translated: It is the very thing explained above as abiding in name.

original: sems ming la gnas pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas de rnyed par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems ming la gnas pa'i phyir bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pas de rnyed par rig par bya ste /
translated: As it was explained above, it should be understood that it is attained through the knowledge that arises from meditation because the mind abides in name.

original: gnyis mi dmigs pa rnyed pa las ji skad bshad pa lta bur gnyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis mi dmigs pa rnyed pa las ji skad bshad pa lta bur gnyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of duality, as explained in the attainment of the non-apprehension of duality.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because the objective support and the subject are not perceived.

original: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs yin no //
translated: This is the situation of the path of seeing.

original: rten ni gnas gzhan du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni med na med pa yin pa'i phyir rten smos kyi /
analyzed: rten ni gnas gzhan du gyur pa'o zhes bya ba ni med na med pa yin pa'i phyir rten smos kyi /
translated: The basis is the transformation of the support, because the support is mentioned in order to show that it is absent when that is absent.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las ni rten smos pa med de /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las ni rten smos pa med de /
translated: But it is not mentioned in the verse.

original: rnal 'byor gyi sa thob pa 'dis na mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi sa thob pa 'dis na mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: This attainment of the stage of yoga is the equality of the stages, etc.

original: rnal 'byor gyi sa des mtshan gzhi lnga dang mtshan nyid de mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi sa des mtshan gzhi lnga dang mtshan nyid de mtshon par byed do //
translated: That stage of yoga is characterized by five topics and is characterized by the following five topics.

original: mtshan gzhi de gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi de gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five topics?

original: gzugs dang / sems dang / sems las byung ba dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed dag dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba rnam pa lngas bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sems dang / sems las byung ba dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed dag dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba rnam pa lngas bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: They are the five topics that were explained: form, mind, the mental concomitants, the factors that are not associated with mind, and the unconditioned.

original: mtshan nyid ni kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang du yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: The characteristic is the imagined, the relative, and the perfect.

original: mtshon bya ni rnam pa lnga yin pas gzhi dang skyed pa dang me long lta bu dang snang ba @91b dang rten gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa lam rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshon bya ni rnam pa lnga yin pas gzhi dang skyed pa dang me long lta bu dang snang ba @91b dang rten gyi bye brag gis tha dad pa lam rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: The object characterized is fivefold, and should be understood as the nature of the five paths, distinguished by the differences of basis, origin, mirror, light, and support.

original: tshogs dang sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mthar thug pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: tshogs dang sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mthar thug pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The five paths are the path of accumulation, application, vision, cultivation, and the ultimate path.

original: mtshon pa shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid des mtshon gzhi dang mtshan nyid de mtshon par byed de /
analyzed: mtshon pa shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid des mtshon gzhi dang mtshan nyid de mtshon par byed de /
translated: The wisdom which is the instrument of characterization characterizes the basis of characterization and the characteristic.

original: thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis yang dag par shes par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis yang dag par shes par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the correct knowledge by means of the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation, etc.

original: mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings na zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings na dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings na zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings na dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir 'gyur ro //
translated: The transformation into sameness is in the uncontaminated realm. In the uncontaminated realm, there is the attainment of the wisdom that is the sameness of the same object and subject of cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su //
translated: Therefore, immediately after that, it is said:

original: 'phags rigs shin tu dri med pa //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags rigs shin tu dri med pa // zhes bshad do //
translated: The stainless lineage of the noble ones.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor gyi sa rnam pa lnga po 'di zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o //üîΩsa bon gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor gyi sa rnam pa lnga po 'di zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur ba la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o // sa bon gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir //
translated: Thus, these five aspects of the stage of yoga are accompanied by the transformation into sameness and so forth.üîΩThe appearance of the abode, meaning, and body

original: gnas don lus su snang ba dag / gzhan du gyur pa zag med dbyings //
analyzed: gnas don lus su snang ba dag / gzhan du gyur pa zag med dbyings //
translated: is the transformation into the uncontaminated realm.

original: de ni rten kun 'gro ba can //
analyzed: de ni rten kun 'gro ba can //
translated: That is the basis, possessing universal movement.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa 'di las dbyings zhes bya ba'i sgra rkang pa gsum pa'i dang po nas 'byung ba dang zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra rkang pa gnyis pa nas 'byung ba dang lhan cig sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa 'di las dbyings zhes bya ba'i sgra rkang pa gsum pa'i dang po nas 'byung ba dang zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra rkang pa gnyis pa nas 'byung ba dang lhan cig sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Here, the term element in this verse should be connected with the first of the third line, and the term uncontaminated with the second of the third line.

original: ji skad du /üîΩgzhan du gyur pa zag med dbyings //
analyzed: ji skad du / gzhan du gyur pa zag med dbyings //
translated: As it is said:

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: The transformation is the uncontaminated element.

original: gnas dang don dang lus su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas dang don dang lus su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa rnams gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The consciousnesses that appear as the abode, objects, and bodies are called transformations.

original: gnas ni rten yin pas gnas smos pas yul du gyur pa la sogs pa bzung ste /
analyzed: gnas ni rten yin pas gnas smos pas yul du gyur pa la sogs pa bzung ste /
translated: The abode is the support, so by mentioning the abode, the objects and so on are included.

original: de dag gzhan las gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gzhan las gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means they are transformed from others.

original: gzugs la sogs pa don gyi rnam par rig pa dang mig la sogs pa lus kyi rnam par rig pa gzhan du gyur pa ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa don gyi rnam par rig pa dang mig la sogs pa lus kyi rnam par rig pa gzhan du gyur pa ni zag pa med pa'i dbyings yin no //
translated: The transformation of the consciousnesses of form and so on, the objects, and of the eyes and so on, the bodies, is the uncontaminated element.

original: yid dang 'dzin dang rnam par rtog / gyur phyir zhes bya ba ni dbang rnam pa bzhi 'thob po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yid dang 'dzin dang rnam par rtog / gyur phyir zhes bya ba ni dbang rnam pa bzhi 'thob po zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because of the transformation of mind, apprehending, and conceptualization, one obtains mastery.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gzhan du gyur na rnam par mi rtog pa gang la dbang 'thob ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gzhan du gyur na rnam par mi rtog pa gang la dbang 'thob ste /
translated: When the other afflicted mind is transformed, one obtains mastery over nonconceptuality.

original: 'di ltar gong du /
analyzed: 'di ltar gong du /
translated: As explained above:

original: yid ni gzhan du gyur pa na //üîΩ'byor dang mthun spyod mi rtog pa'i //
analyzed: yid ni gzhan du gyur pa na // 'byor dang mthun spyod mi rtog pa'i //
translated: When the mind is transformed,üîΩone obtains the highest masteryüîΩover the immaculate, nonconceptual

original: @92a * // ye shes shin tu dri med la //
analyzed: @92a * // ye shes shin tu dri med la //
translated: gnosis that is in harmony with the perfections.

original: 'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: When apprehending is transformed, one obtains mastery over the field.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //üîΩ'dzin pa gzhan du gyur na zhing la dbang 'byor pa thob ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no // 'dzin pa gzhan du gyur na zhing la dbang 'byor pa thob ste /
translated: As is explained:üîΩWhen apprehending and its object are transformed,

original: don bcas 'dzin pa gzhan gyur na //üîΩji ltar 'dod bzhin longs spyod dag /
analyzed: don bcas 'dzin pa gzhan gyur na // ji ltar 'dod bzhin longs spyod dag /
translated: one obtains the highest masteryüîΩover the pure fields

original: bstan phyir zhing ni dag pa la //üîΩ'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan phyir zhing ni dag pa la // 'byor pa dam pa thob par 'gyur // zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: in order to display enjoyments as one wishes.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization refers to the mental consciousness.

original: de bzhin du gyur pa ye shes dang las la dbang ba nyid 'thob ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gyur pa ye shes dang las la dbang ba nyid 'thob ste /
translated: Likewise, one obtains mastery over intuition and action.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rnam rtog gzhan du gyur na ni //üîΩdus rnams rtag tu ye shes dang // las rnams kun la thogs med la //
analyzed: rnam rtog gzhan du gyur na ni // dus rnams rtag tu ye shes dang // las rnams kun la thogs med la //
translated: When discursive thought is transformed,

original: 'byor pa dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byor pa dam pa 'thob par 'gyur //
translated: one always obtains the highest mastery

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: over all intuitions and actions.

original: bdag med pa rnams gnyis po de yang mnyam par shes nas bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag med pa rnams gnyis po de yang mnyam par shes nas bya ba la /
translated: One should understand that the two kinds of selflessness are the same in their reality, and then practice.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra ni kun brtags pa'i gang zag la sogs pa la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i sgra ni kun brtags pa'i gang zag la sogs pa la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúself‚Äù should be understood to refer to the imagined person and so on.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la yang blta bar bya ste /üîΩme ni tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la yang blta bar bya ste / me ni tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba /
translated: It should also be understood to refer to the reality of things.üîΩFor example, ‚Äúfire‚Äù is the reality of heat.

original: tsha ba'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tsha ba'i bdag nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the nature of heat.

original: de ni ji ltar kun brtags pa'i gang zag bdag med pa ltar kun brtags pa'i chos bdag med par shes te /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar kun brtags pa'i gang zag bdag med pa ltar kun brtags pa'i chos bdag med par shes te /
translated: One should understand that the reality of things is selfless just as the imagined person is selfless.

original: de ltar na bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis shes so //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis shes so //
translated: Thus one understands the two kinds of selflessness.

original: 'di ni 'dzin pa tsam mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dzin pa tsam mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is mere apprehension.

original: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don gsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don gsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúmere‚Äù clarifies the meaning,

original: phyi rol gyi don dang bral ba 'dzin pa tsam sems dang / sems las byung ba tsam mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don dang bral ba 'dzin pa tsam sems dang / sems las byung ba tsam mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it means that the mind and mental factors are mere apprehension, free from external objects.

original: de kho na nyid rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rnam par rig pa tsam de kho na nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de kho na nyid rnam par rig pa tsam zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rnam par rig pa tsam de kho na nyid yin zhe na /
translated: The reality of mere representation. How is mere representation reality?

original: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la zhugs na bzod pa'i gnas skabs na gzung ba'i don mi dmigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid la zhugs na bzod pa'i gnas skabs na gzung ba'i don mi dmigs par 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, when one enters into mere representation, at the stage of acquiescence in conformity with reality, the objective referent as the perceived object is not perceived.

original: de yang de kho na'i don gyi phyogs gcig la zhugs pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin pas de kho na nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de kho na'i don gyi phyogs gcig la zhugs pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin pas de kho na nyid ces bya'o //
translated: And since that is a concentration endowed with the entry into one aspect of the reality of that, it is called reality.

original: sngon gyi tshogs kyi stobs kyis so zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan dag la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrubs pa gang dag yod pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi tshogs kyi stobs kyis so zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan dag la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrubs pa gang dag yod pa yin pa'o //
translated: By the power of previous collections. The power of previous collections refers to the collections of merit and direct intuition which were correctly achieved in other lives.

original: @92b ming tsam du mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa tsam du ste zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa ni yid kyi brjod pa tsam zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: @92b ming tsam du mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa tsam du ste zhes bya ba ni mngon par brjod pa ni yid kyi brjod pa tsam zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: ‚ÄúVerbal expressions‚Äù means mere mental expressions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su don dang bral bar ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su don dang bral bar ro zhes bshad do //
translated: That is why it is said immediately after that ‚Äúone sees as devoid of referent objects.‚Äù

original: don med na ni de'i rnam par rig pa mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i don med na 'dzin pa yang mi mthong bas so //
analyzed: don med na ni de'i rnam par rig pa mi mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzung ba'i don med na 'dzin pa yang mi mthong bas so //
translated: If there are no referent objects, then the consciousness of them is not seen, because if there are no referent objects, the subject is not seen.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i zhags pas zin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta bas bcings pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i zhags pas zin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag tu lta bas bcings pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúSeized by the noose of the view of self‚Äù means ‚Äúbound by the view of self.‚Äù

original: bdag tu lta ba'i 'ching pa de ni gnas ngan len yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i 'ching pa de ni gnas ngan len yin te /
translated: This bondage of the view of self is a negative reflex.

original: len ces bya ba'i skad kyi dbyings 'di ni len par byed pa'i don las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: len ces bya ba'i skad kyi dbyings 'di ni len par byed pa'i don las 'byung ngo //
translated: The verbal root ‚Äúgraha‚Äù means to take up.

original: sems de ni ji lta ji ltar phyin ci log tu gyur nas bdag tu lta ba len pa de lta de ltar 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na sdug bsngal mang po la brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems de ni ji lta ji ltar phyin ci log tu gyur nas bdag tu lta ba len pa de lta de ltar 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba na sdug bsngal mang po la brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: The more the mind is perverted and takes on the view of self, the more it is bound to the many sufferings of the five transmigrations.

original: de ltar na ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum po 'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po la 'di dang sbyar bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum po 'di ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po la 'di dang sbyar bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, this threefold lack of own-being should be understood as corresponding to the three characteristics of the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ni gsum ste /
translated: The characteristics of the conditioned are three:

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: arising, passing away and remaining as something different.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po 'di ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum po 'di ni /
translated: These three characteristics of the conditioned

translated: The arising and ceasing of formations is unbearable, like being burned by a fire, like being touched by a red-hot iron ball, and is not at all peaceful.
