original: thog ma ni 'khor ba la ste de la thog ma skye ba med do zhes bya ba ni gang dag 'khor ba thog ma dang ldan par rtog par byed pa'i 'khor ba'i thog ma kun brtags pa de la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa ste

translated: Because they accept that previously arisen phenomena do not arise in the nature of that, they are called ‚Äúthose who obtain acceptance.‚ÄùüîΩAlso, those that arise later in the future do not arise as previously non-existent.

analyzed: ngo bo nyid sgrub pas so //

original: shes rab kyis byang chub kyi sems yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing dran pas bshad ma thag pa'i rigs yang dag par rjes su dran zhing ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyis byang chub kyi sems yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing dran pas bshad ma thag pa'i rigs yang dag par rjes su dran zhing ngo //
translated: By wisdom, he sees and recollects the thought of enlightenment. By mindfulness, he recollects the lineage just explained.

original: ji ltar byang chub pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the realization of the reality of the transcendences.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mjug thogs su //
translated: Therefore, immediately after that, he says,

original: ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: How is it that he has become a perfect buddha?

original: mthu rnam pa bzhi yang dag par mthong nas dga' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthu rnam pa bzhi yang dag par mthong nas dga' ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having seen the four kinds of power, he is filled with joy.

original: mthu ni mthu stobs so //
analyzed: mthu ni mthu stobs so //
translated: Power is strength.

original: mthu stobs med par sems can gyi don bya ba mi 'grub pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs pa la mos nas mthu stobs dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa yongs su tshol te /
analyzed: mthu stobs med par sems can gyi don bya ba mi 'grub pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs de kho na nyid kyi don rtogs pa la mos nas mthu stobs dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa yongs su tshol te /
translated: Since the benefit of beings cannot be accomplished without strength, he seeks the mental attention endowed with power, having confidence in the realization of the reality of the means of nonaddictedness.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la sogs pa mthu yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la sogs pa mthu yid la byed pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four kinds of attention to power are: attention to the power of the cause, attention to the power of the root, attention to the power of reliance, and attention to the power of the antidote.üîΩThe power of the cause is the power of the seed. The power of the root is the power of the root of the wholesome. The power of reliance is the power of the field. The power of the antidote is the power of the abandonment of adverse elements.

original: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa ni dbang phyug go //üîΩtshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ni bde 'gro'o //üîΩbzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ni 'khor to //üîΩbrtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ni las kyi mtha' grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'byin pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnam par smin pa ni dbang phyug go // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ni bde 'gro'o // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ni 'khor to // brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ni las kyi mtha' grub pa nyid do //
translated: The power of the cause is the power of the seed. The power of the root is the power of the root of the wholesome. The power of reliance is the power of the field. The power of the antidote is the power of the abandonment of adverse elements.üîΩThe power of the cause is the power of the seed. The power of the root is the power of the root of the wholesome. The power of reliance is the power of the field. The power of the antidote is the power of the abandonment of adverse elements.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ni gnod pa chung ngu nyid do //üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ni gnod pa chung ngu nyid do // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ni rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The power of the cause is the power of the seed. The power of the root is the power of the root of the wholesome. The power of reliance is the power of the field. The power of the antidote is the power of the abandonment of adverse elements.üîΩThe power of the cause is the power of the seed. The power of the root is the power of the root of the wholesome. The power of reliance is the power of the field. The power of the antidote is the power of the abandonment of adverse elements.üîΩThe power of the cause is the power of the seed. The power of the root is the power of the root of the wholesome. The power of reliance is the power of the field. The power of the antidote is the power of the abandonment of adverse elements.üîΩThe power of the cause is the power of the seed. The power of the root is the power of the root of the wholesome. The power of reliance is the power of the field. The power of the antidote is the power of the abandonment of adverse elements.üîΩThe power of the cause is the power of the seed. The power of the root is the power of the root of the wholesome. The power of reliance is the power of the field. The power of the antidote is the power of the abandonment of adverse elements.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gong nas gong du bya ba kun tu spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gong nas gong du bya ba kun tu spyod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The power of the cause is the power of the seed. The power of the root is the power of the root of the wholesome. The power of reliance is the power of the field.

original: sems can dang rang gi sangs rgyas @96b kyi chos yongs su smin pa las brtsams te zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin pa las brtsams pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: sems can dang rang gi sangs rgyas @96b kyi chos yongs su smin pa las brtsams te zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin pa las brtsams pa dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa las brtsams pa ste /
translated: From the point of view of the maturation of sentient beings and of one's own qualities of buddhahood means from the point of view of the maturation of sentient beings and from the point of view of the maturation of one's own qualities of buddhahood.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sems can thams cad kyi log par bsgrub pas skyo ba med la /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la sems can thams cad kyi log par bsgrub pas skyo ba med la /
translated: From the point of view of the maturation of sentient beings, one is not discouraged by the waywardness of all sentient beings.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba la phyi dang nang gi sdug bsngal 'bab pa thams cad kyis skyo ba med do //
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba la phyi dang nang gi sdug bsngal 'bab pa thams cad kyis skyo ba med do //
translated: From the point of view of the maturation of one's own qualities of buddhahood, one is not discouraged by any of the sufferings that arise internally or externally.

original: sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi yid la byed pa la mdo'i tshig bzhi ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi yid la byed pa la mdo'i tshig bzhi ste /
translated: There are four verses on the four kinds of practice:

original: sdig pa thams cad 'chags so //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad 'chags so //
translated: I confess all my sins.

original: bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: I rejoice in all goodness.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'tshal lo //
translated: I ask the Buddhas to teach.

original: bdag gi ye shes bla na med pa'i mchog tu gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi ye shes bla na med pa'i mchog tu gyur cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: May I attain the highest wisdom.

original: rab tu dang ba yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni dad pas mos pa dang bcas pa yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: rab tu dang ba yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni dad pas mos pa dang bcas pa yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The attention of faith is the attention of one who is endowed with devoted interest.

original: chos de nyid la mi smod pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos de nyid la mi smod pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: One does not criticize that Dharma, in the sense of not rejecting it.

original: mi smod pa ni mi spong ba ste /
analyzed: mi smod pa ni mi spong ba ste /
translated: Not criticizing means not rejecting.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos la gus pas yang dag par nod cing len ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i chos la gus pas yang dag par nod cing len ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One accepts and takes up the Dharma called the perfections with devotion.üîΩThese three kinds of attention should be applied to instruction and counsel.

original: yid la byed pa gsum po 'di dag kho na gdams ngag rjes su ston pa dang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni go cha dang smon lam dang mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa rnams te /üîΩ'di ltar / de bzhin bsgrub dang yang dag pa'i //
analyzed: yid la byed pa gsum po 'di dag kho na gdams ngag rjes su ston pa dang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni go cha dang smon lam dang mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa rnams te / 'di ltar / de bzhin bsgrub dang yang dag pa'i //
translated: The armor, aspirational prayer, and delight are the three kinds of attention.üîΩThus, after the practice, there is instruction and counsel,üîΩbecause it is said, ‚ÄúSimilarly, practice and the true

original: gdams ngag rjes su ston pa dang // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir bsgrub pa'i 'og tu gdams ngag rjes su ston pa yin pas so //
analyzed: gdams ngag rjes su ston pa dang // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir bsgrub pa'i 'og tu gdams ngag rjes su ston pa yin pas so //
translated: instruction and counsel.‚Äù

original: gdams ngag gi don du go cha gyon par byed /
analyzed: gdams ngag gi don du go cha gyon par byed /
translated: One puts on the armor for the sake of instruction.

original: smon lam 'debs /
analyzed: smon lam 'debs /
translated: One formulates aspirational prayers.

original: mngon par dga' ste /
analyzed: mngon par dga' ste /
translated: He is delighted,

original: aa la la bdag ni 'doms pa por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa la la bdag ni 'doms pa por 'gyur ro //
translated: thinking, ‚ÄúI will be an instructor!

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang bdag la 'doms par 'gyur ro snyam nas mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang bdag la 'doms par 'gyur ro snyam nas mngon par dga'o //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas will instruct me!‚Äù

original: gdams ngag rjes su ston pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi skabs yin pas de'i phyir de yid la byed pa'i 'og tu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs so /
analyzed: gdams ngag rjes su ston pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi skabs yin pas de'i phyir de yid la byed pa'i 'og tu sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs so /
translated: After the section on instruction, the section on the perfection of generosity follows immediately after the section on the activity of possessing the means, because of that, immediately after the attention to that, the section on the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The generosity of generosity.

original: sbyin pa ni dge ba'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni dge ba'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: Generosity is the five aggregates of virtuous entities.

original: sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid de dag gis gang gi tshe gzhan la nang dang phyi'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa ni sbyin pa'i sbyin pa yin no //üîΩyang na nang dang phyi'i nor dang 'bru la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin @97a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i ngo bo nyid de dag gis gang gi tshe gzhan la nang dang phyi'i sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa ni sbyin pa'i sbyin pa yin no // yang na nang dang phyi'i nor dang 'bru la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin @97a * //
translated: When one gives to others the internal and external generosity of those entities that are the nature of generosity, that is the generosity of generosity.

original: pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, that which is internal and external wealth, grain, etc. is called generosity.

original: de ni sbyin pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i sbyin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sbyin pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i sbyin pa yin no //
translated: Because of that, it is the generosity of generosity.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i sbyin pa ni gang gi tshe gzhan gyi rgyud la tshul khrims la sogs pa 'jog pa'am ston pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i sbyin pa ni gang gi tshe gzhan gyi rgyud la tshul khrims la sogs pa 'jog pa'am ston pa'o //
translated: The generosity of morality, etc. is that by which one establishes or teaches morality, etc. in the lifestream of another.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dag kho nas bsdu ba'i dngos po'i sbyor bas sems can yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni spro ba yid la byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dag kho nas bsdu ba'i dngos po'i sbyor bas sems can yongs su smin pa zhes bya ba ni spro ba yid la byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The maturation of beings through the application of the means of attraction by means of the perfections is called the mental attention of enthusiasm.

original: nam zhig na bdag bsdu ba'i dngos po dag gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa der 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: nam zhig na bdag bsdu ba'i dngos po dag gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa gang yin pa der 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: When will it be that I will mature beings through the means of attraction?

original: de nas pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sbyin pas sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de nas pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sbyin pas sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin to //
translated: Then, through the generosity endowed with the perfections, one takes hold of beings.

original: snyan par smra ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa kho na yin no //
translated: Agreeable speech is the teaching of the perfections.

original: don spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par len du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par len du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Helpful activity is the engagement in the taking up of the perfections.

original: don mthun pa nyid ni gang la gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa de la bdag rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa nyid ni gang la gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa de la bdag rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Consistency is the engagement in that which one has engaged others.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis bsgrub pa'i mchod pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis sgrub pas mched pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis bsgrub pa'i mchod pa dang zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gis sgrub pas mched pa'o //
translated: The worship of accomplishment is by means of the perfections of morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pas byams pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub pas byams pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The worship of love is by means of the accomplishment of generosity, etc.

original: byams pa ni bde ba dang phrad par 'dod pa ste byang chub sems dpa' ni bde ba dang 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bde ba dang sbyor bar yang byed do //
analyzed: byams pa ni bde ba dang phrad par 'dod pa ste byang chub sems dpa' ni bde ba dang 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi bde ba dang sbyor bar yang byed do //
translated: Love is the desire for the attainment of happiness. The bodhisattva not only desires the attainment of happiness, but also strives for it.

original: ser sna la sogs pa dang 'grogs pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa dang 'grogs pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The worship of compassion is for those beings who are accompanied by stinginess, etc.

original: snying rje ba ni sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje ba ni sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the desire for the removal of suffering.

original: ser sna la sogs pa dang 'grogs pa'i rnam pa ni sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa dang 'grogs pa'i rnam pa ni sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: Stinginess, etc., are the cause of suffering for beings, and so are suffering.

original: de'i phyir sems can ser sna can rnams la snying rje'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can ser sna can rnams la snying rje'o //
translated: Therefore, one has compassion for miserly sentient beings.

original: snying rje 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi ser sna 'dor du yang 'jug go //
analyzed: snying rje 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi ser sna 'dor du yang 'jug go //
translated: Not only does one have compassion, but one also causes them to abandon miserliness.üîΩOne is indifferent to them by being convinced that they are without defilement.

original: de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par mos pa'i sgo nas btang snyoms su byed ces bya ba ni sems can bde ba dang ldan pa rnams la ni sems can 'di dag bde ba la sogs pa la rjes su chags par ma gyur cig / deüîΩ'phrog par byed pa rnams la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa /
analyzed: de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par mos pa'i sgo nas btang snyoms su byed ces bya ba ni sems can bde ba dang ldan pa rnams la ni sems can 'di dag bde ba la sogs pa la rjes su chags par ma gyur cig / de 'phrog par byed pa rnams la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa /
translated: One is indifferent to sentient beings who are happy, being convinced that they are without attachment to happiness, etc.üîΩOne is indifferent to those who are taking away the property of others, being convinced that they are without defilement,

original: khro bar ma gyur par btang snyoms su gyur cig ces de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par mos @97b par byed do //
analyzed: khro bar ma gyur par btang snyoms su gyur cig ces de dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa med par mos @97b par byed do //
translated: and that they are without anger.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas pa'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas pa'am /
translated: One is indifferent to those who are not practicing generosity, etc.,

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'am /
translated: or who are not completing it,üîΩor who are practicing it wrongly.

original: log par byas pa dag la zhes bya ba ni mi byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: log par byas pa dag la zhes bya ba ni mi byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One is indifferent to those who are not practicing generosity, etc.,

original: yongs su ma rdzogs par byed pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dag las gang yang rung ba zhig la 'jug pa dang / gang la 'jug pa de yang yongs su rdzogs par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs par byed pa ni chos kyi sbyin pa dang / zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dag las gang yang rung ba zhig la 'jug pa dang / gang la 'jug pa de yang yongs su rdzogs par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Incomplete giving is giving the Dharma, giving material goods, and giving fearlessness, but not completing any of them, or not completing the one that is begun.

original: log par byed pa ni bcos pa byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: log par byed pa ni bcos pa byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Wrong giving is giving that is hypocritical.

original: ngo tsha nas ni 'jug pa dang ldog par bya ba'i phyir yun mi ring bar 'gyed pa byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo tsha nas ni 'jug pa dang ldog par bya ba'i phyir yun mi ring bar 'gyed pa byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Out of shame, one gives for the sake of engaging in and turning away from that.

original: yun ring po ni rtag tu rjes su 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: yun ring po ni rtag tu rjes su 'brel ba'o //
translated: Long is always connected.

original: gang gi tshe sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas pa la 'gyod pa ni rgyun chags su rjes su 'brel par 'gyod par ni mi byed de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas pa la 'gyod pa ni rgyun chags su rjes su 'brel par 'gyod par ni mi byed de /
translated: When one regrets not having given, etc., one does not regret being connected to it continuously.

original: 'di ltar rgyun chags par 'gyod na dge ba la 'jug pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyun chags par 'gyod na dge ba la 'jug pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For if one were to regret continuously, one would not even engage in virtue.üîΩTherefore, one does not regret not having given, etc.,

original: de bas na sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas pa'am /
translated: or having given, etc.,

original: ngan par byas pa gang yin pa de la yud tsam zhig byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa mi byed pa 'am ngan par byed pa ni rigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems la bsams nas de'i 'og tu sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas
analyzed: ngan par byas pa gang yin pa de la yud tsam zhig byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa mi byed pa 'am ngan par byed pa ni rigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems la bsams nas de'i 'og tu sbyin pa la sogs pa ma byas
translated: It is not right for a bodhisattva to not practice generosity and so on for even a moment with regard to those who have done wrong.

original: pa'am yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa dag la 'gyod pa bzlog pa'i phyir ma byas pa gang yin pa de la ni bya ba'i phyir 'jug la /
analyzed: pa'am yongs su rdzogs par ma byas pa dag la 'gyod pa bzlog pa'i phyir ma byas pa gang yin pa de la ni bya ba'i phyir 'jug la /
translated: After reflecting on this in his mind, he then engages in generosity and so on in order to do what he has not done and in order to complete what he has done, in order to eliminate regret.

original: rdzogs par ma byas pa gang yin pa de la ni rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rtag tu bya ba dang gus par byas te 'jug go //
analyzed: rdzogs par ma byas pa gang yin pa de la ni rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rtag tu bya ba dang gus par byas te 'jug go //
translated: He always engages in generosity and so on with respect and in order to complete what he has not completed.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa log par byas pa dag la ni phyin chad log par mi 'jug go zhes log par byed pa ldog par byed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa log par byas pa dag la ni phyin chad log par mi 'jug go zhes log par byed pa ldog par byed do //
translated: He turns away from wrong practice of generosity and so on and does not engage in them again in the future.

original: de ltar na 'di'i 'gyod pa de las ldog go //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di'i 'gyod pa de las ldog go //
translated: Thus, he turns away from regret.

original: yul la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa yul la ste /
analyzed: yul la dga' ba zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa yul la ste /
translated: He delights in the object refers to generosity and so on.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa dmigs pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa dmigs pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: in relation to the objective supports of generosity, etc.üîΩBecause of the composition of the treatise endowed with the perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i bstan bcos 'god par mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mdo sde rgyan 'di nyid las grangs dang de'i mtshan nyid go rims dang zhes bya ba'i rim pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'god pa
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i bstan bcos 'god par mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mdo sde rgyan 'di nyid las grangs dang de'i mtshan nyid go rims dang zhes bya ba'i rim pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'god pa
translated: Just as in this Ornament of the MahƒÅyƒÅna S≈´tras, the perfections are composed in the order of enumeration, their characteristics, sequence,

original: mngon par 'du byed pa ltar pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'god par mngon par 'du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa ltar pha rol tu phyin pa rnams 'god par mngon par 'du byed pa yin no //
translated: one composes the perfections in the same way.

original: snod @98a * //
analyzed: snod @98a * //
translated: The vessel.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du brjod pa zhes bya ba la ni kha cig ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos bstan du rung ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos bstan du rung ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du brjod pa zhes bya ba la ni kha cig ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos bstan du rung ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos bstan du rung ba'i bar yin no //
translated: In accordance with the individual, some are suitable vessels for the Dharma teaching of the perfection of generosity, up to some are suitable vessels for the Dharma teaching of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rten ni sbyin pa la sogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rten ni sbyin pa la sogs pa yin gyi /
translated: The support is generosity, etc.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa ma gtogs par dbang phyug la sogs pa ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rten du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa ma gtogs par dbang phyug la sogs pa ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rten du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The Lord, etc. are not the basis of perfect enlightenment, except for the perfections.

original: ser sna la sogs pa la ni skyon nyid du so so yang dag pa nyid du rig la /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa la ni skyon nyid du so so yang dag pa nyid du rig la /
translated: He knows stinginess, etc. as faults,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa ser sna la sogs pa'i gnyen po la ni yon tan nyid du so so yang dag par rig go //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa ser sna la sogs pa'i gnyen po la ni yon tan nyid du so so yang dag par rig go //
translated: and he knows generosity, etc. as the antidotes to stinginess, etc. as virtues.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis byang chub chen po 'thob pa'i don du yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis byang chub chen po 'thob pa'i don du yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because he sees that the nature of the factors of enlightenment such as generosity leads to the attainment of great enlightenment.

original: byang chub chen po ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: byang chub chen po ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Great enlightenment is the nonconceptual intuition of the bodhisattvas.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag bsgoms na byang chub chen po de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bor gnas so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag bsgoms na byang chub chen po de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i ngo bor gnas so //
translated: When these perfections are cultivated, they are the basis of the factors of enlightenment which lead to that great enlightenment.

original: tshogs kyi 'og tu yang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun par bsgom pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'og tu yang byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun par bsgom pa 'byung ste /
translated: Also, the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment occurs after the collections.

original: 'di dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa ni don chen po yin no //üîΩrnam par mi rtog pa 'dod pa yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du thabs la mkhas pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs ni rnam
analyzed: 'di dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa ni don chen po yin no // rnam par mi rtog pa 'dod pa yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i don du thabs la mkhas pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs ni rnam
translated: The attention that possesses this is of great import.üîΩThe attention that desires nonconceptuality is for the sake of completing the perfections and for the sake of desiring skill in means.

original: par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: par mi rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The means for completing the perfections is nonconceptual intuition.

original: de la 'dod pa yid la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa yid la bya ba byed do //
translated: One performs the attention that desires that.

original: yang na sbyor ba'i gnas skabs nyid na rtog pa med cing rnam par rtog pa med par sbyin pa la sogs pa 'jug par 'gyur bar mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba'i gnas skabs nyid na rtog pa med cing rnam par rtog pa med par sbyin pa la sogs pa 'jug par 'gyur bar mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: Or, at the time of practice, one performs the attention that desires to engage in giving, etc., without thought and without discrimination.

original: de nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob nas ni rnam par mi rtog pa kho nar sbyin pa la sogs pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob nas ni rnam par mi rtog pa kho nar sbyin pa la sogs pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, having attained nonconceptual intuition, one engages in giving, etc., without conceptualization.

original: 'dzin pa 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni gzungs kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'dzin pa 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni gzungs kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The attention of wanting to apprehend is in the context of the retention of what is heard.

original: rnam smin thos la goms pa dang // ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu yin no //üîΩrkyen dang phrad pa 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i @98b phyir de skye ba thams cad du dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa la sogs pa dang ldan par
analyzed: rnam smin thos la goms pa dang // ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba lta bu yin no // rkyen dang phrad pa 'dod pa yid la byed pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i @98b phyir de skye ba thams cad du dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa la sogs pa dang ldan par
translated: The retention of the maturation of what is heard, the retention of concentration, and so on.

original: gyur cig ces rkyen tshogs par smon lam 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: gyur cig ces rkyen tshogs par smon lam 'debs pa yin no //
translated: The attention of wanting to meet the conditions is the prayer for the assembly of conditions in order to complete the perfections of generosity and so on, such as meeting with spiritual friends in all lives.

original: med pa la yod par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'am /
analyzed: med pa la yod par 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni bdag med pa'am /
translated: The attention of wanting to be without is the attention of wanting to be without the two obscurations.üîΩThe attention of wanting to be without the afflictive obscuration is the attention of wanting to be without the afflictive obstructions.üîΩThe attention of wanting to be without the knowledge obscuration is the attention of wanting to be without the obstructions to omniscience.üîΩThe attention of wanting to apprehend is the attention of wanting to apprehend the two kinds of no-self.üîΩThe attention of wanting to apprehend the no-self of persons is the attention of wanting to apprehend the selflessness of persons.

original: kun brtags pa'i chos rnams la yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /üîΩde'i gnyen por stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos rnams la yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa ste /üîΩde'i gnyen por stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The attention of wanting to apprehend the no-self of phenomena is the attention of wanting to apprehend the selflessness of phenomena.

original: nyes pa dang ldan pa la yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang ldan pa yin na de rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba la sogs par yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin te /üîΩde'i gnyen por smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: nyes pa dang ldan pa la yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa dang ldan pa yin na de rtag pa dang bde ba dang gtsang ba la sogs par yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du 'dzin te / de'i gnyen por smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The antidote to the notion that what is defective is endowed with good qualities is the concentration of wishlessness.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa la yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa yin no //üîΩde la byis pa rnams chad pa'i 'jigs pas yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin par 'dzin to ;
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa la yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni yon tan thams cad phun sum tshogs pa yin no // de la byis pa rnams chad pa'i 'jigs pas yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin par 'dzin to ;
translated: The notion that what is endowed with good qualities is not endowed with good qualities is the notion that nirvana is not endowed with all good qualities.

original: /'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: /'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa rnams so //
translated: The notion that conditioned things are impermanent is the notion that all conditioned things, whether they are impure or pure, are impermanent.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag kho na ste /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba'o zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag kho na ste /
translated: The notion that conditioned things are painful is the notion that all impure conditioned things are painful.

original: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra phyogs gcig brjod pa yin par blta'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra phyogs gcig brjod pa yin par blta'o //
translated: The word all should be understood as referring to one part.

original: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams te /
translated: All phenomena are without self means that all phenomena are without a self, whether they are contaminated or uncontaminated, conditioned or unconditioned.

original: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra 'dir ni ri la brjod pa yin par blta'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra 'dir ni ri la brjod pa yin par blta'o //
translated: The word all should be understood as referring to a mountain.

original: ngo mtshar la 'du shes rnam pa bzhi yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rgya che ba'i 'du shes dang zhes bya ba ni 'di la ngo mtshar che ba de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ngo mtshar la 'du shes rnam pa bzhi yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la rgya che ba'i 'du shes dang zhes bya ba ni 'di la ngo mtshar che ba de ci zhig ce na /
translated: The four kinds of perception of the marvelous are the perception of the vastness of the transcendences. What is marvelous about them?

original: re zhig sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ni rang gi lus gtong ba ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: re zhig sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ni rang gi lus gtong ba ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: In the first place, the giving of one‚Äôs own body is marvelous in the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims la ni sdom pa'i phyir phun sum tshogs pa rgya chen po gtong ba ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la ni sdom pa'i phyir phun sum tshogs pa rgya chen po gtong ba ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: In morality, the giving up of the perfection of the great weal of vows is marvelous.

original: bzod pa la ni mthu med pa dag la bzod pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa la ni mthu med pa dag la bzod pa ste /
translated: In patience, it is patience with the weak.

original: ma rabs bkren pa gdol pa'i bu la sogs pas lan cig ma yin par gnod pa byas kyang bu gcig pa la byams pa bzhin du bzod pa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: ma rabs bkren pa gdol pa'i bu la sogs pas lan cig ma yin par gnod pa byas kyang bu gcig pa la byams pa bzhin du bzod pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: It is a great wonder that he should be patient with the wicked, the poor, the low-caste, and so on, who do him harm again and again, just as if they were his only child.

original: bsam gtan la ni bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi bsam gtan dag la yang ro myang ba med @99a * //üîΩpa ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan la ni bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi bsam gtan dag la yang ro myang ba med @99a * // pa ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: In meditative absorption, it is a great wonder that he should not savor even the blissful meditative concentrations.

original: shes rab la ni mi rtog pa ngo mtshar che ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab la ni mi rtog pa ngo mtshar che ba ste /
translated: In wisdom, it is a great wonder that he should be nonconceptual.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni ngo mtshar che ba nyid kyis rgya che ba yin no //üîΩyun ring ba'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni de ltar ngo mtshar che ba nyid kyis /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag ni ngo mtshar che ba nyid kyis rgya che ba yin no // yun ring ba'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni de ltar ngo mtshar che ba nyid kyis /
translated: Thus, these transcendences are extensive because they are so wonderful.

original: rgya che ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du kun tu spyod de /
analyzed: rgya che ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du kun tu spyod de /
translated: The idea of duration is that the transcendences are practiced for a long time, for three measureless kalpas.

original: 'di yang ngo mtshar che ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang ngo mtshar che ba yin no //
translated: This is also a great wonder.

original: sems can gang dag la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa yang len la re ba med par byed pa 'di yang ngo mtshar che ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gang dag la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis phan 'dogs par byed pa yang len la re ba med par byed pa 'di yang ngo mtshar che ba yin no //
translated: It is also a great wonder that they benefit sentient beings with the perfections and do so without hoping for anything in return.

original: rnam par smin pa la mi lta ba'i 'du shes so zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa tshe phyi ma'i dbang phyug la sogs pa la mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la mi lta ba'i 'du shes so zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa tshe phyi ma'i dbang phyug la sogs pa la mi lta ba'o //
translated: The idea of not looking for karmic rewards refers to not looking for wealth in future lives and so on as a result of generosity and so on.

original: ngo mtshar med pa la yang 'du shes rnam pa bzhi yid la byed de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo mtshar med pa la yang 'du shes rnam pa bzhi yid la byed de zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should also keep in mind four ideas about what is not a wonder.

original: ngo mtshar med pa rnam pa bzhi ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rgya che ba dang yun ring ba nyid yin na ni 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid mngon par 'grub pa dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'di lta bu'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid yin no zhes
analyzed: ngo mtshar med pa rnam pa bzhi ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rgya che ba dang yun ring ba nyid yin na ni 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid mngon par 'grub pa dang zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'di lta bu'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid yin no zhes
translated: The four things that are not wonders are that the result of the perfections is the attainment of buddhahood, that the result of the perfections is the attainment of the result of the levels, that the result of the levels is the attainment of the result of the perfections, and that the result of the levels is the attainment of the result of the levels.üîΩThe idea of not looking for karmic rewards refers to not looking for wealth in future lives and so on as a result of generosity and so on.

original: bya ba la ngo mtshar che ba med do //üîΩgnyis po de nyid yod na zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba dang yun ring ba nyid do //
analyzed: bya ba la ngo mtshar che ba med do //üîΩgnyis po de nyid yod na zhes bya ba ni rgya che ba dang yun ring ba nyid do //
translated: One should also keep in mind four ideas about what is not a wonder.üîΩThe four things that are not wonders are that the result of the perfections is the attainment of buddhahood, that the result of the perfections is the attainment of the result of the levels, that the result of the levels is the attainment of the result of the perfections, and that the result of the levels is the attainment of the result of the levels.

original: rang dang gzhan la sems mnyam par 'jog pa gang yin pa de ngo mtshar che ba med do zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can phal ba bzhin du gzhan la gnod pas rang gi don bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan la sems mnyam par 'jog pa gang yin pa de ngo mtshar che ba med do zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can phal ba bzhin du gzhan la gnod pas rang gi don bsgrub pa'am /
translated: The bodhisattva does not accomplish his own aim by harming others, like an ordinary person,

original: gzhan la mi lta bar bdag nyid kho na'i don byed pa ma yin gyi 'di ltar de ni rang gi lus yongs su gtong ba la sogs pa byed la /
analyzed: gzhan la mi lta bar bdag nyid kho na'i don byed pa ma yin gyi 'di ltar de ni rang gi lus yongs su gtong ba la sogs pa byed la /
translated: nor does he work only for his own aim without regard for others. Rather, he gives away his own body and so on.

original: rang gi lus yongs su gtong ba la sogs pa de yang bskal ba mi nyung bar kun du spyod de rgya che ba dang yun ring ba nyid 'dis rang dang gzhan la sems mnyam par 'gyur ba la ngo mtshar che ba med do //
analyzed: rang gi lus yongs su gtong ba la sogs pa de yang bskal ba mi nyung bar kun du spyod de rgya che ba dang yun ring ba nyid 'dis rang dang gzhan la sems mnyam par 'gyur ba la ngo mtshar che ba med do //
translated: And he practices giving away his body and so on for many eons. Since he is so magnanimous and persevering, it is not surprising that he is impartial toward self and other.

original: de dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sems can skye bo sdug bsngal bar gyur pa dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: de dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sems can skye bo sdug bsngal bar gyur pa dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: He is superior to those who are suffering.

original: brgya byin la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can sdug bsngal bar gyur pa gang dag la sbyin pa la sogs pas phan 'dogs par byed pa de dag la ltos na khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems can sdug bsngal bar gyur pa gang dag la sbyin pa la sogs pas phan 'dogs par byed pa de dag la ltos na khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: Indra and so on are not as magnanimous as the bodhisattvas who benefit those sentient beings who are suffering by means of generosity and so on.

original: brgya byin la sogs pa las mchod pa la sogs pa rnyed du @99b zin kyang lan la mi lta na /
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pa las mchod pa la sogs pa rnyed du @99b zin kyang lan la mi lta na /
translated: Even though Indra and so on receive worship and so on, they do not expect anything in return.

original: gang dag la sbyin par bya ba nyid kyang med pa'i sems can sdug bsngal bar gyur pa rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba la ngo mtshar che ba med de /
analyzed: gang dag la sbyin par bya ba nyid kyang med pa'i sems can sdug bsngal bar gyur pa rnams la lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba la ngo mtshar che ba med de /
translated: What need is there to mention those sentient beings who are suffering and who are not even the objects of generosity?

original: gang zhig brgya byin la sogs pa ches khyad par du 'phags pa la yang lan la mi lta ba de ji ltar skye bo gzhan la yang lan re bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig brgya byin la sogs pa ches khyad par du 'phags pa la yang lan la mi lta ba de ji ltar skye bo gzhan la yang lan re bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How could one who does not expect anything in return from Indra and so on, who are far superior, expect anything in return from other beings?

original: 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par 'phags pa'i lus dang longs spyod 'thob tu zin kyang rnam par smin pa la mi lta ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par 'phags pa'i lus dang longs spyod 'thob tu zin kyang rnam par smin pa la mi lta ba nyid do //
translated: Even though one obtains a body and resources that are superior to all the worlds, one does not expect a karmic maturation.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dbang phyug la sogs pa'i bdag nyid mi 'dod bzhin du 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i lus kyang 'thob la /üîΩlongs spyod rnam pa sna tshogs kyang 'thob pa de rnam par smin pa las mi lta'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ngo mtshar che ba med do snyam pa yid la byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pas sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid 'jug par mngon
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dbang phyug la sogs pa'i bdag nyid mi 'dod bzhin du 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i lus kyang 'thob la / longs spyod rnam pa sna tshogs kyang 'thob pa de rnam par smin pa las mi lta'o zhes bya ba 'di ni ngo mtshar che ba med do snyam pa yid la byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pas sems can thams cad la mnyam pa nyid 'jug par mngon
translated: that are the results of generosity, etc., and that one obtains various kinds of enjoyments.üîΩThe mental attention that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is not wonderful‚Äù is the mental attention that is directed toward the supremacy of generosity, etc.üîΩThe mental attention that thinks, ‚ÄúI will engage in the practice of generosity, etc., toward all sentient beings in a manner that is equal‚Äù is the mental attention that is directed toward the equality of self and others.

original: par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba la zhugs pa la ni 'di snyam du sems can 'di dag ni gnyen po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: par 'du byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba la zhugs pa la ni 'di snyam du sems can 'di dag ni gnyen po la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: bdag nyid mchog tu nges par 'dzin pa yid la byed pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa mchog gis chos la zhugs pas bdag nyid gtso bo'i ngo bor yang dag par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang gi tshe pha rol tu
translated: The conscientious attitude of being well established in the Great Vehicle is the perception of the Great Vehicle as the supreme vehicle, because it is the vehicle for attaining the great enlightenment.

original: phyin pa rnams la 'jug pa de'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sbyor ba ni 'jig rten gyi chos dag pas mchog gtso bo dam pa yin no zhes pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba mchog nyid du 'dzin to //
analyzed: phyin pa rnams la 'jug pa de'i tshe pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sbyor ba ni 'jig rten gyi chos dag pas mchog gtso bo dam pa yin no zhes pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba mchog nyid du 'dzin to //
translated: When one is engaged in the perfections, one holds the engagement in the perfections to be the best, the foremost, the most excellent, the most sublime, by way of the mundane purity.

original: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa gsum po dag la chos kyi sbyin pa dang / zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa rnams kyi nang na ni chos kyi sbyin pa gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: yang na pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa gsum po dag la chos kyi sbyin pa dang / zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa rnams kyi nang na ni chos kyi sbyin pa gtso bo yin la /
translated: Or else, among the three kinds of perfections, the perfection of giving Dharma, the perfection of giving material things, and the perfection of giving fearlessness, the perfection of giving Dharma is the best.üîΩAmong the three kinds of morality, the morality of restraint is the best.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum la ni zlog pa'i tshul khrims gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum la ni zlog pa'i tshul khrims gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs par ro //
translated: These mental attentions to virtue

original: pha rol phyin bcu'i rgyus byung ba //üîΩdge ba yid byed 'di dag ni //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu'i rgyus byung ba // dge ba yid byed 'di dag ni //
translated: that arise from the cause of the ten perfectionsüîΩare always the cause of the bodhisattva‚ÄôsüîΩnourishment of the spiritual gene.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyu las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyu las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: These mental attentions to virtue are called ‚Äúarisen from the cause‚Äù because they are endowed with the ten perfections.

original: rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' yi //
analyzed: rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' yi //
translated: They are always the cause of the bodhisattva‚Äôs

original: khams ni brtas par byed pa yin //
analyzed: khams ni brtas par byed pa yin //
translated: nourishment of the spiritual gene.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rigs brtas par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i rigs brtas par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: chos yongs su tshol ba'i rab tu dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te /üîΩzhes bya ba ni chos yongs su tshol ba'i rab tu dbye ba gang dag yin pa de dag gi @101b dbang du byas te /
analyzed: chos yongs su tshol ba'i rab tu dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa gnyis te / zhes bya ba ni chos yongs su tshol ba'i rab tu dbye ba gang dag yin pa de dag gi @101b dbang du byas te /
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the search for the teaching.üîΩThe search for the teaching is analyzed as to its nature, its basis, its aim, its function, its result, its endowment, its categories, and its preeminence.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis so //
translated: Two verses on the analysis of the search for the teaching.

original: thos pa la mos pa rgyas pas so zhes bya ba ni las dang po'i gnas skabs na theg pa chen po la mos pa skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa la mos pa rgyas pas so zhes bya ba ni las dang po'i gnas skabs na theg pa chen po la mos pa skye ba gang yin pa'o //

original: 'di ltar chos kyi rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i rtser phyin pa las 'byung la de'i mjug thogs su ni sa thob po //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi rgyun gyi ting nge 'dzin ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i rtser phyin pa las 'byung la de'i mjug thogs su ni sa thob po //
translated: Thus, the concentration of the stream of Dharma arises from the culmination of the stage of action in faith, and immediately after that, one attains the stages.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spang ba med pa ni gnyis pa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spang ba med pa ni gnyis pa'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it will be explained that the second is the absence of elimination.

original: chen po ni dbang 'byor pa thob pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chen po ni dbang 'byor pa thob pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The great one is that of those who have attained mastery.

original: dbang 'byor pa ni brgyad pa la sogs pas chen po la zhugs pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: dbang 'byor pa ni brgyad pa la sogs pas chen po la zhugs pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: Mastery is that of those who have entered the great stage, beginning with the eighth stage.

original: sku dang bcas pa ni mos pas spyod pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: sku dang bcas pa ni mos pas spyod pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: The one with a body is that of those on the stage of action in faith, which arises from meditation. This is the state of action in faith.

original: sa dang po ma thob par ji ltar sku dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sa dang po ma thob par ji ltar sku dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can one have a body without attaining the first stage?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i don 'jig pas cung zad cig thob pa'i phyir sku dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i don 'jig pas cung zad cig thob pa'i phyir sku dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: One has a body because one has attained a little bit through the destruction of the object of grasped and grasper.

original: sa dang po la sogs pa la ni mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa spangs pa'i phyir dang gnyis su 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir sku thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang po la sogs pa la ni mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa spangs pa'i phyir dang gnyis su 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i phyir sku thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: On the first stage and so on, the body is said to be attained because the view of the real existence of the body and so on, which are to be eliminated by the path of seeing, are eliminated, and because one is free from the duality of apprehending subject and object.

original: rgyu nyid kyi chos yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos yongs su btsal na mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: rgyu nyid kyi chos yongs su tshol ba la tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos yongs su btsal na mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur bas so //
translated: A verse on the investigation of the cause itself.

original: chos ni gzugs la ni mtshan gyi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la mtshan rnams gsal gyi tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa la ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: chos ni gzugs la ni mtshan gyi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi phung po la mtshan rnams gsal gyi tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa la ni ma yin pas /
translated: The Dharma is the cause of the marks, in the sense of form, because the major marks are clear in the aggregate of form, and not in the formless aggregates of feeling, etc.

original: de'i phyir chos ni gzugs la ni mtshan gyi rgyu'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos ni gzugs la ni mtshan gyi rgyu'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the Dharma is the cause of the marks in the sense of form.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa la ni nad med pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba la chos gzugs can ma yin pa la ni sems dang sems las byung rnams te /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa la ni nad med pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba la chos gzugs can ma yin pa la ni sems dang sems las byung rnams te /
translated: The cause of health is nonphysical phenomena.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa gang gis sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa de dag nye bar zhi bar byed pas de'i phyir chos ni nad med pa'i rgyur bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa gang gis sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa de dag nye bar zhi bar byed pas de'i phyir chos ni nad med pa'i rgyur bshad do //
translated: The cause of health is explained to be nonphysical phenomena, because they pacify the mental afflictions that afflict the mind, such as attachment.

original: de dag zad mi shes pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las @102a * //
analyzed: de dag zad mi shes pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir mya ngan las @102a * //
translated: The cause of their inexhaustibility is nirvana.

original: 'das par 'du shes zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'das par 'du shes zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cause of their inexhaustibility is nirvana.

original: de dag ces bya ba'i sgras ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i nor bzung ste /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba'i sgras ni mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i nor bzung ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúthem‚Äù refers to the jewels of the superknowledges and so on.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la ni rnam pa gang gis kyang zad pa med pas de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i nor yang yongs su zad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa la ni rnam pa gang gis kyang zad pa med pas de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i nor yang yongs su zad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the nirvana of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas is not exhausted in any way, therefore, like nirvana, the wealth of superknowledge, etc. is not exhausted.

original: 'jig rten ni nor zad pas 'jigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni nor zad pas 'jigs par 'gyur na /
translated: The world fears the exhaustion of wealth.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i nor la ni zad pa med pas de'i phyir 'jigs pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i nor la ni zad pa med pas de'i phyir 'jigs pa med do //
translated: But since the wealth of superknowledge, etc. of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas is inexhaustible, therefore they have no fear.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni dang po med pa dang yod par rnam par rtog pa de dag ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni dang po med pa dang yod par rnam par rtog pa de dag ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The first two kinds of conceptual differentiation are the adverse factors for the insubstantiality of the personal entity.

original: gnyis pa dag ni chos la bdag med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa dag ni chos la bdag med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The second two are the adverse factors for the insubstantiality of the dharmas.

original: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos dang chos can gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni chos dang chos can gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Form itself is emptiness. This is because there is no other phenomenon that is the possessor of the property and this is the property.

original: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Emptiness is form is also like that.

original: thabs kyi che ba nyid ni brtson 'grus drag po nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus mi dman pa dang mi 'khrug pa dang chog par mi 'dzin pas te /
analyzed: thabs kyi che ba nyid ni brtson 'grus drag po nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grus mi dman pa dang mi 'khrug pa dang chog par mi 'dzin pas te /
translated: The greatness of the means is due to the fact that he has intense perseverance. He has intense perseverance because he is not inferior in perseverance, he is not disturbed by it, and he is not satisfied with it.

original: brtson 'grus drag po de yang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: brtson 'grus drag po de yang thabs kyis yongs su zin pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, that intense perseverance is embraced by the means.

original: gzu lums kyi brtson 'grus kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzu lums kyi brtson 'grus kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the perseverance of one who is rash.

original: de bzhin nyid bcas gnyis kyi chos nyid yongs btsal ba //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid bcas gnyis kyi chos nyid yongs btsal ba //
translated: The reality of the two, along with suchness, is thoroughly investigated.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i chos nyid dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i chos nyid dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: This refers to the reality of conventional truth and the reality of ultimate truth.

original: de yongs su tshol ba ni gnyis kyis yongs su tshol ba ste /
analyzed: de yongs su tshol ba ni gnyis kyis yongs su tshol ba ste /
translated: The thorough investigation of that is the thorough investigation of the two.

original: 'di skad du kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i chos la mkhas pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i chos la mkhas pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i chos la mkhas pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i chos la mkhas pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is meant by being skilled in the Dharma of conventional truth and being skilled in the Dharma of ultimate truth.

original: chos yongs su tshol ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: chos yongs su tshol ba'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on investigating the Dharma is complete.

original: // / chos yongs su tshol ba'i skabs kyi 'og tu chos ston pa'i skabs te /
analyzed: // / chos yongs su tshol ba'i skabs kyi 'og tu chos ston pa'i skabs te /
translated: The chapter on teaching the Dharma follows the chapter on investigating the Dharma.

original: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its connection?

original: gong du rnam pa gang dag gi de'i sbyor ba'i sa la slob pa de dag ni slob pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: gong du rnam pa gang dag gi de'i sbyor ba'i sa la slob pa de dag ni slob pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par yin te /
translated: The above verse explained that the bodhisattva's training on the level of earnest aspiration has the following features:üîΩThe features of training are the distinctive attitudes and so forth.

original: de dag kyang bsam pa'i khyad par la sogs pa'o zhes bshad pa la bsam pa dang sbyor ba'i khyad par dag ni mos pa yongs su tshol ba'i skabs su bshad @102b zin to //
analyzed: de dag kyang bsam pa'i khyad par la sogs pa'o zhes bshad pa la bsam pa dang sbyor ba'i khyad par dag ni mos pa yongs su tshol ba'i skabs su bshad @102b zin to //
translated: The distinctive attitudes and applications were explained in the chapter on investigating interest.

original: da ni gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa'i khyad par gyi skabs la bab pas de brjod do //
analyzed: da ni gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa'i khyad par gyi skabs la bab pas de brjod do //
translated: Now, since the occasion has arisen for explaining the distinctive ways in which bodhisattvas accomplish the benefit of others, this is done.

original: ji ltar na gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa yin zhe na /
translated: How do they accomplish the benefit of others?

original: gzhan dag la dam pa'i chos yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i phyir te /üîΩde bas na chos yongs su tshol ba'i skabs kyi 'og tu chos ston pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la dam pa'i chos yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i phyir te / de bas na chos yongs su tshol ba'i skabs kyi 'og tu chos ston pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: because they teach the true Dharma to others.üîΩTherefore, after the chapter on the investigation of the Dharma, the chapter on the teaching of the Dharma follows.

original: chos ston pa la ser sna dgag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhe bya ba ni ji ltar na chos ston pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ser sna skabs nyid med pa de ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos ston pa la ser sna dgag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa zhe bya ba ni ji ltar na chos ston pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ser sna skabs nyid med pa de ston par byed pa'o //
translated: One verse on the prohibition of stinginess in teaching the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa ni snying rjes srog dang longs spyod tshegs chen pos rnyed cang zad par 'gyur bas snying po med pa dag kyang sems can sdug bsngal bar gyur pa rnams la sbyin par byed pa na zhes bya ba ni yo byad zad na'ang sdug
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa ni snying rjes srog dang longs spyod tshegs chen pos rnyed cang zad par 'gyur bas snying po med pa dag kyang sems can sdug bsngal bar gyur pa rnams la sbyin par byed pa na zhes bya ba ni yo byad zad na'ang sdug
translated: Even though their lives and possessions are obtained with great difficulty and are perishable, and therefore have no essence, the bodhisattvas give them to suffering beings out of compassion.

original: bsngal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsngal bar 'gyur la /
translated: When their possessions are exhausted, they suffer.üîΩAnd when their lives are exhausted, they die.

original: srog zad na yang 'chi bar 'gyur bas gang zhig zad par 'gyur ba de ni sbyin par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: srog zad na yang 'chi bar 'gyur bas gang zhig zad par 'gyur ba de ni sbyin par mi nus kyi /
translated: Therefore, one cannot give what is perishable.

original: gang zhig sbyin yang zad pa med pa de la ni sems zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig sbyin yang zad pa med pa de la ni sems zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who gives what is inexhaustible does not become depressed.

original: chos ni byin yang zad par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos ni byin yang zad par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Dharma, even when given, does not become exhausted.

original: mar me las mar gyi me spar ba de bzhin du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mar me las mar gyi me spar ba de bzhin du 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Like one lamp lighting another, it increases.

original: longs spyod kyang tshegs chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: longs spyod kyang tshegs chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: Wealth is to be accomplished with great effort.

original: mi nyid kyang yid la smon pa brgya phrag mang pos 'thob ste /
analyzed: mi nyid kyang yid la smon pa brgya phrag mang pos 'thob ste /
translated: Human birth is obtained through many hundreds of wishes.

original: gang zhig de ltar tshegs chen pos rnyed pa'i lus dang longs spyod de dag kyang yongs su gtong ba de ji ltar tshegs chen pos rnyed pa ma yin pa chos yongs su gtong bar mi byed /
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar tshegs chen pos rnyed pa'i lus dang longs spyod de dag kyang yongs su gtong ba de ji ltar tshegs chen pos rnyed pa ma yin pa chos yongs su gtong bar mi byed /
translated: How could one who gives up such a body and wealth, obtained with such great effort, not give up Dharma, which is not obtained with great effort?üîΩDharma is obtained through the purity of life and wealth.

original: chos ni srog dang longs spyod dag pas kyang chos shin tu rnyed par dka' bas tshigs su bcad pa phyed tsam gyi phyir yang byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid yongs su btang ste /
analyzed: chos ni srog dang longs spyod dag pas kyang chos shin tu rnyed par dka' bas tshigs su bcad pa phyed tsam gyi phyir yang byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid yongs su btang ste /
translated: For the sake of even half a verse, a bodhisattva gives up his or her own body.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: legs gsungs tshigs bcad phyed tsam yang //
analyzed: legs gsungs tshigs bcad phyed tsam yang //
translated: Even for half a verse of the well-spoken Dharma,
