translated: For those who think that the excellence of the three realms is the best and the most important, because they are attached to the passion of the three realms, the excellence of the Buddha-land is praised as the antidote to that.

original: nga rgyal spyod pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la'i phun sum tshogs pa lhag par bsngags pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nga rgyal spyod pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la'i phun sum tshogs pa lhag par bsngags pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The antidote to the obscuration of the practice of pride is stated in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúIn some Buddha-lands the excellence of the Blessed One is praised as superior.‚Äù

original: nga rgyal gang zhe na /üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten @108a * //
analyzed: nga rgyal gang zhe na / 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten @108a * //
translated: What is pride?

original: nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩlha dang // klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za la sogs pa kha cig bdag ni gzugs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: nas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o // lha dang // klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za la sogs pa kha cig bdag ni gzugs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is the inflation of the mind based on the false view of individuality.

original: blta na sdug pa dang ldan pa mthu dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: blta na sdug pa dang ldan pa mthu dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Some gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, etc., think, ‚ÄúI am endowed with form, I am endowed with beauty, I am endowed with power.‚Äù

original: bdag pas mthu la sogs pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan ni med do snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag pas mthu la sogs pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa gzhan ni med do snyam nas /
translated: There is no one else who is superior to me in power and so on.

original: gzugs dang mthu dang yangs pa dang dbang phyug la sogs pas sems khengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang mthu dang yangs pa dang dbang phyug la sogs pas sems khengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, his mind becomes arrogant due to his form, power, wealth, sovereignty, and so on.

original: rgyags pas gos pa de lta bu de dag gi khengs pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyags pas gos pa de lta bu de dag gi khengs pa spang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon that kind of arrogance of those who are defiled by conceit,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin la sogs pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin la sogs pa thams cad las khyad par du 'phags te /
translated: The excellence of the Blessed Buddhas is superior to all gods, humans, asuras, and so on.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes sangs rgyas la la'i phun sum tshogs pa lhag par bsngags te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab po zhes sangs rgyas la la'i phun sum tshogs pa lhag par bsngags te /
translated: It is said, The excellence of the Buddhas is inconceivable.

original: des na gzugs dang / na tshod dang / dbang phyug dang / rigs la sogs pas dregs pa yongs su 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gzugs dang / na tshod dang / dbang phyug dang / rigs la sogs pas dregs pa yongs su 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one abandons arrogance due to form, youth, sovereignty, family, and so on.

original: 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni gang dag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa byed pa de dag thams cad ni mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gang dag mi shes pas
analyzed: 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni gang dag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa byed pa de dag thams cad ni mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni gang dag mi shes pas
translated: The antidote to the obscuration of regret is stated as follows:üîΩAll those who harm the buddhas and bodhisattvas will go to the higher realms.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa byed pa de dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad nas 'gyod pa chen po skyes te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa byed pa de dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad nas 'gyod pa chen po skyes te /
translated: Those who, out of ignorance, harm the buddhas and bodhisattvas, later meet a spiritual friend and give rise to great regret.

original: bsod nams phung po 'di lta bu la bdag gis gnod pa byas so snyam nas rtag tu 'gyod pa rgyun chags pa kho nar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bsod nams phung po 'di lta bu la bdag gis gnod pa byas so snyam nas rtag tu 'gyod pa rgyun chags pa kho nar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thinking, ‚ÄúI have harmed such a great heap of merit,‚Äù they constantly and continuously regret it.

original: dge ba'i las la yang mi spyor //
analyzed: dge ba'i las la yang mi spyor //
translated: They do not engage in virtuous actions.

original: 'gyod pa'i gnyen po yang mi bsten pas /
analyzed: 'gyod pa'i gnyen po yang mi bsten pas /
translated: They do not rely on the antidote to regret.

original: de dag gi ched du 'di skad du /
analyzed: de dag gi ched du 'di skad du /
translated: For their sake, it is said:

original: gang dag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa byed pa de dag thams cad ni mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa byed pa de dag thams cad ni mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: All those who harm the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas will go to the higher realms.

original: de skad du bshad na de'i tshe sems can de dag 'di ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa byas pas kyang mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur na phan pa byas pas lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes rjes su 'brel ba'i 'gyod pa yongsüîΩsu 'dor ro //
analyzed: de skad du bshad na de'i tshe sems can de dag 'di ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gnod pa byas pas kyang mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur na phan pa byas pas lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes rjes su 'brel ba'i 'gyod pa yongs su 'dor ro //
translated: When this is explained, those sentient beings will think, ‚ÄúEven by harming the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, one goes to the higher realms, so what need is there to mention helping them?‚Äù They will completely give up the regret that is their companion.

original: de nas gnyen po bsten cing sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bkur @108b sti rnam pa mang po byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas gnyen po bsten cing sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bkur @108b sti rnam pa mang po byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, relying on the antidote, they will make many kinds of offerings to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de bas na gnod par byed pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phan pa byed pas mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur bas gnod pa byed pas mtho ris su 'gro'o zhes bya ba tha snyad 'thob po //
analyzed: de bas na gnod par byed pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phan pa byed pas mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur bas gnod pa byed pas mtho ris su 'gro'o zhes bya ba tha snyad 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, because going to the higher realms is preceded by harm, and is followed by help, the expression ‚Äúgoing to the higher realms through harm‚Äù is used.

original: ma nges pa bzlog pa sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni de la ma nges pa la bzlog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa rnams theg pa chen po las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: ma nges pa bzlog pa sgrib pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni de la ma nges pa la bzlog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa rnams theg pa chen po las bzlog pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTurning away from the indefinite‚Äù means turning away from the Mahayana those bodhisattvas who are indefinite.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa'i rigs can gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa de dag mi dge ba'i grogs po dang phrad pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de yongs su por nas nyan thos kyi theg pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa'i rigs can gang dag byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa de dag mi dge ba'i grogs po dang phrad pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de yongs su por nas nyan thos kyi theg pas mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod
translated: Those bodhisattvas of indefinite lineage who practice the bodhisattva deeds, if they encounter nonvirtuous companions, abandon the bodhisattva deeds and aspire to nirvana through the Listeners‚Äô Vehicle.

original: do // de dag gi theg pa dman pa par 'gro zhing lhung ba de ni sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: do // de dag gi theg pa dman pa par 'gro zhing lhung ba de ni sgrib pa yin te /
translated: That is an obscuration, for it causes them to go and fall to the lower vehicle.

original: de'i gnyen por 'phags pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po la sogs pa las theg pa ni gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por 'phags pa dam pa'i chos padma dkar po la sogs pa las theg pa ni gcig kho na ste /
translated: The antidote to that is the teaching in the sutra, the noble Lotus of the True Dharma and so on, that there is only one vehicle,

original: gnyis pa med do zhes theg pa yang gcig tu bshad la /
analyzed: gnyis pa med do zhes theg pa yang gcig tu bshad la /
translated: for there is no second.

original: nyan thos chen po rnams kyang sangs rgyas nyid du lung bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos chen po rnams kyang sangs rgyas nyid du lung bstan to //
translated: And the great listeners are also prophesied to attain buddhahood.

original: nyan thos lung bstan pa dag theg pa gcig bshad pa de thos nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa'i rigs can de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa yongs su bor nas theg pa chen po kho na bsten cing de kho na la sbyor bar byed do
analyzed: nyan thos lung bstan pa dag theg pa gcig bshad pa de thos nas kyang byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa'i rigs can de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa yongs su bor nas theg pa chen po kho na bsten cing de kho na la sbyor bar byed do
translated: And when they hear the predictions of the disciples, those bodhisattvas of unfixed spiritual gene, having abandoned the disciples vehicle, rely on the Great Vehicle alone and apply themselves to it.

original: // rgyu lnga ni gang gis phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar blo bzang zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ston te /
analyzed: // rgyu lnga ni gang gis phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar blo bzang zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ston te /
translated: The five causes are the five aspects of the teaching of the Dharma, which are indicated by the words of the verse: the bodhisattvas who are well intentioned, who are indefatigable, who are compassionate, who are eloquent, and who are skilled in the methods of teaching.

original: byang chub sems dpa' blo bzang pos phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' blo bzang pos phyin ci ma log par 'chad pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are well intentioned teach without error, as indicated by the words well intentioned.

original: yang dang yang du 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni skyo ba med ldan zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni skyo ba med ldan zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The indefatigable teach again and again, as indicated by the words indefatigable.

original: zad zing med pa'i sems kyis 'chad pa ni brtse ba can zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: zad zing med pa'i sems kyis 'chad pa ni brtse ba can zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The compassionate teach with a mind free of desire for material reward, as indicated by the words compassionate.

original: tshig gzung bar 'os pas 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni snyan par rab grags zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: tshig gzung bar 'os pas 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni snyan par rab grags zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The eloquent teach with words that are worthy to be remembered, as indicated by the words eloquent.üîΩThe skilled in the methods of teaching teach with a mind that is skilled in the methods of teaching, as indicated by the words skilled in the methods of teaching.

original: gdul ba dang 'tsham par 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gdul ba dang 'tsham par 'chad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Explaining in a way that is suitable to be adopted is as follows.

original: chog bzang shes ldan pa yi //
analyzed: chog bzang shes ldan pa yi //
translated: The wise one knows the right amount.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: This is what the verse means.

original: chos ston pa'i 'og tu sgrub pa'i skabs te /
analyzed: chos ston pa'i 'og tu sgrub pa'i skabs te /
translated: After teaching the Dharma, the section on practice follows.

original: 'di'i 'brel ba gang yin zhen /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel ba gang yin zhen /
translated: What is the connection?

original: gzhan la phan bsgrub pa ni chos bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la phan bsgrub pa ni chos bshad pa yin no //
translated: Teaching the Dharma is for the benefit of others.

original: bdag la phan pa bsgrub pa ni bdag nyid de'i don spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag la phan pa bsgrub pa ni bdag nyid de'i don spyod pa yin no //
translated: Practicing what one teaches is for one's own benefit.

original: gzhan dag chos yang dag par ston pa yang mang du thos pas bya dgos la rang gi don yang @109a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag chos yang dag par ston pa yang mang du thos pas bya dgos la rang gi don yang @109a * //
translated: Teaching the Dharma to others must be done with much learning, and one's own goal must be accomplished through practice.

original: bsgrubs pas bsgrub dgos pas chos ston pa'i 'og tu sgrub pa'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: bsgrubs pas bsgrub dgos pas chos ston pa'i 'og tu sgrub pa'i skabs yin no //
translated: Therefore, the section on practice follows after the section on teaching the Dharma.

original: ji skad du don kun shes shing chos kun shes nas chos dang mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: ji skad du don kun shes shing chos kun shes nas chos dang mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa yin /
translated: As it is said, having understood all meanings and all dharmas, one engages in the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: mthun par zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: mthun par zhugs pa yin /
translated: One engages in accordance with the Dharma.

original: mthun pa'i chos la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig 'di dag ni sgrub pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa drug ste zhes bya ba de la mdo'i tshig bzhin du ni tshigs su bcad pa bzhi dang / go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i chos la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig 'di dag ni sgrub pa rnam par dbye ba la tshigs su bcad pa drug ste zhes bya ba de la mdo'i tshig bzhin du ni tshigs su bcad pa bzhi dang / go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They practice the teaching that is in harmony with that.üîΩThese words of the scripture are explained in six verses beginning with:üîΩThe first four verses correspond to the first four phrases of the scripture.

original: tshig tha ma mthun pa'i chos la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba 'di ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig tha ma mthun pa'i chos la spyod pa yin zhes bya ba 'di ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The last phrase, ‚Äúthey practice the teaching that is in harmony with that,‚Äù is explained by the last two verses.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par shes pa ji ltar rnam pa gnyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med par shes pa ji ltar rnam pa gnyis yin zhe na /
translated: How is the knowledge of the selflessness of persons and of things twofold?

original: de ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ston par byed do //
translated: The verse shows that.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no object and no subject.

original: gang zag kyang gzung ba nyid 'dzin pa nyid du med la /
analyzed: gang zag kyang gzung ba nyid 'dzin pa nyid du med la /
translated: The person is not the object and not the subject.

original: byis pas kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra ba 'di ni bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: byis pas kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra ba 'di ni bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Things are also like that, in that they are imagined by the foolish. This is the twofold selflessness.

original: gang la shes she na /
analyzed: gang la shes she na /
translated: Where is this knowledge?

original: med pa dang yod pa gnyis la ste /
analyzed: med pa dang yod pa gnyis la ste /
translated: In the nonexistent and in the existent.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa la ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa la ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The concentration of emptiness is with regard to the non-existence of the imagined nature.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi kun brtags pa'i gang zag med pa dang chos med par shes so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi kun brtags pa'i gang zag med pa dang chos med par shes so //
translated: The concentration of emptiness is the knowledge that the imagined person and the imagined entity do not exist.

original: yod pa la ni smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag yin te /
analyzed: yod pa la ni smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag yin te /
translated: The concentrations of wishlessness and signlessness are with regard to existence.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la ni smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la ni smon pa med pa'o //
translated: Wishlessness is with regard to the relative.

original: yongs su grub pa la ni mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa la ni mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: Signlessness is with regard to the perfect.

original: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba nyes pa mang pos skyon can du gyur pa la smon par mi byed do //
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba nyes pa mang pos skyon can du gyur pa la smon par mi byed do //
translated: The concentration of wishlessness does not wish for the relative, which is called imagination of what is unreal, which is flawed by many faults.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni mtshan ma'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid shes so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni mtshan ma'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral ba yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid shes so //
translated: The concentration of signlessness knows the perfectly accomplished nature, which is free from all the faults of signs.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum po de ji ltar yang dag pa nyid dam log pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum po de ji ltar yang dag pa nyid dam log pa nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: How are these three concentrations neither reality nor unreality?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they depend on mundane and supramundane states.

original: de ltar na thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas don shes pa yin no //üîΩde ltar don shes pa ni chos thams cad gzings lta bur shes shing zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab la gus pa skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas don shes pa yin no // de ltar don shes pa ni chos thams cad gzings lta bur shes shing zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab la gus pa skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, through the knowledge that arises from hearing and reflection, one knows the meaning.

original: thos pa las byung ba la ni ma @109b yin no //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba la ni ma @109b yin no //
translated: One who knows the meaning in this way knows that all dharmas are like a raft, which means that respect for the wisdom that arises from reflection arises, but not for that which arises from hearing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thos pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa spong bar byed de zhes smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thos pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa spong bar byed de zhes smos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one abandons the grasping at sufficiency through mere hearing.

original: de ltar na chos shes pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos shes pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is explained that one knows the dharmas.

original: de ltar thos pa'i gnas skabs dang / bsams pa'i gnas skabs na so so'i skye bo'i shes pas don dang chos shes nas so so'i skye bo'i shes pa de rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub po //üîΩ'di skad du don dang chos de ji lta ba bzhin du thos pa dang bsams pas shes nas de'i 'og tu bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar thos pa'i gnas skabs dang / bsams pa'i gnas skabs na so so'i skye bo'i shes pas don dang chos shes nas so so'i skye bo'i shes pa de rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub po // 'di skad du don dang chos de ji lta ba bzhin du thos pa dang bsams pas shes nas de'i 'og tu bsgrub pa ste /
translated: Thus, in the stage of learning and in the stage of reflection, the ordinary being knows the meaning and the teaching with an ordinary being's knowledge. In order to purify that ordinary being's knowledge, he practices the teaching in conformity with the teaching.

original: bsgoms pas chos dang mthun pa'i chos sgrub cing ting nge 'dzin 'thob ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pas chos dang mthun pa'i chos sgrub cing ting nge 'dzin 'thob ste /
translated: In this way, having known the meaning and the teaching as they are through learning and reflection, subsequently he practices the teaching in conformity with the teaching through meditation, and attains concentration.

original: de ltar na chos dang mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos dang mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is engaged in the teaching in conformity with the teaching.

original: 'di ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i gnas skabs yin te /
translated: This is the stage of the factors conducive to penetration.

original: de'i 'og tu ni bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ro //
translated: Subsequently, he applies himself to meditation.

original: rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i ye shes kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa gang gis sa na rnam par gzhag pa shes nas de'i 'og tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis sa de yongs su sbyong bar byed cing
analyzed: rnam par 'jog par byed pa'i ye shes kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa gang gis sa na rnam par gzhag pa shes nas de'i 'og tu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis sa de yongs su sbyong bar byed cing
translated: The wisdom that establishes refers to the supramundane subsequently attained wisdom by which one knows the stages of the bodhisattva and then, by nonconceptual wisdom, one purifies those stages.

original: sa ma thob pa rnams kyang thob par byed de /
analyzed: sa ma thob pa rnams kyang thob par byed de /
translated: And one obtains those stages that have not been obtained.

original: de ltar mthun pa'i chos la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mthun pa'i chos la spyod pa yin no //
translated: Thus one practices in accord with the Dharma.üîΩThe phrase that one practices with refers to practicing in association.

original: lhan cig spyod pa yis zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brel bar spyod pa ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes bar du chod pa dang bcas pa dang / bar du chod pa med par kun tu 'byung bas so //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa yis zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brel bar spyod pa ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes bar du chod pa dang bcas pa dang / bar du chod pa med par kun tu 'byung bas so //
translated: The phrase that one practices in connection refers to the occurrence of nonconceptual wisdom and the subsequently attained wisdom that is not nonconceptual, sometimes with intervals and sometimes without intervals.

original: 'khor lo bzhis bag yod pa'i shing rta 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhis bag yod pa'i shing rta 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: The chariot of heedfulness moves on the four wheels of the four right efforts.

original: 'khor lo bzhi ni mthun pa'i yul du gnas pa dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / bdag nyid kyi yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / sngon bsod nams byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi ni mthun pa'i yul du gnas pa dang / skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / bdag nyid kyi yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / sngon bsod nams byas pa nyid do //
translated: The four wheels are: dwelling in a suitable region, relying on holy persons, one's own pure aspiration, and the performance of merit in the past.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di dag ni sgrub pa la bag yod par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di dag ni sgrub pa la bag yod par bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bzhi dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These words of the Sutra should be applied in order to the four verses on heedfulness in practice.

original: grogs bzang po ni grogs tshul khrims dang / lta ba mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te yul de na rnal 'byor pa de la grogs bzang po tshul khrims dang mthun pa dang lta ba mthun pa dag yod na de lta na yul grogs bzang po can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: grogs bzang po ni grogs tshul khrims dang / lta ba mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te yul de na rnal 'byor pa de la grogs bzang po tshul khrims dang mthun pa dang lta ba mthun pa dag yod na de lta na yul grogs bzang po can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Good companions means that one's companions are of the same moral discipline and the same views. If in that region there are good companions who are of the same moral discipline and the same views as the yogin, then that region is to be known as having good companions.

original: rnal 'byor bde ba ni nyin par 'du 'dzin nyung zhing ljan ljin nyung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bde ba ni nyin par 'du 'dzin nyung zhing ljan ljin nyung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Good for yoga means that there is little noise and little trash during the day.

original: rnal 'byor ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bsdus pa'i @110a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bsdus pa'i @110a * //
translated: Yoga is included in serenity and insight.

original: lam zung du 'brel par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: lam zung du 'brel par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The path is the union of serenity and insight.

original: gal te zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mi mthun pa'i'o phyogs spangs par gyur na de ltar na yul de rnal 'byor ba de ba can yin te /
analyzed: gal te zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mi mthun pa'i'o phyogs spangs par gyur na de ltar na yul de rnal 'byor ba de ba can yin te /
translated: When the adverse conditions of serenity and insight are abandoned, then the object is suitable for the yogin.

original: des na rnal 'byor pa de yul der sems mnyam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rnal 'byor pa de yul der sems mnyam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the yogin places his mind in equipoise on that object.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni khye'u dang bu mo'i 'du 'dzi dang skye bo khyim pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni khye'u dang bu mo'i 'du 'dzi dang skye bo khyim pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: The adverse conditions of that are the distractions of boys and girls, and the company of householders.

original: de nyin ljan ljin te lang long yin no //
analyzed: de nyin ljan ljin te lang long yin no //
translated: It is dirty during the day, and noisy at night.

original: yang na phyag dar la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na phyag dar la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Or, it is dirty with dust, etc.

original: mtshan mo sgra chung ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshan mo sgra chung ba la sogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the little noise at night, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pas ni sbrang bu mchu rings dang / sha sbrang dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul la sogs pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pas ni sbrang bu mchu rings dang / sha sbrang dang / rlung dang / nyi ma dang / sdig sbrul la sogs pa shes par bya ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúat night, etc.‚Äù indicates that the little noise is due to mosquitoes, flies, wind, sun, snakes, etc.

original: sgra ni bsam gtan gyi tsher ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni bsam gtan gyi tsher ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Noise is a thorn to concentration.

original: de las bzlog na yul rnal 'byor bde ba can yin par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog na yul rnal 'byor bde ba can yin par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of this is the domain of the yogi who is happy.

original: zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan dus su bsgom pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan dus su bsgom pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cultivation of the signs of serenity, etc., at the proper time.

original: 'di dag dus su bsgom pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag dus su bsgom pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the proper time for the cultivation of these?

original: gang gi tshe sems rgod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems rgod par 'gyur ba de'i tshe zhi gnas kyi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ro //
translated: When the mind is agitated, one should apply oneself to the cultivation of the signs of serenity.

original: gang gi tshe zhum pa de'i tshe lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhum pa de'i tshe lhag mthong gi rgyu mtshan bsgom pa la rab tu sbyor ro //
translated: When it is slack, one should apply oneself to the cultivation of the signs of special insight.

original: gang gi tshe mnyam par 'dug pa de'i tshe btang snyoms su 'jug go //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mnyam par 'dug pa de'i tshe btang snyoms su 'jug go //
translated: When it is in equipoise, one should apply oneself to equanimity.

original: de ltar na de thabs bzang po can du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de thabs bzang po can du bstan pa yin te /
translated: Thus, he is shown to be one who has good means.

original: yang dag pa'i smon lam dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i smon lam dang sbyar ro //
translated: He is endowed with right aspiration.

original: nges par 'byung ba bzang ba nyid kyis ni gang du bya ba yod pas cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba bzang ba nyid kyis ni gang du bya ba yod pas cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: By the excellence of his renunciation, he does not consider a little to be enough, since there is still more to be done.

original: sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rtag tu gus par byas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rtag tu gus par byas te /
translated: The word ‚Äúapplication‚Äù indicates that he is always respectful.

original: sbyor ba nyid ston to //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyid ston to //
translated: The author now teaches the practice.üîΩ

original: dga' ba'i rgyu nyid ces bya ba ni 'dis sngon gyi mi mthun pa'i yul na gnas na yang dga' pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i rgyu bsod nams byas pa yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rgyu nyid ces bya ba ni 'dis sngon gyi mi mthun pa'i yul na gnas na yang dga' pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i rgyu bsod nams byas pa yin no //
translated: The cause of joy is the merit that he has previously accumulated, by which he becomes the cause of joy even when living in a place that is disagreeable.

original: tshad med pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rgyu ni 'dis sngon gang gi na yang dag par 'jog pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba de lta bu bstsags pa yin te /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rgyu ni 'dis sngon gang gi na yang dag par 'jog pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba de lta bu bstsags pa yin te /
translated: The cause of the immeasurables, the concentrations, and wisdom is the accumulation that he has previously made, by which he becomes the cause of the establishment of those in the present.

original: yang dag par 'jog pa ni don thams cad 'grub po //
analyzed: yang dag par 'jog pa ni don thams cad 'grub po //
translated: The establishment of those is the accomplishment of all aims.üîΩBecause he has investigated the reality of ignorance and enlightenment.

original: ma rig pa dang byang chub kyi chos nyid de dag la nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang / byang chub kyi chos nyid gang yin pa'i chos nyid de la ma rig pa gang yin pa de nyid byang chub yin no zhes ma rig pa dang byang chub nye bar brtags te chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang byang chub kyi chos nyid de dag la nye bar brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa dang / byang chub kyi chos nyid gang yin pa'i chos nyid de la ma rig pa gang yin pa de nyid byang chub yin no zhes ma rig pa dang byang chub nye bar brtags te chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reality of ignorance and the reality of enlightenment are not different.

original: 'dod chags la sogs @110b pa de dag kho na la tshul bzhin du 'jug na de dag las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs @110b pa de dag kho na la tshul bzhin du 'jug na de dag las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one engages in those such as attachment in the correct manner, one will be liberated from them.

original: ji ltar tshul bzhin du 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul bzhin du 'jug ce na /
translated: How does one engage in them in the correct manner?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams ni mi dge ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams ni mi dge ba /
translated: One should understand that afflicted phenomena such as attachment are nonvirtuous,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rtsa ba /
translated: the root of suffering,

original: rims nad dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rims nad dang bcas pa /
translated: endowed with a disease,

original: 'khrug pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrug pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: and endowed with conflict.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i gnas lta bu dag yod na skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bas 'di dag ni spang bar bya zhing dor bar bya ba dge ba'i chos rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba yin no zhes
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i gnas lta bu dag yod na skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bas 'di dag ni spang bar bya zhing dor bar bya ba dge ba'i chos rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur ba yin no zhes
translated: If the truths of the origin of attachment and so on exist, the suffering of birth and so on will arise. Therefore they are to be abandoned and rejected. They are adverse conditions to virtuous phenomena.

original: bya bar shes par byas nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la sogs pa yang dag par bsgrubs na spong ste des na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya bar shes par byas nas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la sogs pa yang dag par bsgrubs na spong ste des na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one engages in them in the correct manner, one abandons them through correctly contemplating them and so on, and one is liberated.

original: byang chub dri med yangs pa'i bar du gcod byed min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub dri med yangs pa'i bar du gcod byed min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not an obstruction to the vast, stainless enlightenment.

original: dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Stainless means that the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience are abandoned together with their latencies.

original: yangs pa ni shes bya thams cad yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yangs pa ni shes bya thams cad yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vast means that all objects of knowledge are its domain.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi sems ni rtag tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi sems ni rtag tu rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar rung ba ma yin te /
translated: The dependent consciousness is not always suitable to be naturally luminous,

original: gang gi phyir sems de ni skad cig gcig la 'dod chags dang dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa la thog ma med pa'i dus nas zag pa dang bcas
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems de ni skad cig gcig la 'dod chags dang dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa la thog ma med pa'i dus nas zag pa dang bcas
translated: because that mind is always afflicted by being born and ceasing together with defiled phenomena such as attachment and faith, and because it is related to defiled phenomena since beginningless time.

original: pa'i chos rnams dang 'brel ba yang yin pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi sems ni rtag tu 'od gsal ba nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: pa'i chos rnams dang 'brel ba yang yin pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi sems ni rtag tu 'od gsal ba nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that the dependent consciousness is always luminous.

original: sems kyi chos nyid ni rtag tu 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyi chos nyid ni rtag tu 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: The reality of mind is always clear light.

original: der ni res 'ga' yang 'khor ba pa'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa dag gis lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rims kyis ma rnyogs pa yin no //
analyzed: der ni res 'ga' yang 'khor ba pa'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa dag gis lhan cig skye ba dang 'gag pa'i rims kyis ma rnyogs pa yin no //
translated: It is never obscured by the simultaneous arising and cessation of the dharmas of cyclic existence, which are accompanied by the outflows.

original: de lta bas na de kho na rtag tu 'od gsal ba nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de kho na rtag tu 'od gsal ba nyid du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that reality is always clear light.üîΩThe Bhagavat has said,

original: sems can rnams la phan byed phyir //üîΩde la chags skyes ltung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan byed phyir // de la chags skyes ltung mi 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva who is skilled in meansüîΩand is not separated from the perfection of wisdom

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la byams pa gang yin pa ni 'dir 'dod chags su dgongs te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la byams shing dga' ba gang yin pa de ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la byams pa gang yin pa ni 'dir 'dod chags su dgongs te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la byams shing dga' ba gang yin pa de ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i
translated: is not defiled by the actions of cyclic existence,üîΩeven though he practices for the sake of sentient beings.üîΩThe bodhisattva‚Äôs love for sentient beings is considered here to be attachment.

original: phyir phan pa yin te /
analyzed: phyir phan pa yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs love and joy for sentient beings is beneficial for the purpose of bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: des na de dag la des byas pa'i ltung ba dgag go //
analyzed: des na de dag la des byas pa'i ltung ba dgag go //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva is not defiled by the actions of cyclic existence.

original: khong khro ba las skyes pa'i ltung ba ni nyes pa mang ste /
analyzed: khong khro ba las skyes pa'i ltung ba ni nyes pa mang ste /
translated: The downfall that arises from anger has many faults.

original: 'di ltar yid kyi nyes pa ni @111a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid kyi nyes pa ni @111a * //
translated: Thus, the fault of the mind

original: rang bzhin gyis skyon chags pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis skyon chags pa yin no //
translated: is by nature defective.

original: de ltar re zhig byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba la sems can thams cad las 'dod chags las skyes pa'i ltung ba rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba la sems can thams cad las 'dod chags las skyes pa'i ltung ba rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: Thus, a monk bodhisattva does not commit a downfall from attachment to any sentient being.

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i bu dang chung ma la sogs pa la byams pas byas pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de yang ha cang nyes pa mang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i bu dang chung ma la sogs pa la byams pas byas pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa de yang ha cang nyes pa mang ba ma yin te /
translated: But the attachment of a householder bodhisattva to his children, wife, and so on, which is produced by love, is not very faulty.

original: 'dod chags kyis ni sems can yongs su gtang ba med la /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis ni sems can yongs su gtang ba med la /
translated: For, there is no abandonment of sentient beings because of attachment,

original: khong khro ba ni yongs su gtang ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: khong khro ba ni yongs su gtang ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: but there is abandonment because of anger.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' la ni khong khro bas byas pa kho na'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag gi 'dod chags las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' la ni khong khro bas byas pa kho na'i ltung ba rnam par gzhag gi 'dod chags las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a downfall is posited only for a bodhisattva who is angry, not for one who is attached.

original: gang gi phyir don byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don byed de /
translated: Because he acts for the sake of others.

original: phyir sgyu sems 'gal zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyir sgyu sems 'gal zhes bya ba la /
translated: The thought of deceit is contradictory to that.

original: sgyu ni g-yo yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ni g-yo yin te /
translated: Deceit is fraud.

original: 'di ltar don bsgrub par 'dod la de g-yo dang sgyu dang dor dang thabs la sogs pas gzhan slu bar byed do zhes bya ba de ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar don bsgrub par 'dod la de g-yo dang sgyu dang dor dang thabs la sogs pas gzhan slu bar byed do zhes bya ba de ni 'gal lo //
translated: It is contradictory to say that one who desires to accomplish the aims of others deceives others by fraud, deceit, pretense, and trickery.üîΩJust as a patient, after examining and investigating a good medicine, such as myrobalan, etc.,

original: ji ltar nad pa sman bzang po kha zhing tsha ba la sogs pa la yang so sor brtags shing so sor brtags nas 'jug pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'khor ba la so sor brtags nas yongs su mi 'dor bar 'jug go zhes bya bar
analyzed: ji ltar nad pa sman bzang po kha zhing tsha ba la sogs pa la yang so sor brtags shing so sor brtags nas 'jug pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang 'khor ba la so sor brtags nas yongs su mi 'dor bar 'jug go zhes bya bar
translated: takes it, so a bodhisattva, after examining samsara, does not abandon it, but enters it.

original: sbyar ro // ji ltar sman pa phan par 'dod pas nad pa la bsgrubs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' phan par 'dod pa sman pa lta bu yang sems can nad pa lta bu rnams la bsgrub po //
analyzed: sbyar ro // ji ltar sman pa phan par 'dod pas nad pa la bsgrubs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' phan par 'dod pa sman pa lta bu yang sems can nad pa lta bu rnams la bsgrub po //
translated: Just as a physician, desiring to help, treats a sick person, so a bodhisattva, desiring to help, treats sentient beings who are like sick persons.

original: ji ltar na rje bo bran ma grub pa la grub par bya ba'i phyir bsgrubs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang bdag nyid la sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar na rje bo bran ma grub pa la grub par bya ba'i phyir bsgrubs pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang bdag nyid la sgrub par byed de /
translated: Just as a master, desiring to help, treats a servant who is not well-trained in order to train him, so a bodhisattva treats himself.

original: sems la bdag nyid ces nye bar btags so //
analyzed: sems la bdag nyid ces nye bar btags so //
translated: The mind is designated as the self.

original: sems ma grub pa la grub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub ste /
analyzed: sems ma grub pa la grub par bya ba'i phyir sgrub ste /
translated: In order to establish the mind which is not established, one practices.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa las /
translated: As it is said in the noble Ratnaku·π≠a:

original: 'od srungs 'di lta ste /üîΩrta mkhan mkhas pas ni gang dang gang du rta 'brum pa'am /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di lta ste / rta mkhan mkhas pas ni gang dang gang du rta 'brum pa'am /
translated: KƒÅ≈õyapa, it is like this:

original: mi srun par gyur pa de dang der de tshar gcod par byed do //
analyzed: mi srun par gyur pa de dang der de tshar gcod par byed do //
translated: A skilled horse trainer subdues a wild horse in whatever way is necessary.

original: de bzhin du dge slong rnal 'byor spyod pa yang gang dang gang kho nar sems 'gyur bar mthong ba de dang de kho nar de tshar gcad pa'i phyir sgrub ste /

analyzed: tshong pa rnams rang dar bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bu dang chung ma'i don du sred pas kyang zong sgrub par byed pas de ni 'dir mi sbyar gyi /

analyzed: 'dir ni dar ba tsam zhig chos dang mthun pa yin te /

original: de dang 'dra bar ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar ro //

analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams kyi longs spyod 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir yul de dag sgrub po //

analyzed: yid brtan pa ni 'dir dkor gyi bla lta bu ste dkor spyan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: rtag tu brtson 'grus dang ldan pa nyid ni rtag tu rgyun chags pas so //

analyzed: de'i tshe chos kyi rgyun la sangs rgyas rnams las gdams ngag 'ji lta bu zhig 'thob ce na //

analyzed: rgya chen po ste /

original: sar gtogs par btub pa yin no //
analyzed: sar gtogs par btub pa yin no //

analyzed: de nas dang por sdom brtson de //

analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i sems ni mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi ming la dmigs pa gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: gdams ngag thob nas sam /

analyzed: bdag nyid kyis brtags nas 'di lta ste /

original: de la bgrang ba ni grangs 'dzin pa ste /

original: rtog pa ni tshad mas rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni tshad mas rtog pa'o //

analyzed: so sor rtog pa ni bgrang ba dang / gzhal ba dang brtags pa'i don la blta ba'o //

analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba'i don kyang rung /üîΩgang gi don du rab tu brtson pa de la 'dun pa dang lhan cig 'byung ngo //
translated: or for the meaning of progress.

original: 'di sems kho na dmigs par snang bar 'byung gi / sems las ma gtogs pa'i dmigs pa ni med do zhes sems tsam du shes kyang rung ma shes kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di sems kho na dmigs par snang bar 'byung gi / sems las ma gtogs pa'i dmigs pa ni med do zhes sems tsam du shes kyang rung ma shes kyang rung ste /
translated: The statement, ‚Äúit is the investigation‚Äù is a synonym for the conceptualization that is the thorough search.üîΩAs the Characteristics of the Obscurations states:üîΩWhat is conceptualization?

original: dmigs pa ni sems yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin pas sems rnam pa drug po dmigs par snang bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni sems yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin pas sems rnam pa drug po dmigs par snang bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is the thorough search that is based on either thought or wisdom.üîΩIt is the gross form of mind.

original: btsal bya zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa bshad do //
analyzed: btsal bya zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa bshad do //

analyzed: tshol ba zhes bya 'di ni kun tu tshol ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i ming gi rnam grangs yin te /
translated: The statement, ‚Äúit is the investigation‚Äù is a synonym for the conceptualization that is the thorough search.üîΩAs the Characteristics of the Obscurations states:

original: rtog pa'i mtshan nyid las ji skad du /
analyzed: rtog pa'i mtshan nyid las ji skad du /

analyzed: rtog pa gang zhe na / sems pa'am shes rab la brten nas kun tu tshol ba yin gyi brjod pa ste /
translated: What is conceptualization?üîΩIt is the thorough search that is based on either thought or wisdom.üîΩIt is the gross form of mind.üîΩThe statement, ‚Äúit is the object of investigation‚Äù explains the mental attention that is accompanied by investigation and analysis.

original: sems rags pa gang yin pa'o zhes @113a * //
analyzed: sems rags pa gang yin pa'o zhes @113a * //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúit is the investigation‚Äù is a synonym for the conceptualization that is the thorough search.

original: bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As the Characteristics of the Obscurations states:üîΩWhat is conceptualization?üîΩIt is the thorough search that is based on either thought or wisdom.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni /

original: dus kyis ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa ni de bzhin du bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du skad cig ma re re la sbyin par byed ces gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dus kyis ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa ni de bzhin du bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du skad cig ma re re la sbyin par byed ces gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: The thought of being insatiable with regard to time is as follows: It is explained that one should give in every instant for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river.

original: sems can rnams la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa ni sems can gcig la ji lta ba bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par bya ba'i sems can gyi khams ji snyed pa de dag la rnam grangs 'dis
analyzed: sems can rnams la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa ni sems can gcig la ji lta ba bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par bya ba'i sems can gyi khams ji snyed pa de dag la rnam grangs 'dis
translated: The thought of being insatiable with regard to sentient beings is as follows: Just as one does for one sentient being, one should give in this way to the realm of sentient beings who are to be brought to full maturity in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: sbyin par byed kyang /
analyzed: sbyin par byed kyang /
translated: Although one gives in this way,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i bsam pa la ngoms pa med pa nyid ces bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa'i bsam pa la ngoms pa med pa nyid ces bshad pa yin te /
translated: it is explained that the bodhisattva is not satisfied with the thought of giving.

original: de ni mdor bsdu na dngos pos ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa dang / bdag nyid yongs su gtang ba ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa dang / dus kyis ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa dang / sems can rnams la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na dngos pos ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa dang / bdag nyid yongs su gtang ba ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa dang / dus kyis ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa dang / sems can rnams la ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: In brief, they are the attitude of not being satisfied with things, the attitude of not being satisfied with giving up the self, the attitude of not being satisfied with time, and the attitude of not being satisfied with sentient beings.

original: nyams par mi byed ces bya ba ni skad cig ma 'dab chags su zin kyang gal te na dus chung zad cig 'jug srid pas de yongs su spang ba'i phyir byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du rgyun gcod par mi byed ces bya ba smos
analyzed: nyams par mi byed ces bya ba ni skad cig ma 'dab chags su zin kyang gal te na dus chung zad cig 'jug srid pas de yongs su spang ba'i phyir byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du rgyun gcod par mi byed ces bya ba smos
translated: Not being interrupted means that even if there is a break in the continuity of the moments, if there is a possibility of engaging in it for a little while, in order to completely eliminate that, it is said that it is not interrupted until one sits on the seat of enlightenment.

original: so // de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nye bar ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems can de dag la de ltar phan btags na byang chub nye bar ston par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: so // de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub nye bar ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems can de dag la de ltar phan btags na byang chub nye bar ston par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because they show the nearness of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment means that if one benefits sentient beings in that way, enlightenment will be shown to be near.

original: lus gcig gis sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ni ha cang dka' ba ma yin pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyis zhes bya ba smos te mang ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: lus gcig gis sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ni ha cang dka' ba ma yin pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i lus gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyis zhes bya ba smos te mang ba nyid du ston to //
translated: Since it is not very difficult to experience suffering with one body, therefore it says, ‚Äúwith as many bodies as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river.‚Äù

original: lus mang du zin kyang tshe'i tshad lo brgya la sogs par sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ni ha cang dka' ba ma yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: lus mang du zin kyang tshe'i tshad lo brgya la sogs par sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba ni ha cang dka' ba ma yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Even with many bodies, it is not very difficult to experience suffering for a life span of a hundred years, and so on. Therefore it says,

original: tshe'i tshad bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: tshe'i tshad bskal pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: ‚Äúfor a life span of as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges river.‚Äù

original: rtag par yo byad thams cad kyis phongs bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams me ma mur gyis rab tu gang bar zhes bya ba ni mes bsregs pa la me zhi bar byed pa'i yo byad chu dang / tsandan dang byug pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis phongs pa ste /
analyzed: rtag par yo byad thams cad kyis phongs bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams me ma mur gyis rab tu gang bar zhes bya ba ni mes bsregs pa la me zhi bar byed pa'i yo byad chu dang / tsandan dang byug pa la sogs pa thams cad kyis phongs pa ste /
translated: Constantly lacking all resources, in a world system of a billion worlds filled with fire, means that, in order to extinguish the fire that burns with fire, one lacks all resources such as water, sandalwood, ointments, and so on.

original: sreg pa la gnyen por gyur pa chu la sogs pa de dag med par ro //
analyzed: sreg pa la gnyen por gyur pa chu la sogs pa de dag med par ro //
translated: The absence of water, etc. which are antidotes to burning.

original: de ltar sreg kyang gal te @120a * //
analyzed: de ltar sreg kyang gal te @120a * //
translated: Thus, even though one is burning,

original: spyod lam 'ga' zhig gis te /
analyzed: spyod lam 'ga' zhig gis te /
translated: if one is in some posture,

original: 'dug pa'am nyal ba la me'i tsha ba ha cang bya dka' ba ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dug pa'am nyal ba la me'i tsha ba ha cang bya dka' ba ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: sitting or lying down, the heat of the fire is not too difficult to bear.

original: spyod lam rnam pa bzhi byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩspyod lam bzhi la zhugs pa'i yang tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs par gyur na ni ha cang bya dka' ba ma yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: spyod lam rnam pa bzhi byed cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // spyod lam bzhi la zhugs pa'i yang tshul khrims kyi phung po la sogs pa mtha' dag yongs su rdzogs par gyur na ni ha cang bya dka' ba ma yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúwhile engaging in the four postures, etc.‚Äù

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i skad cig ma gcig sgom par byed cing zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i skad cig ma gcig sgom par byed cing zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If one is engaged in the four postures and has perfected the entire aggregate of morality, etc., it is not too difficult. Therefore, he says, ‚Äúwhile cultivating the perfection of morality, etc. in a single moment.‚Äù

original: rnam grangs 'dis na byang chub sems dpa'i ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis na byang chub sems dpa'i ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa nyid yin no //
translated: By this enumeration, the bodhisattva‚Äôs attitude is insatiable.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin pa na zhes bya ba ji ltar na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rjes su 'dzin ce na /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin pa na zhes bya ba ji ltar na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rjes su 'dzin ce na /
translated: How does the perfection of morality take care of sentient beings?

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams la srog gcod pa la sogs pa lhag par mi spyod de ;
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems can rnams la srog gcod pa la sogs pa lhag par mi spyod de ;
translated: By the morality of restraint, one does not engage in killing, etc., for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de ltar na de dag rjes su bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag rjes su bzung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, they are taken care of.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyang sems can gyi don kho na yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyang sems can gyi don kho na yin no //
translated: The morality of gathering virtuous factors for the bodhisattvas is also for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims ni des dngos po kho nar sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims ni des dngos po kho nar sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin te /
translated: The morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings takes care of sentient beings by means of the very things.

original: de ltar tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyis kyang rjes su bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyis kyang rjes su bzung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, they are taken care of by the three kinds of morality.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa thabs la brten pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag par so sor rtog pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa thabs la brten pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum yongs su dag par so sor rtog pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of the perfections in dependence on method is threefold.

original: sbyin pa po mi dmigs zhes bya bas ni gang zag la bdag med par ston to//
analyzed: sbyin pa po mi dmigs zhes bya bas ni gang zag la bdag med par ston to//
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe bodhisattva does not apprehend a giver‚Äù shows the selflessness of persons.

original: 'dis ni bdag mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de mi 'byung ngo //
translated: This shows that the conception of a self does not occur.

original: sbyin par bya ba dang len pa po mi dmigs zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos la bdag med par ston te /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba dang len pa po mi dmigs zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos la bdag med par ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe bodhisattva does not apprehend something to be given‚Äù shows the selflessness of phenomena.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yongs su bzung bas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa dang / 'di la ni sbyin no zhes 'di la ni mi sbyin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa len pa po la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yongs su bzung bas dngos po la mngon par zhen pa dang / 'di la ni sbyin no zhes 'di la ni mi sbyin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa len pa po la mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since the bodhisattva has taken up nonconceptual wisdom, the conception of a thing and the conception of a recipient, such as ‚ÄúI will give to this one but not to that one,‚Äù do not occur.

original: yang na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir de gsum char yang mi 'byung bas yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid mchog yin no //
analyzed: yang na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob pa'i phyir de gsum char yang mi 'byung bas yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid mchog yin no //
translated: Or else, because of the attainment of nonconceptual intuition, all three are absent, and thus the absence of appropriation is the highest.üîΩ Mastery of the body should be recognized as the two bodies of the Tathagata, the essential body and the beatific body.

original: sku la dbang 'byor pa nyid ni @120b de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis po ngo bo nyid kyi dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku 'di gnyis ni dbang 'byor pa thun mong ma yin pa brnyes pa ste /
analyzed: sku la dbang 'byor pa nyid ni @120b de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis po ngo bo nyid kyi dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i yin par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sku 'di gnyis ni dbang 'byor pa thun mong ma yin pa brnyes pa ste /
translated: These two bodies of the Tathagatas are the attainment of the uncommon mastery.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha' lta bu dbang 'byor ba brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i phyir nam mkha' lta bu dbang 'byor ba brnyes pa yin no //
translated: The essential body of the Tathagatas is the attainment of mastery like space, because it is unobstructed in all its activities which are to be known by each one individually.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du theg pa chen po'i chos thun mong ma yin pa la rdzogs par longs spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'byor pa ston pas dbang 'byor ba brnyes pa yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du theg pa chen po'i chos thun mong ma yin pa la rdzogs par longs spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'byor pa ston pas dbang 'byor ba brnyes pa yin no //
translated: The enjoyment body is the enjoyment of the unshared Mahayana Dharma in the circle of the Buddha's retinue, and it is the attainment of mastery by demonstrating the Buddha's wealth.üîΩThe cause is the intention that is innate with nonattachment and so on.

original: rgyu ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa'o zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa'o zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i sems pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu yin te /
translated: The cause is the intention that is innate with nonattachment, nonaversion and nonignorance.

original: rgyu 'dis sbyin pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: rgyu 'dis sbyin pa la 'jug go //
translated: By this cause one engages in generosity.üîΩAs it occurs in the Sutra on the Five Points.

original: gnas lnga pa'i mdo las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la zas byin na gnas lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas lnga pa'i mdo las byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la zas byin na gnas lnga 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: As it occurs in the Sutra on the Five Points, when one gives food to others, one obtains five things:

original: tshe dang kha dog dang stobs dang bde ba dang lnga pa ni spobs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshe dang kha dog dang stobs dang bde ba dang lnga pa ni spobs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: long life, good color, strength, happiness and the fifth is eloquence.

original: de ni 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu yin no //
translated: That is the result.

original: gnyis rjes su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis rjes su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rang dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The second is called ‚Äúcaring for others‚Äù because it cares for oneself and others.

original: rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rdzogs par byed pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: The third is called ‚Äúperfection‚Äù because it perfects the accumulations for great enlightenment.

original: 'di ni las yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni las yin no //
translated: This is its activity.

original: de yang ser sna med pa dang ldan zhes bya ba ni sems can ser sna med pa dag las yod de 'di ni ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang ser sna med pa dang ldan zhes bya ba ni sems can ser sna med pa dag las yod de 'di ni ldan pa yin no //
translated: It is also called ‚Äúgenerosity of the fearless‚Äù because it is possessed by those who are not stingy.

original: chos dang zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa la mthong zhes bya ba'i bdun pa ni gsum pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: chos dang zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa la mthong zhes bya ba'i bdun pa ni gsum pa'i don yin no //
translated: The seventh case is used in ‚Äúgenerosity of the Dharma, of material goods, and of fearlessness‚Äù because it is the object of the generosity.üîΩThe six limbs are:üîΩto abide with morality;üîΩto be restrained by the pratimoksa vows;üîΩto have perfect conduct;

original: yan lag drug ni tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / khan ma thob phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
analyzed: yan lag drug ni tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / khan ma thob phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
translated: to have a perfect range of activity;üîΩto see danger in the slightest transgression;

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la yang dag par bslangs te slob pa yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la yang dag par bslangs te slob pa yin no //
translated: and to train in the bases of training.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsams pas yang dag par len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu can gyi tshul khrims yang dag par @121a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsams pas yang dag par len pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu can gyi tshul khrims yang dag par @121a * //
translated: Because one takes up morality with the thought of nirvana.

original: len par byed de /üîΩdper na zas kyi gnas so //
analyzed: len par byed de / dper na zas kyi gnas so //
translated: One takes up morality that is a cause of nirvana.üîΩFor example, one understands that food is the basis of life,üîΩand that knowledge is the basis of wisdom.

original: rig pa gnas so zhes bya ba ni zas kyi rgyu can dang rig pa'i rgyu can du gnas pa yin par khong du chud pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu can gyi tshul khrims yang dag par len pa yin no //
analyzed: rig pa gnas so zhes bya ba ni zas kyi rgyu can dang rig pa'i rgyu can du gnas pa yin par khong du chud pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu can gyi tshul khrims yang dag par len pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, one takes up morality that is a cause of nirvana.üîΩIt is peace because it pacifies the torment of the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba zhi bas zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par gnon par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba zhi bas zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par gnon par byed do //
translated: By taking up morality, one suppresses the defilements.

original: de nas tshul khrims la legs par brten nas bsam gtan thob par re zhig tsam spong la /
analyzed: de nas tshul khrims la legs par brten nas bsam gtan thob par re zhig tsam spong la /
translated: Then, having well taken up morality, one obtains concentration and abandons the defilements.

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi sa bon kun nas bcom pas bcom pa'i sgo nas de gtan du spong ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi sa bon kun nas bcom pas bcom pa'i sgo nas de gtan du spong ste /
translated: It is abandoned permanently by the complete destruction of the seed of the wisdom of the ƒÅryas.

original: de ltar na nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba zhi bas zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba zhi bas zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called ‚Äúpeace‚Äù because the torment of the afflictions is pacified.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen can gyis 'jigs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang khon rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i rkyen can gang dag yin pa ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rkyen can gyis 'jigs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang khon rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i rkyen can gang dag yin pa ste /
translated: It is ‚Äúfearless‚Äù because fear and the danger of committing misdeeds and creating enmity do not arise due to the conditions of killing and so on.

original: de'i rgyu can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i rgyu can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are caused by that.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'jigs pa dang mya ngan la sogs pa mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang mya ngan la sogs pa mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: Fear, sorrow, and so on do not arise.

original: de dag ni de'i rtsa ba can yin pas de dang bral ba'i phyir de dag kyang med de /
analyzed: de dag ni de'i rtsa ba can yin pas de dang bral ba'i phyir de dag kyang med de /
translated: Since they have that as their root, they do not exist because one is free from them.

original: de bzhin du srog gcod pa la sogs pas sems can dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba gang yin pa de yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du srog gcod pa la sogs pas sems can dmyal ba la sogs par 'gro ba gang yin pa de yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Likewise, the karma of taking life, etc. that would lead to the hells, etc. does not occur.

original: mi dge ba byed pa srog gcod pa pa de nyid la sha khon du 'dzin pa rnams tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir de la mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba byed pa srog gcod pa pa de nyid la sha khon du 'dzin pa rnams tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir de la mi 'byung ste /

translated: Thus, the morality of the absorptions and the undefiling vows and the morality of gathering virtuous factors are considered to be meditative equipoise.üîΩBecause the absorptions and wisdom that is in accordance with reality are meditative equipoise,

translated: Attachment to procrastination in patience is
