analyzed: bshol zhing bzod par byed kyi myur du ma yin pa dang / bsdigs nas bzod pa byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: patience that is delayed, not immediate, and patience that is given under duress.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa ni zhe sdang yang dag par ma bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa ni zhe sdang yang dag par ma bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment to the adverse side is attachment to the non-eradication of hatred.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni le lo'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni le lo'o //
translated: The adverse side of effort is laziness.

original: de la chags pa gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa ste /
analyzed: de la chags pa gang yin pa de ni brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa ste /
translated: Attachment to that is attachment to the adverse side of effort.

original: de la chags pa yang rtag tu le lo can las ngan pa'i mtha' la sbyor zhing 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: de la chags pa yang rtag tu le lo can las ngan pa'i mtha' la sbyor zhing 'dug pa yin no //
translated: That attachment always causes the lazy to be bound to the lower realms.

original: bshol ba la chags pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams la myur du mi 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: bshol ba la chags pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams la myur du mi 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Attachment to procrastination is not quickly engaging in virtuous dharmas.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa ni le lo rab tu mi spong ba yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa ni le lo rab tu mi spong ba yin no //
translated: Attachment to the adverse side is not abandoning laziness.

original: bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: The adverse side of meditative concentration is distraction.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba la chags pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba la chags pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gtan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa ste /
translated: Attachment to distraction is attachment to the adverse side of meditative concentration.

original: ji srid du rnam par g-yengs zhing kha phyir bltas pa de srid du mnyam par gzhag pa mi 'thob po //
analyzed: ji srid du rnam par g-yengs zhing kha phyir bltas pa de srid du mnyam par gzhag pa mi 'thob po //
translated: As long as one is distracted and looks outward, one does not attain meditative equipoise.

original: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'chal ba'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'chal ba'i shes rab ste /
translated: The adverse side of wisdom is faulty wisdom.

original: shes rab 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of increasing wisdom,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya ba la brtson par mi byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya ba la brtson par mi byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni shes rab kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la chags pa yin no //
translated: one does not strive to serve and honor spiritual friends. This is attachment to the adverse side of wisdom.

original: de las bzlog pa ni ma chags pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni ma chags pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is nonattachment.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig 'don dang 'bri dang spyod pa dang // gzhan la 'dri zhing thos pa 'dzin byed pa //üîΩde yi blo ni nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis //
analyzed: gang zhig 'don dang 'bri dang spyod pa dang // gzhan la 'dri zhing thos pa 'dzin byed pa // de yi blo ni nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis //
translated: and hears and retains for others,üîΩhis mind opens like a lotus

original: padma bzhin du rnam par kha phye'o //üîΩzhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: padma bzhin du rnam par kha phye'o // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: by the light of the sun.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i 'og tu yon tan gyi skabs te /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i 'og tu yon tan gyi skabs te /
translated: After the analysis, the topic of virtues.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so so la yon tan rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so so la yon tan rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The perfections of giving and so on have four virtues each.

original: yon tan rnam pa bzhi ni rgya che ba nyid dang / zang zing med pa nyid dang / don chen po nyid dang ; mi zad pa nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bzhi ni rgya che ba nyid dang / zang zing med pa nyid dang / don chen po nyid dang ; mi zad pa nyid do //
translated: The four virtues are: vastness, disinterestedness, benefit, and inexhaustibility.

original: de la rtsa ba dang pos ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgya che ba nyid bshad do //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba dang pos ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgya che ba nyid bshad do //
translated: The first root explains the vastness of the perfection of giving.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sangs rgyas sras rnams slong dang phrad nas rang gi srog kyang rtag tu gtong //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras rnams slong dang phrad nas rang gi srog kyang rtag tu gtong //
translated: The Buddha's spiritual heir, meeting a petitioner, always gives even his own life.

original: zhes bya bas de ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas de ston to //
translated: This shows it.

original: rang gi srog sbyin par yongs su bsgrags pas phyi rol gyi @123b dngos po lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: rang gi srog sbyin par yongs su bsgrags pas phyi rol gyi @123b dngos po lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention external things?

original: ji skad du slob dpon ma khol gyi zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du slob dpon ma khol gyi zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: As Master Matrceta says:

original: nyid kyi sha yang btang gyur na //
analyzed: nyid kyi sha yang btang gyur na //
translated: Even your own flesh you gave away,

original: dngos po gzhan lta smos ci 'tshal //üîΩzhes bshad pa la bu'o //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan lta smos ci 'tshal // zhes bshad pa la bu'o //
translated: What need to mention other things.

original: rang gi srog de yang res 'ga' zhig yongs su gtong ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi srog de yang res 'ga' zhig yongs su gtong ba ma yin gyi /
translated: And it is not that you sometimes give away your own life.

original: slong ba po gang gi tshe srog don du gnyer ba de kho na'i tshe /
analyzed: slong ba po gang gi tshe srog don du gnyer ba de kho na'i tshe /
translated: When a beggar is in need of your life,

original: dpyad pa med par sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: dpyad pa med par sbyin par byed do //
translated: you give it without hesitation.

original: rang gi srog sbyin pa smos pas /
analyzed: rang gi srog sbyin pa smos pas /
translated: By mentioning the giving of your own life,

original: yan lag dang nyid lag sbyin pa ni dpyad du yang med pa nyid de /
analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag sbyin pa ni dpyad du yang med pa nyid de /
translated: the giving of your major and minor body parts is also implied, for they are not even considered.

original: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i rgya che ba nyid bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni sbyin pa'i rgya che ba nyid bshad do //
translated: This explains the greatness of generosity.

original: snying rjes gzhan las lan kyang mi re 'dod pa'i 'bras bu don mi gnyer //
analyzed: snying rjes gzhan las lan kyang mi re 'dod pa'i 'bras bu don mi gnyer //
translated: Out of compassion, you do not expect a reward from others, nor do you seek a desirable result.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa'i zang zing med pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa'i zang zing med pa nyid bstan te /
translated: This shows the disinterestedness of generosity.

original: rgyud snying rjes brlan pa ni slong ba po rnams la rang gi srog kyang sbyin par byed cing de dag las lan kyang mi re la /
analyzed: rgyud snying rjes brlan pa ni slong ba po rnams la rang gi srog kyang sbyin par byed cing de dag las lan kyang mi re la /
translated: The continuum is moistened with compassion, since one gives one's life even to beggars, and one does not expect any reward from them.

original: 'bras bu dbang phyug la sogs pa yang don du mi gnyer ro //üîΩsbyin pa gang zhig lan la lta ba'am /
analyzed: 'bras bu dbang phyug la sogs pa yang don du mi gnyer ro // sbyin pa gang zhig lan la lta ba'am /
translated: And one does not seek any result, such as lordship, etc.üîΩThat generosity which is practiced with an eye to reward

original: 'bras bu la lta bas sbyin par byed pa de ni srid pas bdag gir byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu la lta bas sbyin par byed pa de ni srid pas bdag gir byas pa yin no //
translated: or with an eye to results is appropriated by existence.

original: des bdag gir byas pa'i sbyin pa ni 'khor bar ltung ba kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: des bdag gir byas pa'i sbyin pa ni 'khor bar ltung ba kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The generosity which is appropriated by that is defiled by the sin of falling into cyclic existence.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i gos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i gos pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: That is the bodhisattva's generosity with outflows.

original: de las bzlog pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is without sin.

original: rtsa ba gnyis pa 'dis ni snying rjes yongs su zin pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i zang zing med pa nyid bshad do //
analyzed: rtsa ba gnyis pa 'dis ni snying rjes yongs su zin pa'i phyir sbyin pa'i zang zing med pa nyid bshad do //
translated: This second root explains the absence of materiality in generosity because it is completely taken hold of by compassion.

original: sbyin pa de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
analyzed: sbyin pa de nyid kyis kyang skye bo thams cad byang chub gsum la bkod //
translated: And by that very generosity, he establishes all beings in the three enlightenments.

original: ces bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa'i don chen po nyid bstan te /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa'i don chen po nyid bstan te /
translated: This shows the greatness of the gift.

original: skye bo thams cad skal ba ji lta ba bzhin byang chub gsum la bkod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtheg pa gang yang rung ba zhig yongs su btang ba'am /
analyzed: skye bo thams cad skal ba ji lta ba bzhin byang chub gsum la bkod pa'i phyir ro // theg pa gang yang rung ba zhig yongs su btang ba'am /
translated: It is great because it establishes all beings in the three enlightenments according to their lot.

original: sems can gang yang rung ba zhig yongs su btang bas ni /üîΩdon chen po nyid du mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir skye bo thams cad kyang smos la /
analyzed: sems can gang yang rung ba zhig yongs su btang bas ni / don chen po nyid du mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir skye bo thams cad kyang smos la /
translated: The greatness of the gift is not due to the giving of any one vehicle or to the giving of any one being.

original: theg pa sum char yang smos so //
analyzed: theg pa sum char yang smos so //
translated: Therefore, all beings are mentioned and all three vehicles.üîΩThe gift is established in the world as inexhaustible.

original: 'jig rten dag na mi zad bzhag / ces bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa mi zad pa nyid yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na mi zad bzhag / ces bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa mi zad pa nyid yongs su bstan to //
translated: This shows the inexhaustibility of the gift.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it inexhaustible?

original: re zhig ji ltar 'jig rten pa dag sbyin pa sbyin pa ltar gal te byang chub sems dpa' yang de kho na ltar sbyin par byed na ni dbang phyug dang / mtho ris dang / gzugs bzang po la sogs pas @124a * //
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar 'jig rten pa dag sbyin pa sbyin pa ltar gal te byang chub sems dpa' yang de kho na ltar sbyin par byed na ni dbang phyug dang / mtho ris dang / gzugs bzang po la sogs pas @124a * //
translated: If the bodhisattva gives in the same way that worldly people give, then the gift would be exhausted in the same way.

original: kyang bdag gir byas pa'i phyir 'khor bar ltung bas te /
analyzed: kyang bdag gir byas pa'i phyir 'khor bar ltung bas te /
translated: because of appropriating them, one falls into cyclic existence.

original: de ni rnam par smin pa zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par smin pa zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is exhausted by the exhaustion of the karmic maturation.

original: 'on te nyan thos lta bur 'khor bas 'jigs shing 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs la mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bas rang grol bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin par byed na de yang phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zad pas zadüîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te nyan thos lta bur 'khor bas 'jigs shing 'khor ba la rgyab kyis phyogs la mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bas rang grol bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin par byed na de yang phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one gives in order to liberate oneself, fearing cyclic existence like the Sravakas, turning one's back on cyclic existence and leaning toward nirvana, that is exhausted by the exhaustion of the nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de gnyis ka yongs su spangs nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed do //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni de gnyis ka yongs su spangs nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pas sbyin pa sbyin par byed do // de nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattvas, having completely abandoned both of those, give gifts through being filled with nonconceptual intuition.

original: mi zad pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: mi zad pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: Therefore, it is shown that they are inexhaustible by way of not abiding in cyclic existence or in nirvana.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply this also to morality, etc.

original: sangs rgyas sras rnams shin tu bya dka' de bzhin mi yi gnod kun bzod //üîΩces bya ba ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras rnams shin tu bya dka' de bzhin mi yi gnod kun bzod // ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: The buddhas' spiritual heir endures all the harm that people do, and even what is very difficult to endure.üîΩThis is the patience of not retaliating for injuries, because one does not retaliate for the injuries that people do, even when one is greatly harmed.

original: sems can gyi don la rab tu sbyor ba la sdug bsngal gang dag 'byung ba de dag la ji mi snyam par byed cing sdug bsngal de rtsis la ma chags par byas nas sems can gyi don bya ba dag la 'jug go //
analyzed: sems can gyi don la rab tu sbyor ba la sdug bsngal gang dag 'byung ba de dag la ji mi snyam par byed cing sdug bsngal de rtsis la ma chags par byas nas sems can gyi don bya ba dag la 'jug go //
translated: The patience of accepting suffering is the patience of accepting the suffering that arises in working for the welfare of living beings.

original: de bzhin mi yi gnod kun bzod ces bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin mi yi gnod kun bzod ces bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: The patience of enduring harm is the patience of enduring all the harm that people do.

original: sems can gang dag dbyug pa dang / tshon cha dang bong pa la sogs pas snun par byed pa de dag thams cad la bu gcig pa la byams pa lta bus bzod do //
analyzed: sems can gang dag dbyug pa dang / tshon cha dang bong pa la sogs pas snun par byed pa de dag thams cad la bu gcig pa la byams pa lta bus bzod do //
translated: One endures all the harm that people do, even when they strike one with sticks, clods of earth, and so forth, as if one were a loved one's only child.

original: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa ni 'di'i khongs su 'dus pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa ni 'di'i khongs su 'dus pa kho nar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The patience of certainty with respect to phenomena should be regarded as included in these three types of patience.

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams go cha sbyor ba'i bdag nyid brtson 'grus dpe med byas //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams go cha sbyor ba'i bdag nyid brtson 'grus dpe med byas //
translated: The victors' spiritual heir, with incomparable diligence, is the very embodiment of the armor and application.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni go cha'i brtson 'grus ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni go cha'i brtson 'grus ston te /
translated: This shows the armor-like diligence.

original: 'di nyid kyis brtson 'grus kyi rgya che ba nyid ston to //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis brtson 'grus kyi rgya che ba nyid ston to //
translated: It shows the vastness of diligence.

original: dpe med pa nyid kyis ni 'jig rten pa dang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus dag las byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus khyad par du byed do //
analyzed: dpe med pa nyid kyis ni 'jig rten pa dang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi brtson 'grus dag las byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus khyad par du byed do //
translated: Incomparability shows the bodhisattva's diligence to be superior to the diligence of mundane beings, disciples, and hermit buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'i brtson 'grus ji ltar na dpe med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'i brtson 'grus ji ltar na dpe med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the bodhisattva's armor-like diligence incomparable?

original: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las /
translated: As the noble Aksayamati S≈´tra says,

analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa'i go cha mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble sir, what is the bodhisattvas‚Äô imperishable armor?

original: 'khor ba na yongs su mi @124b skyo ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba na yongs su mi @124b skyo ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the refusal to be discouraged by samsara.

original: de ni bskal pa 'di snyed cig tu go bgo'o zhes bskal pa bgrang bas byang chub tshol bar mi byed kyi /
analyzed: de ni bskal pa 'di snyed cig tu go bgo'o zhes bskal pa bgrang bas byang chub tshol bar mi byed kyi /
translated: One does not seek enlightenment by counting the eons, thinking, I will don the armor for this many eons.

original: 'on kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa kho nar go gyon par byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa kho nar go gyon par byed do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: But rather, one dons the armor for an inconceivable length of time.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi rgya che ba nyid bshad do ;
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi rgya che ba nyid bshad do ;
translated: This is the greatness of effort.

original: / rang dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs tshogs gzhom byang chub dam pa 'thob par byed //
analyzed: / rang dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs tshogs gzhom byang chub dam pa 'thob par byed //
translated: It is said, It destroys the hosts of one's own and others' afflictions and brings about the attainment of supreme enlightenment.

original: ces bya ba 'dis ni zang zing med pa nyid kyi sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus ston to //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis ni zang zing med pa nyid kyi sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus ston to //
translated: This shows the effort of application that is free of material desires.

original: ji ltar zang zing med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zang zing med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it free of material desires?

original: rang dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa yang dag par gzhom pa'i phyir dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa yang dag par gzhom pa'i phyir dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
translated: One applies effort in order to destroy one's own and others' afflictions and in order to attain supreme enlightenment.

original: de ni sred pas bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa gtan du yang dag par 'joms pas zang zing med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sred pas bdag gir ma byas pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa gtan du yang dag par 'joms pas zang zing med pa yin no //
translated: It is disinterested, because it is not appropriated by craving, and it is the complete conquest of the defilements.

original: brtson 'grus gang zhig bdag gis dngos po dang / lta ba sred pas bdag gir byas pa de ni zang zing dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang zhig bdag gis dngos po dang / lta ba sred pas bdag gir byas pa de ni zang zing dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The effort that is appropriated by craving for things and views is associated with interest.

original: 'di ji ltar sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus yin zhe na /
translated: How is this the effort of application?

original: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gos mi zad pa'i mdo kho na las sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gos mi zad pa'i mdo kho na las sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi dbang du mdzad de /
translated: As it is said in the Ak·π£ayamatis≈´tra, with reference to the effort of application:

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gnon pa mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gnon pa mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva‚Äôs imperishable effort?

original: gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba yang brgal nas de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar spro ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gnon pa yin no //
analyzed: gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba yang brgal nas de bzhin gshegs pa la blta bar spro ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gnon pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs effort is the effort to cross over even if the great billion world universe were filled with fire in order to see the TathƒÅgata.

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa'i rgyu can gyi spro ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gnon pa yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa'i rgyu can gyi spro ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gnon pa yin no //
translated: The enthusiasm of the bodhisattva which is based on listening to the holy Dharma is his or her spiritual power.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu can gyi spro ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gnon pa mi lhod pa /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i rgyu can gyi spro ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol gnon pa mi lhod pa /
translated: The enthusiasm of the bodhisattva which is based on the spiritual ripening of sentient beings is his or her unflagging spiritual power.

original: mi zhan pa /
analyzed: mi zhan pa /
translated: It is not weak.

original: brtan pa / mi bzlog pa /
analyzed: brtan pa / mi bzlog pa /
translated: It is firm and irreversible.

original: dge ba'i bsam pa can /
analyzed: dge ba'i bsam pa can /
translated: It is based on the virtuous mind.

original: snying rje chen po la brten pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la brten pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin te /
translated: It is based on great compassion.

original: des na pha rol gnon pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: des na pha rol gnon pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: This is called spiritual power.

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams ting 'dzin mang ldan bsam gtan rnam pa thams cad bsgrubs //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams ting 'dzin mang ldan bsam gtan rnam pa thams cad bsgrubs //
translated: The bodhisattvas have attained all the kinds of contemplations which are endowed with many samadhis.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin mang ba nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bsam gtan gyi rgya che ba nyid ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni ting nge 'dzin mang ba nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bsam gtan gyi rgya che ba nyid ston te /
translated: This shows the abundance of samadhis and the greatness of the contemplation of the knowledge of all things.

original: ji skad du chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji skad du chos mngon pa kun las btus pa las 'di lta ste /
translated: As it is said in the Abhidharmasamuccaya:

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams @125a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams @125a * //
translated: The buddhas and bodhisattvas

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji snyed pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ming yang shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji snyed pa la snyoms par zhugs pa de dag ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ming yang shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: on the basis of the perfection of meditative concentration, enter into the meditative concentrations included in the first meditative concentration, the disciples and hermit buddhas do not even know the names of those meditative concentrations.

original: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as the first meditative concentration is included in the remaining meditative concentrations and formless states.

original: rgyal ba'i sras rnams de nyid shes bya gang yin mtha' dag rnam kun shes //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras rnams de nyid shes bya gang yin mtha' dag rnam kun shes //
translated: The victors' spiritual heirs know all that is to be known in every way.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni shes rab kyi rgya che ba nyid bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni shes rab kyi rgya che ba nyid bstan te /
translated: This shows the vast extent of wisdom.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni bzang po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni bzang po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term thatness means excellence.

original: gzhan dag na re de nyid ces bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pas te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de nyid ces bya ba ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis bsdus pas te /
translated: Others believe that the term thatness is included in the universal characteristic.

original: gnyis la bdag med pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnyis la bdag med pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The selflessness of the two is the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: rang gi brda la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba mtha' yas pas tha dad pa'i shes bya gang yin pa de yin no zhes bya ba ni ri khrod pa dang kla klo la sogs pa'i yul gang dang gang dag na rang gi brda'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye
analyzed: rang gi brda la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba mtha' yas pas tha dad pa'i shes bya gang yin pa de yin no zhes bya ba ni ri khrod pa dang kla klo la sogs pa'i yul gang dang gang dag na rang gi brda'i mtshan nyid kyi dbye
translated: The object of knowledge is that which is differentiated by the infinite divisions of characteristics such as one‚Äôs own language.

original: bas tha dad pa'i shes bya de sgyu ma mkhan la sogs pa sgyu ma byas pa la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa ltar /
analyzed: bas tha dad pa'i shes bya de sgyu ma mkhan la sogs pa sgyu ma byas pa la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa ltar /
translated: Just as a magician is not attached to the things created by his magic,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos rnams la kun tu ma rmongs pas 'jig rten pa la tha snyad du bya ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis sgyu
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos rnams la kun tu ma rmongs pas 'jig rten pa la tha snyad du bya ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis sgyu
translated: so too, because they are not confused about phenomena such as those with or without contamination, conditioned or unconditioned, they use nonconceptual wisdom to engage in conventional activities for the sake of the world.

original: ma dang smig rgyu dang chu zla'i tshul du tha snyad 'dogs shing thams cad ji la bzhin du yang shes so //
analyzed: ma dang smig rgyu dang chu zla'i tshul du tha snyad 'dogs shing thams cad ji la bzhin du yang shes so //
translated: and they designate them conventionally in the manner of a mother, a mirage, and the moon reflected in water, and they know all things just as they are.

original: ye shes sems can yongs su bzung bas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag //
analyzed: ye shes sems can yongs su bzung bas 'jig rten dag na mi zad gzhag //
translated: The gnosis of the bodhisattvas, which is sustained by compassion, is set down in the worlds as inexhaustible.

original: ces bya ba 'dis ni ye shes mi zad pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis ni ye shes mi zad pa nyid ston te /
translated: This shows the inexhaustibility of gnosis.

original: snying rjes yongs su bzung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni mi zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rjes yongs su bzung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni mi zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nonconceptual gnosis sustained by compassion becomes inexhaustible.

original: snying rjes ni sems can yongs su mi gtong ste /
analyzed: snying rjes ni sems can yongs su mi gtong ste /
translated: Compassion does not abandon sentient beings.

original: des na nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, unlike the disciples, the bodhisattvas do not lean toward nirvana.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni 'jig rten pa dag ltar 'khor ba la gnas par mi 'gyur bas de ni mi zad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis ni 'jig rten pa dag ltar 'khor ba la gnas par mi 'gyur bas de ni mi zad pa yin no //
translated: And because of nonconceptual gnosis, they do not remain in cyclic existence as do the worldly. Thus it is inexhaustible.

original: de bas na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir ye shes de phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang mi zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i phyir ye shes de phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na yang mi zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because it does not abide in samsara or nirvana, that intuition does not perish even in the nirvana without remainder.

original: byang chub sems @125b dpa' rnams kyi phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ni sprul pa'i skus ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems @125b dpa' rnams kyi phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ni sprul pa'i skus ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The nirvana without remainder of the bodhisattvas is that shown by the emanation body.

original: slong ba po'i sbyin pa po mthong bas dga' ba gang yin pa dang / mthong nas re ba yongs su rdzogs pas dga' ba gang yin pa dang / slong ba po'i sbyin pa po ma mthong bas mi dga' ba gang yin pa dang / slong ba po'i yid la re ba yongs su ma rdzogs pas yongs su mi dga' ba gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: slong ba po'i sbyin pa po mthong bas dga' ba gang yin pa dang / mthong nas re ba yongs su rdzogs pas dga' ba gang yin pa dang / slong ba po'i sbyin pa po ma mthong bas mi dga' ba gang yin pa dang / slong ba po'i yid la re ba yongs su ma rdzogs pas yongs su mi dga' ba gang yin pa dang /
translated: The joy of the giver who sees the supplicant, the joy of fulfilling the expectation upon seeing him, the displeasure of the giver who does not see the supplicant, the displeasure of not fulfilling the expectation of the supplicant,

original: slong ba po'i smon pa po gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: slong ba po'i smon pa po gang yin pa ste /
translated: and the aspiration of the supplicant.

original: sbyin pa mthong ba dang / yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par smon pa gang yin pa dga' ba dang mi dga' ba dang smon pa de dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' brtse ba dang ldan pas snying rje lhag par ldan pa'i sgo nas zil gyis mnan te /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i rgyud snying rjes brlan pas slong ba po mthong ba dang / de'i yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs pas slong ba po bas lhag par dga' ba skye la /
analyzed: sbyin pa mthong ba dang / yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par smon pa gang yin pa dga' ba dang mi dga' ba dang smon pa de dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' brtse ba dang ldan pas snying rje lhag par ldan pa'i sgo nas zil gyis mnan te / byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud snying rjes brlan pas slong ba po mthong ba dang / de'i yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs pas slong ba po bas lhag par dga' ba skye la /
translated: Whatever joy and sorrow and aspiration there is in giving, in seeing, and in fulfilling the hopes of those who ask, all that is surpassed by the bodhisattva who is full of love, who is especially compassionate.üîΩThe bodhisattva, whose mind is moistened with compassion, is more joyful at seeing the petitioner and fulfilling his hopes than the petitioner is.

original: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba po mthong ba dang / de'i yid la re ba yongs su ma rdzogs pas kyang slong ba po bas lhag par mi dga' ba skye'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba po mthong ba dang / de'i yid la re ba yongs su ma rdzogs pas kyang slong ba po bas lhag par mi dga' ba skye'o //
translated: And the bodhisattva is more sorrowful at not seeing the petitioner and not fulfilling his hopes than the petitioner is.

original: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba po mthong bar smon pa dang / de'i yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par smon pa yang smon pa yang slong ba po bas lhag par skye bas de'i phyir zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' slong ba po mthong bar smon pa dang / de'i yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs par smon pa yang smon pa yang slong ba po bas lhag par skye bas de'i phyir zil gyis gnon to //
translated: The bodhisattva wishes to see the petitioner and wishes to fulfill his hope, and he generates a greater wish than the petitioner. Therefore, he surpasses the petitioner.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par te /
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par te /
translated: This is the special quality of the perfection of generosity.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught in one verse.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims ni //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyis bsdus pa yin pas /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyis bsdus pa yin pas /
translated: is included in the ten virtuous actions.

original: de la bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bsam par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be considered.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la srog dang longs spyod dang chud ma dga' gtong zhing shin tu dga' bar byed pas te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la srog dang longs spyod dang chud ma dga' gtong zhing shin tu dga' bar byed pas te /
translated: The bodhisattva gives his life, his enjoyments, and his merit to sentient beings and he is very happy.

original: rab tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rab tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: He is extremely happy, as the term ‚Äúvery‚Äù indicates.

original: de ji ltar srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spyod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa spyod par 'gyur /
translated: How can he engage in killing, stealing, and sexual misconduct?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gnod byed pa la yang phan pa'i 'du shes 'thob la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gnod byed pa la yang phan pa'i 'du shes 'thob la /
translated: Bodhisattvas have the perception of benefit even toward those who harm them.

original: gzhan la phan par bya ba la brtson pa la rlung dang nyi ma dang sdig sbrul la sogs pa las sdug bsngal skyed pa gang yin pa la de la yang byang chub sems dpa' mchog tu dga' ba rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan la phan par bya ba la brtson pa la rlung dang nyi ma dang sdig sbrul la sogs pa las sdug bsngal skyed pa gang yin pa la de la yang byang chub sems dpa' mchog tu dga' ba rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: And when they are working to benefit others, even if they experience suffering caused by wind, sun, snakes, scorpions, and so on, bodhisattvas find the highest joy in that.

original: bzod pa'i tshogs tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir @126a * //üîΩgnod pa byed pa gang yin pa la yang phan pa'i 'du shes thob la gzhan la phan par brtson pa la sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de la yang dga' ba 'thob na gang la dgra la sogs pa la yang gnod pa byed pa'i 'du shes mi
analyzed: bzod pa'i tshogs tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir @126a * // gnod pa byed pa gang yin pa la yang phan pa'i 'du shes thob la gzhan la phan par brtson pa la sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de la yang dga' ba 'thob na gang la dgra la sogs pa la yang gnod pa byed pa'i 'du shes mi
translated: Because it is the cause for completing the accumulation of merit for the perfection of patience.üîΩSo when they have the perception of benefit even toward those who harm them and they find joy in the suffering that arises when they are working to benefit others, what need is there to mention their patience toward those who are neither harming nor benefiting them?

original: 'byung la / gzhan gyi don la brtson pa la sdug bsngal la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo mi 'byung ba des gang la ci zhig bzod par bya /
analyzed: 'byung la / gzhan gyi don la brtson pa la sdug bsngal la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo mi 'byung ba des gang la ci zhig bzod par bya /
translated: So what is there to be patient with and who is there to be patient with?

original: 'di dag gis ni go rims bzhin du gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa bdag bshad do //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni go rims bzhin du gnod pa byed pa la mi mjed pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa bdag bshad do //
translated: These four kinds of patience are explained in order as follows: the patience of not retaliating for harm, the patience of enduring suffering, the patience of accepting the Dharma, and the patience of being certain about the Dharma.üîΩAlways loving others more than oneself

original: bdag pas ches lhag gzhan la rtag byams dang // zhes bya ba ni ji skad du sgrub pa'i skabs nas /
analyzed: bdag pas ches lhag gzhan la rtag byams dang // zhes bya ba ni ji skad du sgrub pa'i skabs nas /
translated: This is as explained in the chapter on practice:

original: ji ltar snying rje'i bdag nyid gzhan gyi don gyi phyir //
analyzed: ji ltar snying rje'i bdag nyid gzhan gyi don gyi phyir //
translated: Those who are compassionate by nature

original: bdag la sdug bsngal mi bzad gdung ba rab byed pa //üîΩde ltar 'jig rten gdung ba'i las kyis gzhan dgra la //
analyzed: bdag la sdug bsngal mi bzad gdung ba rab byed pa // de ltar 'jig rten gdung ba'i las kyis gzhan dgra la //
translated: Suffer unbearably for the sake of others.üîΩBut they do not engage in the work of the worldüîΩWith such great compassion for others.

original: shin tu brtse ba med par rab tu 'jug ma yin //
analyzed: shin tu brtse ba med par rab tu 'jug ma yin //
translated: As when one groping with one's hands in the darküîΩFeels for an object that is there,üîΩOne has a slight awareness of the Dharma

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩji ltar mun khung lag nom dag gis shes pa yul chung ba //üîΩzhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pas mnams nas de'i rjes la dran pas 'di ni bum pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // ji ltar mun khung lag nom dag gis shes pa yul chung ba // zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pas mnams nas de'i rjes la dran pas 'di ni bum pa'o //
translated: Through faith alone.üîΩWhen one gropes with one's hands in the dark for an object that is there, one has a slight awareness of it.üîΩLater, through memory, one knows that it is a pot or a piece of cloth.

original: 'di ni ras yug go zhes bya bar shes pa de ni shes pa yul chung ngu can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ras yug go zhes bya bar shes pa de ni shes pa yul chung ngu can yin no //
translated: That is a slight awareness of the object.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po de mig gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po de mig gis mngon sum du ma gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Non-perception is because that entity is not perceived by the eye.

original: lag nom gyis bzung ba'i kha dog la sogs pa yongs su gcad par ni mi nus so //
analyzed: lag nom gyis bzung ba'i kha dog la sogs pa yongs su gcad par ni mi nus so //
translated: The color, etc. grasped by the hand cannot be ascertained.

original: shin tu dri ma med pa ma yin pa ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu dri ma med pa ma yin pa ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not completely pure means

original: nyan thos rnams kyi shes pa de ni bag chags dang ldan pa'i phyir bag chags dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi shes pa de ni bag chags dang ldan pa'i phyir bag chags dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: that knowledge of the sravakas is together with residual impressions because it possesses residual impressions.

original: yang na byis pas kun brtags pa'i chos la 'dzin pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na byis pas kun brtags pa'i chos la 'dzin pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it is because the clinging to the imagined reality of the foolish has not been eliminated.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni ngan song dang 'khor bas 'jigs pa dag la de dag gis mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rgyud la 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pas ngan song las yongs su skyob la /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa ni ngan song dang 'khor bas 'jigs pa dag la de dag gis mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rgyud la 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pas ngan song las yongs su skyob la /
translated: The bestowal of fearlessness is for those who fear the evil destinies and samsara.

original: bden pa mthong ba ni 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par bzla bas skyob po //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba ni 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par bzla bas skyob po //
translated: Those who see the truths are protected from the five fears.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa ni dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god pas 'khor ba las yongs su skyob po //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa ni dgra bcom pa nyid la 'god pas 'khor ba las yongs su skyob po //
translated: The stream-enterer and so on are completely protected from cyclic existence because they are established in the state of an arhat.

original: rgyu mtshan ni snying rje'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni snying rje'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The reason is compassion.

original: snying rjes @126b yongs su zin pa'i sbyin pa ni sbyin pa mchog yin te /
analyzed: snying rjes @126b yongs su zin pa'i sbyin pa ni sbyin pa mchog yin te /
translated: Generosity that is embraced by compassion is the best generosity.

original: snying rjes yongs su zin pas sbyin pa gzhan dag las khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: snying rjes yongs su zin pas sbyin pa gzhan dag las khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: Because it is embraced by compassion, generosity is superior to other types of generosity.üîΩThe cause is the habitual tendency to practice the perfection of generosity in previous lives.

original: rgyu ni sngon gyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pa'i bag chags so zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan dag na ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa kun tu spyad pas bag chags gzhan pa
analyzed: rgyu ni sngon gyi sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pa'i bag chags so zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan dag na ma chags pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa kun tu spyad pas bag chags gzhan pa
translated: The habitual tendency is the intention that is concomitant with the roots of virtue such as nonattachment in other lives.

original: gang yin pa'i bag chags de'i stobs kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa de ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: gang yin pa'i bag chags de'i stobs kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la 'jug pa de ni rgyu ste /
translated: The power of that habitual tendency is the cause for engaging in the perfections such as generosity.

original: des na mchog tu 'dod do //
analyzed: des na mchog tu 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is considered to be the best.

original: gong du ni snying rje'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan gyi sgo nas mchog yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gong du ni snying rje'i rgyu mtshan can gyi sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu mtshan gyi sgo nas mchog yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Previously, it was explained that generosity that is motivated by compassion is superior in terms of its motivation.

original: da ni sngon sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pa'i bag chags las rgyu'i sgo nas mchog yin no zhes bshad na /
analyzed: da ni sngon sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pa'i bag chags las rgyu'i sgo nas mchog yin no zhes bshad na /
translated: Now, it is explained that it is superior in terms of its cause, from the habitual tendency to practice the perfection of generosity.

original: rgyu dang rgyu mtshan la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu mtshan la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between a cause and a motivation?

original: rgyu ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: rgyu ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: A cause is a unique cause,

original: dper na myu gu'i sa bon lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu'i sa bon lta bu'o //
translated: like a seed for a sprout.

original: rgyu mtshan ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: A motivation is a cooperative condition,

original: dper na myu gu de nyid kyi byed rgyu sa dang chu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu de nyid kyi byed rgyu sa dang chu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the conditions for a sprout, such as soil and water.

original: de ltar na grangs bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la goms pa'i bag chags ni rgyu lta bu ste /
analyzed: de ltar na grangs bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba la goms pa'i bag chags ni rgyu lta bu ste /
translated: Thus, in order, the habitual tendencies of being accustomed to generosity and so on are like a cause,

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: because they are unique causes.

original: snying rje ni thun mong gi rgyu ste /
analyzed: snying rje ni thun mong gi rgyu ste /
translated: Compassion is a common cause,

original: sa dang chu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the soil, water, and so on.

original: zhing ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: zhing ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The field is fivefold:üîΩthose who are beggars, those who are suffering, those who are helpless, those who engage in negative actions, and those who possess good qualities.

original: slong ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rten med pa dang / nyes par spyad spyod pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba gong du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pas sbyin pa po dang / sbyin par bya ba dang len pa po rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir sbyin pa khyad par du 'phags so zhes bshad ma thag ma yin nam /
analyzed: slong ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rten med pa dang / nyes par spyad spyod pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba gong du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin pas sbyin pa po dang / sbyin par bya ba dang len pa po rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir sbyin pa khyad par du 'phags so zhes bshad ma thag ma yin nam /
translated: Immediately above, it was explained that generosity is superior because the giver, the gift, and the recipient are nonconceptual due to being embraced by nonconceptual wisdom.

original: da ni don la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ji ltar snga phyi mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: da ni don la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ji ltar snga phyi mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: Now, since one conceptualizes the object and so on, how is there no contradiction between the earlier and later statements?

original: 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs nyam dbar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs nyam dbar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, when the perfection of generosity is not complete, it is the state of ordinary beings.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas skabs ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The state of nonconceptuality is the state in which the perfection of generosity is complete.

original: de'i tshe ni 'di gang zhig gang slong ba de la de sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni 'di gang zhig gang slong ba de la de sbyin par byed do //
translated: At that time, he gives whatever is asked for to whoever asks for it.

original: don la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i dbul ba'i gnas skabs @127a * //
analyzed: don la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i gnas skabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i dbul ba'i gnas skabs @127a * //
translated: The stage of conceptualizing objects and so on is the stage of poverty for the bodhisattva.

original: yin pas slong ba po thams cad la spyan pa sbyin par nus par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di mi srid do //
analyzed: yin pas slong ba po thams cad la spyan pa sbyin par nus par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for him to be able to give his eyes to all beggars.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis ni /
translated: By the power of nonconceptual intuition,

original: de la sbyin pa po dang sbyin par bya ba dang len pa por mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa po dang sbyin par bya ba dang len pa por mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: he does not conceive of himself as a giver, the gift, or the recipient.

original: 'dir yang mngon par zhen pa 'gog par zad pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir yang mngon par zhen pa 'gog par zad pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Here also, since only the conception is refuted, there is no contradiction.

original: mos pa dang yid la byed pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas sbyin pa mchog tu 'dod de /
analyzed: mos pa dang yid la byed pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas sbyin pa mchog tu 'dod de /
translated: Giving is considered supreme from the point of view of aspiration, attention, and concentration.

original: mos pa'i sgo nas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mos pa'i sgo nas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it supreme from the point of view of aspiration?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde thams cad la bsam pa thag pa'i bar du dang bas mos pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i mdo sde thams cad la bsam pa thag pa'i bar du dang bas mos pa'o //
translated: One has deep faith in all the s≈´tras that are endowed with the perfection of generosity.

original: yid la byed pa'i sgo nas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i sgo nas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it through mental activity?üîΩOne relishes the perfections that have been attained through relishing mental activity, as if seeing their good qualities.

original: ro myang ba yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams la yon tan du lta ba'i tshul gyis ro myong bar byed pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pas 'jig rten thams cad na sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang /
analyzed: ro myang ba yid la byed pas pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa rnams la yon tan du lta ba'i tshul gyis ro myong bar byed pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pas 'jig rten thams cad na sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang /
translated: One rejoices through rejoicing mental activity, rejoicing in all the generosity and so on of all sentient beings in all worlds.

original: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pas bdag nyid dang sems can rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par ma 'ongs pa rnams la mngon par dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pas bdag nyid dang sems can rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khyad par ma 'ongs pa rnams la mngon par dga' ba yin no //
translated: One delights through delighting mental activity, delighting in the special future perfections of oneself and sentient beings.

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten pas sbyin pa mchog yin no /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten pas sbyin pa mchog yin no /
translated: Generosity is supreme when it is based on meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pas te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pas te /
translated: Meditative concentration is the sky treasury and so on.

original: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa'i lam mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i gnas skabs na nam mkha' nyid mdzod du gyur te /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa'i lam mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i gnas skabs na nam mkha' nyid mdzod du gyur te /
translated: On the eighth ground and so on, when the bodhisattva path is in the state of non-conditioning, the sky itself becomes a treasury.

original: gang dang gang la ci dang ci dgos pa de dang de la nam mkha' kho na las thams cad sbyin par byed cing nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa du ma yang ston to //
analyzed: gang dang gang la ci dang ci dgos pa de dang de la nam mkha' kho na las thams cad sbyin par byed cing nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa du ma yang ston to //
translated: Whatever is needed and wherever it is needed, everything is given from the sky itself.

original: ji skad du de nyid las dbang 'byor pa bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba gang nas bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad du de nyid las dbang 'byor pa bshad pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba gang nas bshad ce na /
translated: As explained in that text, mastery.

original: bsgom pa rnam par dbye ba las so //
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam par dbye ba las so //
translated: From the chapter on the cultivation of the perfections.

original: ji skad du bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad ce na /
translated: What is explained there?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dbang 'byor pa nyid la brten pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa dbang 'byor pa nyid la brten pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The cultivation of the perfections based on mastery is threefold:

original: sku la dbang 'byor pa nyid dang / spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa nyid dang / ston pa la dbang 'byor pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sku la dbang 'byor pa nyid dang / spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa nyid dang / ston pa la dbang 'byor pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: mastery over body, mastery over conduct, and mastery over teaching.

original: de la sku la dbang 'byor pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de la sku la dbang 'byor pa nyid ni /
translated: Mastery over body is as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis po ngo bo nyid kyi dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i yin par blta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis po ngo bo nyid kyi dang / longs spyod rdzogs pa'i yin par blta ste /
translated: The two bodies of the Tathagata are to be regarded as the essential body and the body of enjoyment.

original: sku 'di gnyis ni chos dkar po thams cad kyi tshogs yin no //
analyzed: sku 'di gnyis ni chos dkar po thams cad kyi tshogs yin no //
translated: These two bodies are the collection of all the bright things.

original: chos dkar po'i tshogs nyid yin du @127b zin kyang /
analyzed: chos dkar po'i tshogs nyid yin du @127b zin kyang /
translated: Even though they are the collection of bright things,

original: ting nge 'dzin smos pas dbang 'byor pa'i phyogs gcig bzung ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin smos pas dbang 'byor pa'i phyogs gcig bzung ste /
translated: by mentioning the meditative concentration, one part of mastery is included.

original: nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The meditative concentration of the sky treasury and so on are included.

original: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin la brten pas sbyin pa mchog yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin la brten pas sbyin pa mchog yin par 'dod do //
translated: Thus, it is held that giving is supreme in dependence on meditative concentration.

original: rnam pa ji snyed sbyin pa ni sbyin pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni mos pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i rnam pa'i dbye bas rnam pa'i bye brag shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ji snyed sbyin pa ni sbyin pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni mos pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i rnam pa'i dbye bas rnam pa'i bye brag shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: Giving is the giving of whatever is given. That is to be understood as the classification of types by way of the classification of types of aspiration, mental attention, and meditative concentration.

original: tshul khrims kyi rten ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi rten ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The basis of morality is the bodhisattva.

original: gzhi mchog ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pas tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po sdom pa dang / dge ba'i chos su sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba la bsdus so //
analyzed: gzhi mchog ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pas tshul khrims rnam pa gsum po sdom pa dang / dge ba'i chos su sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba la bsdus so //
translated: The bodhisattva vow includes the three kinds of morality: the morality of restraint, the morality of acquiring virtuous factors, and the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings.üîΩPatience is with regard to the weak, the killers.

original: bzod pa ni ngan pa stobs chung ngus gsod pa dag go zhes bya ba ni lag dbyug dang / thal lcags la sogs pa bzod pa gang yin pa de ni ngo mtshar mi che'i /
analyzed: bzod pa ni ngan pa stobs chung ngus gsod pa dag go zhes bya ba ni lag dbyug dang / thal lcags la sogs pa bzod pa gang yin pa de ni ngo mtshar mi che'i /
translated: It is not so very wonderful that one should be patient with a weak person who kills, such as a servant or an outcast.

original: rje dpon yin la gsod pa ngan pa bran dang gdol pa la sogs pa'i gzod pa gang yin pa 'di ni rab tu ngo mtshar che'o //üîΩngan du zin kyang gal te stobs dang ldan pa yin na stobs dang ldan pa bzod pa gang yin pa de yang tshar gcig ngo mtshar mi che'o //
analyzed: rje dpon yin la gsod pa ngan pa bran dang gdol pa la sogs pa'i gzod pa gang yin pa 'di ni rab tu ngo mtshar che'o // ngan du zin kyang gal te stobs dang ldan pa yin na stobs dang ldan pa bzod pa gang yin pa de yang tshar gcig ngo mtshar mi che'o //
translated: But it is very wonderful that one should be patient with a powerful person who kills, such as a king.üîΩAnd it is not so very wonderful that one should be patient with a powerful person who kills, if one is oneself powerful.

original: gal te ngan pa stobs kyang chung na ngo mtshar che ste /
analyzed: gal te ngan pa stobs kyang chung na ngo mtshar che ste /
translated: But it is very wonderful that one should be patient with a weak person who kills, if one is oneself weak.

original: de'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni gzhi mchog tu gyur pas bzod pa khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: de'i bzod pa gang yin pa de ni gzhi mchog tu gyur pas bzod pa khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: The patience that is based on that is superior patience, because the basis is superior.

original: yang na ngan pa yang gzhan kho na yin la /
analyzed: yang na ngan pa yang gzhan kho na yin la /
translated: Or else, inferior means something else,

original: stobs chung ngu yang gzhan yin te /
analyzed: stobs chung ngu yang gzhan yin te /
translated: and weak means something else.

original: ngan pa ni bran la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pa ni bran la sogs pa'o //
translated: The inferior are slaves, etc.

original: de las gzhan pa rigs mthun zhing /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rigs mthun zhing /
translated: Those who are not like that, who are of the same class,

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa dang bral par bya ba'i mthu med pa de ni stobs chung ba'o //üîΩshes rab kyi gzhi mchog ni /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa dang bral par bya ba'i mthu med pa de ni stobs chung ba'o // shes rab kyi gzhi mchog ni /
translated: and who are powerless to be free from the lord, etc. are weak.

original: de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The superior basis of wisdom is suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid ni gnyis la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gnyis la bdag med pa'o //
translated: Suchness is the selflessness of the two.

original: de la dmigs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni mchog yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de ni mchog yin te /
translated: The wisdom that focuses on that is superior,

original: gzhi zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs par bshad do //
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs par bshad do //
translated: because the word basis is explained as the object.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i zhing ni theg pa chen po zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi de dag gi theg pa'i zhing gis bsdus pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni mchog ma yin gyi /üîΩtheg pa chen po bstan pas theg pa chen po la zhugs pa rnams @128a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i zhing ni theg pa chen po zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi de dag gi theg pa'i zhing gis bsdus pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni mchog ma yin gyi / theg pa chen po bstan pas theg pa chen po la zhugs pa rnams @128a * //
translated: The field of the perfections such as morality, etc., is the Great Vehicle. The morality, etc., of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas, which is included in their vehicle, is not the highest.

original: kyi gang yin pa de ni theg pa dman pa'i zhing mchog tu 'dod do //
analyzed: kyi gang yin pa de ni theg pa dman pa'i zhing mchog tu 'dod do //
translated: But that of those who have entered the Great Vehicle, which is taught by the Great Vehicle, is considered the highest.

analyzed: gnas ni mos pa la sogs te /

analyzed: de ltar mos na mos pa la brten pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa mchog ces bya'o //

original: yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni /
translated: Attention is the attention of the bodhisattvas.

translated: One relishes the transcendent perfections of discipline and so on by savoring them, rejoicing in them and delighting in them with a mental state that savors, rejoices and delights.üîΩOne relishes the transcendent perfections of discipline and so on by savoring them, rejoicing in them and delighting in them with a mental state that savors, rejoices and delights.üîΩOne relishes the transcendent perfections of discipline and so on by savoring them, rejoicing in them and delighting in them with a mental state that savors, rejoices and delights.üîΩOne relishes the transcendent perfections of discipline and so on by savoring them, rejoicing in them and delighting in them with a mental state that savors, rejoices and delights.üîΩOne relishes the transcendent perfections of discipline and so on by savoring them, rejoicing in them and delighting in them with a mental state that savors, rejoices and delights.

original: tshul khrims ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig bzung ngo //üîΩde bzhin du bzod pa la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni dge ba'i chos sdud pa gang yin pa de'i phyogs gcig bzung ngo // de bzhin du bzod pa la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
