original: ting nge 'dzin 'grub par bya ba'i phyir sbrang bu mchu rings dang / sha sbrang la sogs pa'i phyi dang nang gi sdug bsngal bzod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i chos bshad na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'grub par bya ba'i phyir sbrang bu mchu rings dang / sha sbrang la sogs pa'i phyi dang nang gi sdug bsngal bzod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i chos bshad na /
translated: One relishes the transcendent perfections of discipline and so on by savoring them, rejoicing in them and delighting in them with a mental state that savors

original: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pas bzod pa yang yin pa'i bzod pa de ni ting nge 'dzin pas mchog yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pas bzod pa yang yin pa'i bzod pa de ni ting nge 'dzin pas mchog yin par 'dod de /
translated: That patience is the best of all patiences, because it is the patience of the certainty of Dharma, and because it is the patience of the concentration of the stream of Dharma.

original: 'di ltar bzod pa la brten nas ting nge 'dzin de dag 'grub pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bzod pa la brten nas ting nge 'dzin de dag 'grub pas so //
translated: For, in dependence on patience, those concentrations are accomplished.

original: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi yon tan gyi gnas skabs yin pas yon tan skabs nyid kyi sbyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi yon tan lhag par bsngags te /
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi yon tan gyi gnas skabs yin pas yon tan skabs nyid kyi sbyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi yon tan lhag par bsngags te /
translated: Since this is the occasion of the virtues of the perfections, the virtues of the perfections of giving and effort are especially praised.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa ni //
translated: The giving of the bodhisattva

original: sems can gcig bde bskal mang du //
analyzed: sems can gcig bde bskal mang du //
translated: is for the happiness of beings in many eons.

original: gnod pa byed kyang dga' 'gyur na //
analyzed: gnod pa byed kyang dga' 'gyur na //
translated: Even if they harm him, he is pleased.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas sbyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi yon tan lhag pa brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas sbyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag gi yon tan lhag pa brjod do //
translated: This verse and others praise the virtues of the perfections of giving and effort.

original: de tshe rdzas ngan lta la smos kyang ci zhig dgos //
analyzed: de tshe rdzas ngan lta la smos kyang ci zhig dgos //
translated: At that time, what need is there to mention bad things?

original: zhes bya ba ni lus las gzhan pa'i rdzas ni ngan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus las gzhan pa'i rdzas ni ngan pa ste /
translated: The substance other than the body is inferior,

original: mchog ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩbtang dga' longs spyod can zhes bya ba ni btang ba nyid longs spyod yin la /
analyzed: mchog ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // btang dga' longs spyod can zhes bya ba ni btang ba nyid longs spyod yin la /
translated: that is, it is not the best.üîΩThe bodhisattva is one who delights in giving and enjoys giving.üîΩHe delights in giving and giving is his enjoyment.

original: dga' ba nyid longs spyod yin te /üîΩde gang la yod pa de ni btang dga' longs spyod can yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba nyid longs spyod yin te / de gang la yod pa de ni btang dga' longs spyod can yin no //
translated: He is one who delights in giving and enjoys giving.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kho na la yon tan @128b 'di dag yod kyi mi gzhan la ni med do //üîΩyang na btang ba la dga' ba ni btang dga'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kho na la yon tan @128b 'di dag yod kyi mi gzhan la ni med do // yang na btang ba la dga' ba ni btang dga'o //
translated: These qualities exist only in the bodhisattva, not in others.üîΩOr else, he delights in giving, he delights in giving.

original: dga' ba nyid longs spyod yin pas na btang dga' longs spyod do //
analyzed: dga' ba nyid longs spyod yin pas na btang dga' longs spyod do //
translated: Giving is his enjoyment, he enjoys giving.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa'i bye brag gis brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan lhag par bsngags so //
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa'i bye brag gis brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan lhag par bsngags so //
translated: The perfection of vigor is praised as superior by way of its preeminence, etc.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni srid sbyong 'dod pa thob //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni srid sbyong 'dod pa thob //
translated: Through vigor, one obtains the enjoyments of cyclic existence and the bliss of tranquility.

original: ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i srid par gtogs pa'i longs spyod ni srid spyod do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'dod pa'i srid par gtogs pa'i longs spyod ni srid spyod do //
translated: The enjoyments of cyclic existence are the enjoyments of the desire realm.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni dag pa rab 'gyur ldan //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni dag pa rab 'gyur ldan //
translated: Through effort, one becomes endowed with the purity of the form and formless realms.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dag pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dag pa ste /
translated: This refers to the purity of the form and formless realms.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: It is included in the mundane meditative concentrations and formless states.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni 'jig tshogs gnas nas grol //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni 'jig tshogs gnas nas grol //
translated: Through effort, one is freed from the abode of the body of beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams gang zag la bdag med par mthong bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams gang zag la bdag med par mthong bas so //
translated: This refers to the Listeners and the Self-Buddhas, who are freed from the abode of the body of beings by seeing the insubstantiality of the person.

original: brtson 'grus kyi ni byang chub mchog sangs rgyas //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ni byang chub mchog sangs rgyas //
translated: Through effort, one attains supreme enlightenment, Buddhahood.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus gang yin pa'o //
translated: This refers to the effort of the Bodhisattvas.üîΩMoreover, there are two verses on effort that is diminishing and increasing, etc.

original: gzhan yang nyams dang 'phel ba'i brtson 'grus dang // zhes bya ba la sogs tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni yang dag par spong ba dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam rnams brtson 'grus kyi rnam pas dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan yang nyams dang 'phel ba'i brtson 'grus dang // zhes bya ba la sogs tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis ni yang dag par spong ba dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam rnams brtson 'grus kyi rnam pas dbye ba bstan to //
translated: These two verses show the analysis of the correct exertions, faculties, powers, limbs of enlightenment, and path, in terms of the aspects of effort.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas de dag tu brtson 'grus ma bstan to /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas de dag tu brtson 'grus ma bstan to /
translated: Since the bases of psychic power have the nature of meditative concentration, effort is not taught in them.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi ni bsam pa dang / blo zhan pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi ni bsam pa dang / blo zhan pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the disciples have a limited attitude and limited understanding.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni bsam pa dang blo rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni bsam pa dang blo rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattvas have a vast attitude and vast understanding.üîΩAttachment to enjoyment is the obstacle to the nonenjoyment and nonstability of the enjoyment of objects such as form, etc.

original: longs spyod la chags pa ni de kun tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni longs spyod gzugs la sogs pa'i yul bsgrub pa dag la chags pa gang yin pa mi spyod pa dang mi brtan pa bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen por /
analyzed: longs spyod la chags pa ni de kun tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni longs spyod gzugs la sogs pa'i yul bsgrub pa dag la chags pa gang yin pa mi spyod pa dang mi brtan pa bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen por /
translated: The remedy for that is effort.

original: brtson 'grus ldan pa longs spyod kyis pha ma med //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ldan pa longs spyod kyis pha ma med //
translated: The one who has effort has no attachment to enjoyment.

original: ces brjod de spyad par bya ba ni longs spyod yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces brjod de spyad par bya ba ni longs spyod yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should enjoy enjoyment, because enjoyment is to be enjoyed.

original: nyon mongs pa ni de yongs su spyod pa la lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni longs spyod dag spyod pa la lhag par chags shing sred pa gang yin pa bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen por //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni de yongs su spyod pa la lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni longs spyod dag spyod pa la lhag par chags shing sred pa gang yin pa bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen por //
translated: Afflictions are the obstacle to the enjoyment of those enjoyments.

original: brtson 'grus ldan pa nyon mongs kyis pham med //üîΩces bya ste /üîΩbrtson 'grus dang ldan pa dge @129a * //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ldan pa nyon mongs kyis pham med // ces bya ste / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dge @129a * //
translated: The remedy for that is the perfection of effort, because one is not defeated by afflictions when one has effort.üîΩOne who has effort and is engaged in virtue is not defeated by afflictions.

original: ba'i chos la brtson pa ni nyon mongs rnams kyis pham par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i chos la brtson pa ni nyon mongs rnams kyis pham par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has effort and is engaged in virtue is not defeated by afflictions.

original: yon tan gyi skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: yon tan gyi skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The section on qualities is complete.

original: // / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni tshul khrims dang bzod pas bsdus te /
analyzed: // / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni tshul khrims dang bzod pas bsdus te /
translated: The giving of fearlessness is included in morality and patience.üîΩThus, these two give fearlessness.

original: de ltar 'di gnyis kyis mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed do zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims yang dag par len pa ni sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed cing gzhan gshe ba dang brdeg pa la sogs pas rnam pa du mar 'tshe ba
analyzed: de ltar 'di gnyis kyis mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed do zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims yang dag par len pa ni sems can thams cad la mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed cing gzhan gshe ba dang brdeg pa la sogs pas rnam pa du mar 'tshe ba
translated: The taking up of morality gives fearlessness to all sentient beings.

original: yang thams cad bzod cing dang du len te /
analyzed: yang thams cad bzod cing dang du len te /
translated: Moreover, one should be patient and accept everything.

original: 'di ltar tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas ni gshes kyang slar mi gshe bar bya /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pas ni gshes kyang slar mi gshe bar bya /
translated: Thus, one should think, ‚ÄúBy taking up morality, even if others insult me, I will not insult them in return;

original: khros kyang slar mi khro bar bya /
analyzed: khros kyang slar mi khro bar bya /
translated: even if they are angry, I will not be angry in return;

original: brdeg kyang slar mi brdeg par bya /
analyzed: brdeg kyang slar mi brdeg par bya /
translated: even if they beat me, I will not beat them in return;üîΩeven if they expose my faults, I will not expose theirs.‚Äù

original: mtshang 'bru yang slar mtshang 'bru bar mi bya'o snyam du de ltar so sor brtags nas bzod pa ni gzhan dag la mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed pas /
analyzed: mtshang 'bru yang slar mtshang 'bru bar mi bya'o snyam du de ltar so sor brtags nas bzod pa ni gzhan dag la mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed pas /
translated: Thus, having reflected in this way, patience gives security to others.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pas ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pas ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that morality and patience are included in the gift of security.

original: chos sbyin pas ni bsam gtan dang shes rab dag ste /
analyzed: chos sbyin pas ni bsam gtan dang shes rab dag ste /
translated: Dhyana and wisdom are included in the gift of Dharma.üîΩThus, one should think, ‚ÄúBy means of that very gift of Dharma, one should teach the Dharma to others.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar de nyid kyis chos sbyin par byed do zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyis rdzu 'phrul dang kun brjod pa la sogs pas kun mgu bar byas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid kyis chos sbyin par byed do zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gyis rdzu 'phrul dang kun brjod pa la sogs pas kun mgu bar byas te /
translated: By means of dhyana, one should please others with miracles, predictions, etc.,

original: snod du rung bar byas nas chos ston to //üîΩgnyi gas ni brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: snod du rung bar byas nas chos ston to //üîΩgnyi gas ni brtson 'grus te /
translated: and having made them suitable recipients, one should teach the Dharma.üîΩBoth of them, i.e., dhyana and wisdom, are included in the gift of Dharma.

original: 'di ltar des gnyi ga sbyin par byed do zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i dus dang chos sbyin pa'i dus na brtson 'grus gdon mi za bar yod pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gnyi ga sbyin par byed do zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i dus dang chos sbyin pa'i dus na brtson 'grus gdon mi za bar yod pas so //
translated: Thus, he gives both. At the time of giving fearlessness and at the time of giving the gift of Dharma, he definitely has effort.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad bsdus te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni dge ba'i chos kyi phyogs yin pas de bas na dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad bsdus te zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni dge ba'i chos kyi phyogs yin pas de bas na dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis thams cad bsdus so //
translated: By the morality of gathering virtuous qualities, all of generosity and so forth are included. Thus, the perfections of generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditative stabilization, and wisdom are the side of virtuous qualities. Therefore, by the morality of gathering virtuous qualities, all are included.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pas ni mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dag bsdus te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pas ni mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dag bsdus te /
translated: Similarly, the others should be connected. By the patience of not retaliating against harm, the gifts of fearlessness and morality are included.

original: 'di ltar de gnyis kyis ni gnod par byed pa la mi mjed par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis kyis ni gnod par byed pa la mi mjed par byed do //
translated: Thus, these two make one not recoil from the afflictions.

original: chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pas ni bsam gtan dang shes rab dag bsdus te /
analyzed: chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pas ni bsam gtan dang shes rab dag bsdus te /
translated: The acceptance of the cognition of the teaching includes meditation and wisdom.

original: 'di ltar de @129b gnyis kyi go rims bzhin du sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de @129b gnyis kyi go rims bzhin du sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: Thus, in order, one has correct knowledge just as it is through the mind that is in meditative equipoise.

original: gnyi gas ni brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: gnyi gas ni brtson 'grus te /
translated: Both include effort.

original: 'di ltar des gnyi ga sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gnyi ga sbyin par byed do //
translated: Thus, they both cause one to apply oneself.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni thams cad bsdus so //
translated: Effort includes all,

original: mngon par bsgrub pa dang bya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan gyis kyang thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa dang bya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan gyis kyang thams cad bsdus te /
translated: because one includes all in the meditative absorptions of accomplishment and performance.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dus na nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dus na nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At the time of generosity, etc., one includes all in the meditative absorptions of the sky treasury, etc.

original: shes rab kyis kyang thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis kyang thams cad bsdus te /
translated: Wisdom includes all,

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad nas sbyin pa la sogs pa la rab tu sbyor bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad nas sbyin pa la sogs pa la rab tu sbyor bas so //
translated: because one includes all in the wisdom that is the investigation of generosity, etc.

original: sbyin pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi sbyin pa'i bar yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi sbyin pa'i bar yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The generosity of generosity, the generosity of morality, up to the generosity of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i sbyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the generosity of generosity?

original: gzhan dag la nor dang 'bru la sogs pa'i dngos po sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la nor dang 'bru la sogs pa'i dngos po sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin pa'i sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The generosity of generosity is the giving of material things such as wealth and grain to others.

original: tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi rgyud dag la sdom pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa 'god pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi rgyud dag la sdom pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa 'god pa ste /
translated: The generosity of morality is the establishment of the morality of restraint, etc. in the mindstreams of others.

original: shes rab kyi sbyin pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi sbyin pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The generosity of wisdom should be understood in the same way.

original: yang na de dag dang ldan pa'i chos ston pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na de dag dang ldan pa'i chos ston pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it is the teaching of the Dharma endowed with those.

original: chos nyid kyis rnam par nges pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i don gang dag la mdo la sogs pa snang ba gang dag yin pa dang ; mdo la sogs pa'i chos gang dag la sbyin pa la sogs pa snang ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjod par bya ba bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis rnam par nges pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i don gang dag la mdo la sogs pa snang ba gang dag yin pa dang ; mdo la sogs pa'i chos gang dag la sbyin pa la sogs pa snang ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni phan tshun bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rjod par bya ba bsdus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The ascertainment by nature is that the topics such as generosity are the meaning that appears in the sutras, etc., and the topics such as the sutras are the Dharma that appears in generosity, etc.

original: sbyin pa ni tshul khrims la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /üîΩlongs spyod la mi lta na tshul khrims la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar longs spyod la mi lta na /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni tshul khrims la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te / longs spyod la mi lta na tshul khrims la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar longs spyod la mi lta na /
translated: Generosity is the reason for morality, etc.,üîΩbecause when one does not look at wealth, one engages in morality, etc.

original: tshul khrims kyang yang dag par len la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang yang dag par len la /
translated: Thus, when one does not look at wealth, one also takes up morality.

original: gzhan dag gis phrogs na yang de la mi lta bas bzod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis phrogs na yang de la mi lta bas bzod do //
translated: When it is stolen by others, one endures it without looking at it.

original: longs spyod la kun tu chags pa'i le lo dge ba'i chos rnams la mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de yang mi lta ba la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: longs spyod la kun tu chags pa'i le lo dge ba'i chos rnams la mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de yang mi lta ba la mi 'jug ste /
translated: That is also not engaging in not seeing.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang 'chal ba'i shes rab kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Distraction and faulty wisdom are also like that.

original: tshul khrims kyang sbyin pa la brtson pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te /üîΩdge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par blangs na yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad gtong ba'i phyir dang / tshul khrims @130a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang sbyin pa la brtson pa'i rgyu mtshan yin te / dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par blangs na yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad gtong ba'i phyir dang / tshul khrims @130a * //
translated: Morality is the reason for striving in generosity.üîΩWhen one has taken up the vow of a fully ordained monk, because one gives up all possessions, and because one has patience, etc.

original: la gnas na bzod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa ni gzhan dag las lus dang ngag las byung ba'i mi 'dod pa 'ongs pa thams cad bzod do //
analyzed: la gnas na bzod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa ni gzhan dag las lus dang ngag las byung ba'i mi 'dod pa 'ongs pa thams cad bzod do //
translated: when one is established in morality, the taking up of morality is the patience with regard to all the unwanted things that come up in body and speech from others.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams la spro ba 'phel bar 'gyur zhing 'gyod pa med pa'i rim gyis sems rtse gcig pa nyid du yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams la spro ba 'phel bar 'gyur zhing 'gyod pa med pa'i rim gyis sems rtse gcig pa nyid du yang 'gyur la /
translated: When one has taken up morality, one increases the delight in virtuous practices, and in due course, one becomes free from regret and one-pointed in mind.

original: de nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang yongs su shes so //
analyzed: de nas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang yongs su shes so //
translated: Then one comes to know reality as it is.

original: bzod pa dang ldan pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dus na nyes par smras shing mi snyan par gyur pa'i tshig gi lam dang brdegs pa la sogs pa thams cad bzod do //
analyzed: bzod pa dang ldan pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dus na nyes par smras shing mi snyan par gyur pa'i tshig gi lam dang brdegs pa la sogs pa thams cad bzod do //
translated: One who is patient endures all the unpleasant words and blows, etc. that occur when one is practicing generosity, etc.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims mnyam pa yin zhing brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin pa sems rtse gcig pa nyid las yongs su 'thob pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims mnyam pa yin zhing brtson 'grus dang ldan pa yin pa sems rtse gcig pa nyid las yongs su 'thob pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Similarly, one who is morally disciplined, one who is diligent, and one who is one-pointed in mind, obtains all the perfections.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan dang shes rab kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply this method to diligence, meditation, and wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the perfections is completed.

original: // / pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu bsdu ba'i dngos po'i skabs yin te /
analyzed: // / pha rol tu phyin pa'i skabs kyi 'og tu bsdu ba'i dngos po'i skabs yin te /
translated: The chapter on the perfections is followed by the chapter on the means of gathering,

original: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the connection?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin pas rang gi don to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin pas rang gi don to //
translated: The bodhisattva's application to the perfections is for his own benefit, since it brings about the completion of the qualities of the Buddha.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The means of gathering are for the benefit of others.

original: de'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po'i skabs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po'i skabs te /
translated: Therefore, the chapter on the means of gathering follows the chapter on the perfections.

original: bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhis gzhan gyi don byed do //üîΩsbyin mtshungs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsdu pa'i dngos po bzhis gzhan gyi don byed do // sbyin mtshungs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One benefits others through the four means of gathering.üîΩThere is no generosity equal to that of the bodhisattva, much less a greater one.

original: grangs dang de'i mtshan nyid go rims dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad du bstan pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: grangs dang de'i mtshan nyid go rims dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji skad du bstan pa lta bu yin no //
translated: This is as stated in the verse: Generosity, morality, patience, vigor,üîΩDhyana, and wisdom,üîΩIn order, are the six perfections.üîΩThe others are not equal to even a sixteenth part of this.üîΩService to the aims is causing them to take it up.

original: don spyod pa ni de yang dag par len du 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par len du 'jug pa ni don spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don spyod pa ni de yang dag par len du 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par len du 'jug pa ni don spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Service to the aims is causing others to take up the perfections.

original: de la bdag nyid rjes su 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gang la gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa de nyid la bstan par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyang 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: de la bdag nyid rjes su 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa gang la gzhan yang dag par len du 'jug pa de nyid la bstan par bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyang 'jug pa yin /
translated: One should engage in them oneself means that one should engage in generosity and so on oneself in order to inspire others to take them up.

original: de ltar na de dag sbyin pa la sogs pa la brtan por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag sbyin pa la sogs pa la brtan por 'gyur te /
translated: Thus they are firm in generosity and so on.

original: 'di ltar gang la bdag cag btsud pa de nyid la bdag nyid kyang 'jug pa dang sbyar na 'di ni bdag cag la slu bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la bdag cag btsud pa de nyid la bdag nyid kyang 'jug pa dang sbyar na 'di ni bdag cag la slu bar byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If we are engaged in what the teacher engages in, he is not deceiving us.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa 'di ni gdon mi za bar bzang ngo snyam du sems so //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa 'di ni gdon mi za bar bzang ngo snyam du sems so //
translated: This generosity and so on is certainly good.

original: don mthun pas ni yun ring por sgrub pa'i @130b phyir ;
analyzed: don mthun pas ni yun ring por sgrub pa'i @130b phyir ;
translated: By practicing what one preaches, one accomplishes the aims of others for a long time.
